Reviews.Title: “Best of the best”
Reviews.Author: mlb1613
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a palace in a private island, while entering to its well maintained garden you will be in an other world watching the flowers, trees and rabbits!! Then comes the beautifully designed hotel and hotel rooms which i think all have beautiful locations, even though it costs 60 euros from the train station to the hotel by boat its realy worth it especially in venice where i feel taking a hotel in the middle of venice is a bit uncomfortable!! The hotel provides you with a shuttle i think every 20 minutes which would take you to the centre FREE!! The rooms are extremely nice and clean. The burger in the bar is a piece of art

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel”
Reviews.Author: IanSvenson
Reviews.Content: This hotel is 'fantastico'. The staff are very friendly and good at their job. We never felt anything was too much trouble and the food was the best we had in Venice. Overall a great hotell

Reviews.Title: “EASTER BREAK”
Reviews.Author: David C
Reviews.Content: This hotel is on a private island just off Venice which is great position when site seeing Venice. I visited this hotel last year and it was great 9.5 out of 10. This year it was not so good 7.5 out of 10. The second restaurant was closed as was the pool,which was not acceptable considering the room rate.The second restaurant is very good and the service is excellent .Choice on the menu is good.(Very expensive).The breakfast is good with a plenty of choice,however attend early as you may have to wait for a table if you arrive between 9.00 to 10.00am.Spa is very good and the staff are very helpful.The gardens are well maintained and are very nice to walk around after a busy day in Venice (Take plenty money you will need it).

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, few tweaks would make it excellent”
Reviews.Author: KPnorthlondon
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights at San Clemente Palace in Venice. The hotel is very spacious and peaceful, which is a real relief after the crazy crowds in Venice. If you want a luxurious hotel in striking distance of Venice but not in the centre this is ideal - but for the prices charged a few changes would have made it even better. Staff are helpful and courteous. The breakfast is delicious with a wide range of choice of hot and cold food but a pity the decaf on offer only nescafe instant. I agree with other reviews about the bar prices - once on the island for the night you are a captive audience, and 7 euros for a small bottle of still mineral water is excessive as are the bar snacks - 27 euros for a simple hamburger with chips that are cold due to the distance from the kitchen. We would have eaten in and ordered more drinks if the prices had been more reasonable. Chamber maids are erratic, not cleaning rooms till after 4pm and coming back an hour later to do a turn down, not taking away dirty glasses. The rooms are otherwise very clean and bathrooms lovely - but stuffy without air conditioning in April. Only English TV is CNN or Fox news, so not great for UK residents. Restaurant is excellent, high quality cuisine but also pricey. The shuttle service is very reliable and regular, with trips from early in the morning till very late at night. We enjoyed the spa and steam room but the pool was closed.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, wonderful location, amazing food”
Reviews.Author: aterri
Reviews.Content: After a long analysis of all 5 stars hotel, I choice for San Clemente Palace. I did a great choice. It is a private island, 7 minutes by free of charge private boat to San Marco place. Food was excellent also for a sophisticated italian like me. I selected the junior suite with San Marco view and it was amazing. The private park with small white rabbis is a jewel. Strongly recommended to avoid humidity and narrow spaces of downtowon venice hotels. ambrogio

Reviews.Title: “Great value on a BA deal”
Reviews.Author: sherman49
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a long weekend at the beginning of April, and would thoroughly recommend this hotel. First impressions were that it was quite a formal. traditional place but the service was friendly, there was a real mix of people staying and it felt very comfortable. The room was extremely quiet (we were upgraded, had a view over the front gardens) and a welcome change from the bustle of the main island - it was a relief to catch the shuttle from St Marks Square. Breakfast was excellent and served until 11am, allowing a proper lie in. We paid way under the rack rate on a BA flight/hotel package, therefore excellent value. Make sure you take water/soft drinks/wine/beer as the mini bar prices were hilarious - 7 euros for a Diet Coke - and the restaurant is hugely expensive so we didn't eat here. But we had drinks in the bar and it wasn't extortionate. Overall, a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “very huge but quite”
Reviews.Author: Sanaz M
Reviews.Content: we were there for 2 nights. very nice complex , very huge and very clean. the only complain i would make is there is no night life in such a big hotel. no outside restaurant in March, no light musin in bar and even breakfast area. at least a piano. in corridors to reach to rooms, they can do better decoration like flowers.it is very nude and empty with colours.so if you add becomes more warm. Breakfast hall is small compare to huge building and very less veraity compare to other 5 stars hotels in been too and the number of people who are working in breakfast hall is not enough. they are running but still there are so much left to do. and no slippers in the room. but i mostly concern about night life in hotel such as light music or someone plays piano. or outdoor restaurant. but i go back there for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: bodus65
Reviews.Content: In this hotel everything is perfect, from the transportation from Piazza San Marco to the island, up to the reception, to the location, to the room and the service. The restaurant is not so fantastic, but the cadre forgive it, a fantastic old church to visit and rabbits in the gardens are making of it a dream destination. Please take an aperitif in the small harbor, it is simply amazing

Reviews.Title: “Cavernous hotel that is anti-service out of season”
Reviews.Author: PandEKew
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a business meeting this week. The hotel is actually an old women's asylum that resonates as the rooms are deep with just one, slender window, lovely marble bathrooms and quality furniture. My room was placed on the very far side of the hotel, with no view and no air-con - despite it being a very hot March and the rooms had no ventilation. I was informed that the aircon only comes on in May - I left my window open and was plagued by mosquitos!!! Not good enough. The food was good, very expensive - â‚¬48 for two course lunch (club sandwich and tiramisu). Service was great, though late dinners and bar tabs were held reluctantly, as staff seemed to want to go home. Overall, I just believe there are better value hotels in Venice itself - this is 15mins away from the main island and though a beautiful island the service was just not up to a 5 star hotel - off season or otherwise - I was disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “The only place to stay for spring in Venice!”
Reviews.Author: Kate G
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 5 nights at the San Clemente Palace Hotel with my mother - it was a belated birthday celebration and was more than perfect in every way. Checking in: First of all we took a taxi to the hotel from the airport - this costs 120euros but is really the only way to arrive in Venice - splash out! We arrived at the hotel, I felt very tired and was wearing my 'comfy-flying-on-a-plane' clothes so wondered how we would be greeted keeping in mind this is a 5* hotel. I needn't have worried - the boat concierge was delightful and our luggage was swept up and we slowly walked into the hotel taking in the atmosphere of the breath-taking island in the evening spring sunshine. Inside the receptionist was very pleasant and gave us a timetable of the shuttle to San Marco. She then showed us to our room - we were upgraded to a junior suite on the 3rd floor over looking the entrance path. The room was vast yet very comfortable, luxurious and warm. Our luggage arrived about 10 minutes after we did which had given us enough time to explore the room. One point I feel I must make for ALL hotels I have stayed in in Italy - if you are British/American, don't expect there to be a kettle in the room - it just doesn't happen here. I don't see it as a problem at all - I am on holiday, in another country, please deal with it and stop whining! The bar: On our first night we had cocktails in 'Gli Specchi' American Bar. They were divine and were served with a variety of olives, nuts and crisps. Other reviewers have commented on the expense but I think for the treats that come with them, the service, the surroundings and the quality - I happily paid 28 euros for 2 drinks! 'Le Maschere' restaurant: Because of the time of year that we visited, this was the main restaurant open at the hotel. We ate here two nights because the food was so delicious. Both times the receipt was very acceptable for the quality of the service and food - I thought it was almost too cheap in comparison to a number of other restaurants in Venice! At the end of our first meal on the first night we were both given two small bouquets of flowers which was lovely. After our second meal we were given a small tray of traditional biscuits, compliments of the chef. It really went beyond 5* service! The shuttle/boats: We took the shuttle everyday to Venice - it was very convenient and never full. It was a smooth ride to a private launch in San Marco which was very easy to find. We also took a private boat to Murano - we were advised by the boat concierge that this was always on standby. He also arranged for us to go to a gallery which offered private glass blowing tours to guests of certain hotels - it was fantastic! The Island: we were very lucky that the weather every day was perfection - blue skies and warm sun. The island is bliss to walk around, with an old church to explore and very large bunnies (which you must not disturb) who are cuteness personified! It is a spectacular location. The hotel: Some people have commented on the hotel feeling like the set of The Shining - all I can say is it is a shame. I felt like I was walking around a royal palace. Considering the history of the building (monastery to institution) they have made it into a fantastic hotel - you wouldn't know about its history without reading it. The corridors are long, yes, but my gosh - what a feeling you get being able to stay there! Spa: We requested a couple of treatments at the spa. The day we went, it was very understaffed but this wasn't an issue for us. We had booked in and the lady was wonderful. I had a manicure and facial and then was offered a cup of green tea whilst my mother had a massage. It was fantastic! Breakfast: The one thing I love about Italy is breakfast! The hotel breakfast didn't disappoint - so much choice! So yummy! The service was great, you were shown to your seat and offered coffee. You then serve yourself at the buffet which had everything under the sun you could think of! The perfect way to start the day! This is an incredible hotel and by far the best place to spend a luxurious and relaxing holiday in Venice. Yes - it might be a bit of a 'one off' holiday for most but it is worth every last cent!

Reviews.Title: “Pure Bliss”
Reviews.Author: Matt B
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, has great historic background. Magnificent property and great rooms.

Reviews.Title: “San Clemente Palace - Depends on what you want”
Reviews.Author: Amir190311
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 3 nights during March and i am not able to make my mind up about this place, it has so much going for it yet it has some little things going against it, you want to go back yet you do not know why. It is an expensive hotel so you expect world class service, the complementary shuttle boat to Samarco is great and always on time and gives you time to relax before going back to the hotel or when going the other way and socialise with fellow visitors. The room was comfortable and clean and we had chosen a classic room, it has everything you need but some of the things go against it for example there is now view (we were told rooms with views are limited) it is on an island!! the windows are quite small for the hotel size, the wireless is expensive which for a 5 star hotel is very strange, there is hardly any English channels on the TV which sometimes you want to watch before you sleep or in the morning or even the afternoon when you are relaxing and getting ready for an evening out. The hotel restaurant is quite good when you get to it as the signs are not very clear. On the positive side the hotel looks fantastic, the gardens, the pool and the reception area are beautiful, the staff is very friendly and helpful. The room decoration is very elegant and quite spacious so as you can see i still can't make my mind up!

Reviews.Title: “Tranquil lovely location in bustling Venice”
Reviews.Author: Cdneurotravel
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 5 day stay here. Grounds very nice, though pool closed. There is a small 3 hole golf course I was told. Rooms spacious and well appointed. I had a standard room and had a dinner meeting with room service and it was very comfortable. Food was also very positive. Drinking Campari on the dock over looking Venice a great experience. (drinks can be pricey) You feel like Bond as they shuttle you into Venice on their speed boat. A nice 2-3 day visit if your in Europe

Reviews.Title: “Away from the crowds!”
Reviews.Author: mzmolly49
Reviews.Content: A lovely, separate island, away from the Venetian crowds, lies an old monastery, now a luxurious, 5 star hotel. San Clemente Palace welcomes its guests at the dock, where they handle your luggage and see you to your room personally. We had a corner Jr. Suite that overlooked Venice and the sunset across the island, complete with a large, well appointed bathroom with both a shower and a tub. The room, bathroom and closet space are reminicent of luxury hotels in times past. The staff is very friendly, speak English easily, and are helpful in every way. There is a lovely, elegant bar that serves snacks and sandwiches, as well as a dining room. Breakfast is included. A very nice hotel shuttle boat runs between the hotel and Venice - San Marco square - every 20 - 40 minutes. It is about a 10 minute ride, and enables you to see Venice in ways you couldn't if staying there. San Clemente Palace is a beautifully decorated, well maintained hotel that certainly deserves its 5 star rating.

Reviews.Title: “A unique place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Pokcon
Reviews.Content: Venice was our last stop to our European holiday and staying at the San Clemente Palace was the perfect final destination. We were very impressed by each and every ride between the island and St Marks Square as the view was always beautiful at various times of the day. (However it was very hard to find the shuttle stop initially after arriving into Venice). The island is very secluded and private but the grounds are very grand and well maintained - we loved the gardens where we caught glimpses of their resident bunnies. Our room was on the 2nd floor but given the size of the hotel we had to walk a long way to our room. Buffet breakfast was indulgent. We only wish we could stay longer to use some of their facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for couples.”
Reviews.Author: spicydiamond
Reviews.Content: Need privacy, quietness and some space? San Clemente Palace is just what we need to spend our Valentine Day. Unfortunately lot of outdoors activities are closed on wintertime and the schedules of their private shuttle boat are limited too. Their breakfast buffet is really something not-to-be-missed!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel in Venetian lagoon......easy access to St Mark's”
Reviews.Author: bhare
Reviews.Content: The people at the San Clemente Palace went out of their way to assit us on our recent stay.....we had to go to the local hospital (fractured ribs from a fall prior to arrival at the hotel) and the staff arranged private water taxi service to the hospital and back.....monitiored our progress while we were at the hospital for over seven hours......and gave us excelllent service during our entire stay....our room was upgraded at no extra cost....dinner in the restaurant was outstanding...delightful bar for evening cocktails....easy access to St Mark's by their own complementary water taxi.......what a fabulous place.....will not stay anywhere else again when in Venice........

Reviews.Title: “The most gorgeous hotel”
Reviews.Author: hbotis
Reviews.Content: I dream about staying here again next time I'm in Venice. This is a truly gorgeous, tranquil, 5 star hotel you ever want. A hotel with corridors that larger than most rooms you ever stayed in. Love it to bits.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning in every aspect.”
Reviews.Author: MaggieSummerville123
Reviews.Content: San Clemente Palace is a stunning hotel on a private island in Venice. From St. Mark's Square the hotel's lovely wooden boat takes you to the property. The grounds are stunning, although it was cold when we went so the pool was closed and the gardens were not in bloom. The room was beautifully furnished and the bathroom was exquisite. The breakfast was 5 star. The staff was superb, especially the concierge. We were able to leave our luggage on the last day of our trip and return for it in the afternoon. The boat runs from early morning to late night so it is very easy to get back and forth to St. Marks. ***We made our reservation on Hotels.com and it was substantially less expensive than the hotel's own site**. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Private island in Venice”
Reviews.Author: RGiddey
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights, had a suite on the top level, incredibly high ceilings, felt a little remote at first but their ferry service to st marks etc was always available Ontime and pleasant. They had some fantastic wines in their cellar had a Chateau Margaux with our amazing meal. French champagne on ice when we arrived, whole honeymoon booked by Amex Centruion and all their choices where amazing. Be wary of the glass tours.. Experience was great we went to but some custom champagne flutes however ended up spending abou 40,000â‚¬. Have to say we love what we purchased thought.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: B3thany
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the San Clemente following our wedding in Ravello on the Amalfi coast. We had spent the previous week with our family and friends which was wonderful but very busy and we wanted to spend some time relaxing. However, we're not 'beach' people and wanted somewhere we could explore and see the sights as well as lounge by the pool, for this, the San Clemente is perfect. You are no more than a 15 minute boat ride from the island of Venice which is a service offered free by the hotel. For us, riding across the lagoon watching the sunset after a busy day sightseeing was the icing on the cake and never got old. The grounds of the hotel are well worth a wander around as is an afternoon spent by the pool both offering a tranquil retreat from the bustling city. The hotel is grand and elegant with sweeping staircases and never ending corridors. Our deluxe room was wonderful and spacious with views over the lagoon towards Venice and like the rest of the hotel it was immaculate. The staff were beyond helpful and polite particularly the lovely staff at the spa which is another must visit. There is a wide range on offer at breakfast and the prosecco made it just a bit more special. Dinner at the 'Le Maschere' restaurant is out of this world, I highly recommend the dessert simply entitled 'chocolate'. You can also have drinks and bar food out on the pier which is an amazing place to sit and watch the sunset. This is an old fashioned 5 star hotel with impeccable service amongst luxurious surroundings but do expect to pay handsomely for it. Food and drink are very expensive as are spa treatments and extras. In my opinion its worth every penny for a truly memorable stay.

Reviews.Title: “5-Star Comfort”
Reviews.Author: Walker222
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a converted palace on a private island. The rooms are large, the corridors longer than a football pitch. The staff are quiet, respectful and 100% bilingual, with all staff speaking excellent English. The gardens are quiet and overlook the waters and there is a private and exclusive motor launch service that takes one from the hotel to the mainland. Breakfast was the usual self-help menu found in every good hotel, with one exception, they had the very rare to find, coffee flavoured yoghurt. Wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Old-elegance formal, glorious but 21 euros for a G&T!”
Reviews.Author: skiimprover
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the San Clemente as part of a corporate trip. I think the hotel is an old hospital or institution, and it covers the whole small island and so everything is extremely spacious... the windows in our room must have been 15 feet tall, very high ceilings and corridors and a fabulous, marble sweeping double staircase on each floor, which made me want to don a ballgown! It is grand in a formal, faded kind of way, in keeping with Venice itself and has lovely walks around the grounds. It's appeal is exactly the fact that it IS a Venetian hotel - a bland 'corporate' type hotel in Venice would just kill the point of being in this stunning city. The bar is beautiful (have a Bellini cocktail from Omar in his white tux) but beware the prices!! As you're on a small island ie: no other choice, 21 euros for 1 gin and tonic meant that we took the boat over to Venice itself (15 min trip), though that is also dear. The hotel bar also closed at 1am when our group were still in full swing. Food-wise, we ate as a corporate trip so not sure if the food was it's usual standard or not - it was only very average. In terms of location, some people love the fact that the hotel is on an island by itself and therefore quiet and very spacious. Others said they would prefer to be in Venice itself. There is a beautiful shuttle boat (think shining wood and cream leather) which travels to and fro from St Marks square (takes 15 mins - gorgeous views of Venice en-route - personally, we felt this was part of the thrill of the experience), from 6am - 2am. Venice itself is spectacular - if going again, I'd probably consider staying in Venice itself if you got the same hotel character and authenticity. Finally, we went in November, blue skies, sun, stunning, need a coat. I'd recommend this time of year as it was bustling but not packed - I believe the summer is crazy busy. Worth a trip up the Campanile tower (the main tower in St Marks square) for the views.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel on Private Island”
Reviews.Author: Gurler
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in the June of 2011 for about a week. We chose a suite room as we travelled with our 3 year old. The room was very spacious, nicely decorated, clean. The hotels location was excellent, and provided the much needed breathing space after sight seeing in overcrowded Venice. The pool is a big luxury. Although it was not heated and our daughter found it too cold to swim in. The food was nice with a choice of restaurants. The major problem with this hotel was that it was understaffed. We ended up waiting at least 10mins for ordering food, asking a question at the reception or anything that required communication with a staff, while watching them running around trying to do their best. A second problem was that the pool side restaurant stopped serving food at 5 and then the restaurants did not open until 7-730. The only choice was the room service, at our daughters usual dinner time which was at 6-630.

Reviews.Title: “"Worth Every Penny"”
Reviews.Author: John M
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed in the San Clemente for 3 nights in early September. Right from the start the staff were extremely helpful in my correspondence concerning the new City Tax. Once we were arrived they continued to make every effort to make our stay as enjoyable as possible and I found them extremely friendly and polite. The hotel and grounds are very impressive and immaculate. We stayed in a Junior Deluxe Suite (which was beautiful, spacious and had a lovely view of the lagoon), as part of the "Secluded Love" package. The extra for the package is a small amount to pay compared to the price paying for all its extras singly. Included was a candlelight dinner for two in the â€œLe Maschereâ€� Restaurant. Again the service was excellent and the food perfect and presented exquisitely. Breakfast was also included and it there was a wide selection that was regularly topped up as items began to run low. Lastly for anyone that visits I would highly recommend the Spa facilities. Exploring the many hidden backstreets of Venice can be hard on your feet but an hour in the jacuzzi followed by a massage in a relaxing setting had us ready to go again. Loved every minute of our stay and although it isn't cheap it was worth every penny. We will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “A Perfect Haven for Peace”
Reviews.Author: Bazrat92
Reviews.Content: Absolutely loved this hotel and the fact it is selcuded on its own island and away from the hustle and bustle of central Venice. Catching the boat back and forth to Venice is a joy and the silence that greets you when you step off the boat at the island is perfect. The rooms are clean and comfortable. The breakfast buffet was excellent and the actual building itself and the ruined church is quite beautiful. This is definitely a hotel to which I would like to return.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: George M
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights at the San Clemente to celebrate our 25th wedding anniversary. The hotel is very impressive and the staff wonderfully attentive. Everyone we dealt with, from the front desk to the concierge and the restaurant staff, were friendly, helpful and there when you needed them, and they made our stay memorable. The room was lovely, with views from two sides across the lagoon to St. Mark's Square. The food and service in the restaurant was excellent, and this helped to make it such a pleasant experience. The private shuttle was always on time and reliable. The only downside for us was the spa, which was one of the main reasons we chose the hotel. It was closed for the day on our first day there, and also on our third and final day, and on the second day we couldn't have treatments as the only masseuse was unwell that day. I appreciate that it was late November and hence out of season, but if the spa is supposed to be open it needs to provide a proper service with sufficient staff. It would also have been good if the boutique could have been opened for at least an hour a day.

Reviews.Title: “An Island and a Peace of your own,in a Palace........”
Reviews.Author: tony d
Reviews.Content: The San Clemente used to be the stopping off place for ambassadors and dignitaries from all over the world when visiting the Doge in Venice.It was a palace and an abbey then.Now it is a sublime place to visit for it's own understated qualities - not just as an hotel.......... A complimentary shuttle motor boat service gives wonderful and ,if needed,late night access to the heart of the City.The accomodation,service and cuisine are exactly what you would require from a top class five star hotel.The rooms are sumptuous and the corridors so big and wide,airy and exciting - you could play cricket there! The hotel gardens are exquisite and populated by white rabbits with great personalities - Alice in Wonderland!!!!!!!!!! The only way to understand this hotel is to do the research on the web and talk to others. Like many of the very best hotels ,quality comes before price considerations,but the winter deals are good - remember to think about it at Carnivale in February,when my beloved Venice becomes totally magical. T.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Place”
Reviews.Author: dunfion39
Reviews.Content: This hotel is truly magnificent.We were booked into it following a cruise and I was unsure at first as it seemed quite far out from St Mark's .However , it only takes 12 minutes by the hotel's private taxi to cross the lagoon to St Marks.The taxi runs every 40 minutes - dead on time and with a minimum of effort. The reward is that you have a private island for the hotel , with beautiful walks , outdoor pool and little pitch and putt course.It must be wonderful in spring and summer - pity I was there in November, but even that was lovely. The bedrooms are huge and the staff very friendly and helpful - not at all stand offish like some other hotels in Venice!The food is expensive - but after all this is Venice and on an island of its own.I would go back tomorrow if I could!

Reviews.Title: “Loved San Clemente!”
Reviews.Author: Kaykkenk
Reviews.Content: San Clemente Hotel and Spa was great. It took me one day to figure out all of the different passages and exciting places to go from San Clemente. There was a free water taxi shuttle to San Marco which was very helpful. The Customer Service was extremely polite and the restaurant was exquisite (I went to breakfast and lunch). There was free Wifi if you collect the password. I had to leave at 4:00am to go to the airport but San Clemente reserved a water taxi for us to go straight to the airport. It was exquisite!!! We also asked for Murano and Burano transits and they helped us there too. Very helpful and polite. When I was staying there, I was using the free Wifi to look up the history when I found something quite disturbing (which made the hotel lose 1 star in my review). According to many history sites, San Clemente used to be a great monastery on the amazing island but it turned in to a lunatic asylum. The amazing hotel/spa/resort was on it's very own island which explained the asylum/monastery part. Although that is very creepy, I still recommend it. I had a very fun time with my friends. We'll definitely go back to Venice and stay at San Clemente. When I was there, Madonna had reserved a few floors at the top! That's how great the hotel was! The great Madonna stayed there! That proves how great the place is!

Reviews.Title: “Memorable Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ontario_Canada_Jane
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel as part of a tour of Italy. It is a very luxurious (and huge!) hotel. We were a group of 3 on the tour, and we were booked into the spacious junior suite on the first floor which had a very comfortable double bed and a cot. The rooms have vaulted ceilings and even a doorbell! Our bathroom had a shower, a tub, a heated towel rack, and very lovely shampoos and shower products. Our room was very clean. The boat shuttle from the hotel to the main island was fun and was appreciated. We ate dinner in the hotel bar one night; we ordered the club sandwich with fries and the ham and cheese sandwich with chips. The food was a little pricey, but it was so delicious and it was a fun experience. We split the 2 orders between 3 people and we were full! The waiter (who was really nice) also brought us chips and mixed nuts to snack on while we were waiting for our food. We weren't rushed at all by the waiter, and he was very accommodating when a bunch of our tour friends came to sit with us. The breakfast was the best out of all of the places that we stayed at on our tour, and it included various pastries, cheeses, juices, amazing yogurt in glass jars, fruit, hot foods, etc. Note to Canadians/Americans: the hot chocolate is not sweetened, so it tastes very different from what we are used to! Little touches were greatly appreciated, such as putting out water and apples for hotel clients in the afternoon and having free internet access. The hotel also made a call for us to the main island to check on the availability of opera tickets. The hotel would be a little pricey for us to stay at if we were not on the tour, but they offered us a discount on the room rate if we wanted to extend our stay after our tour ended, which was extremely nice. A great experience! For those tourists who get the tax refund for spending a certain amount of money in one store, there is a place right in St. Mark's Square where you can get the refund. Watch out for pickpockets in St. Mark's Square; someone tried to steal our friend's water bottle!

Reviews.Title: “An Oasis in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Domperignon59
Reviews.Content: This was our 3rd stay at San Clemente, still the biggest standard rooms and the best deals on Junior Suites in Venice, a minor problem with the plumbing in our bathroom was efficiently solved by the excellent front desk manager. Breakfast was ok,the short transfer to San Marco every 20 minutes a pleasant mini-cruise.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place”
Reviews.Author: Daniela M
Reviews.Content: We stayed twice at the San Clemente Palace and really liked the property and its location. The Hotel is nice, spacious and service was very friendly and helpful. We stayed in a family suite, which was great. The churchgard is the perfect place for a drink and the park is even in autum very nice for a walk. The short boat-ride (about 12 minutes) to San Marco was enjoyable. The breakfast was served in a nice room and quite good for italien standarts. The only contra about the hotel - from our experience- was the room service. That was actually a desaster- so I would not recommend ordering anything from the roomservice.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: norm5Seattle
Reviews.Content: Based on previous tripadvisor reviews I was anticipating a hotel with surly staff, but was pleasantly surprised that the staff was quite cordial, helpful, and friendly. The hotel is a quiet oasis from the hordes of tourists in Piazza San Marco. Loved the large rooms and well appointed bathrooms. The little complimentary boat ride back and forth from the Piazza was actually enjoyable. Concierge service was exemplary. They efficiently got us an earlier train back to Milan. The breakfast spread was quite good. My only concern is the high food prices which deter guests from eating dinner at the hotel - cheaper to get good food in the city. Prices for dinner at the hotel are consistent with a two or three star Michelin restaurant, a rating I don't believe the hotel has. All in all, though an enjoyable stay. Would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “A spooky experience . . . . .”
Reviews.Author: Hummingbirds35
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed two nights at the San Clemente Palace while visiting Venice with a Globus Tour. This hotel is huge -- but when we were staying there it was nearly empty. I understand it is more filled during the peak of the summer season, while we were into the fall. One criticism I had was that the desk gave us rooms at the extreme other end of this huge hotel. It was a very long walk plus an elevator ride to reach the lobby. This was bewildering, since very few rooms were occupied and rooms much closer to the lobby were surely available. Late in the evening as we returned to the hotel and walked to our room, the total emptiness of the place gave us a creepy feeling. We compared it to the hotel in the movie "The Shining." When we checked into our room, a shelf on the wall close to our room had dirty dishes, bottles and glasses stacked on it. The next day at lunchtime, those dirty dishes were still there. Where was the staff? We wanted to eat at the hotel, but a glance at the menu showed us that a hamburger cost 27.5 Euros, or about $35 in American money. The main menu for the sit-down restaurant did not have a single entree for less than 33 Euros, with some much more. The salad course had to be ordered separately at outrageous prices. An unopened bottle of wine disappeared from our room. It was noticed right after the maids cleaned the room. My wife ran down the hall to question the maids, but they just played dumb. We think they must have taken it, but have no proof. In favor of the hotel, they did have a computer hooked up to the internet free for guests to use. It was a very impressive edifice, with free water taxi service to St Marks' Square. Even so, we were glad to get out of the place.

Reviews.Title: “A Hotel of complete luxury”
Reviews.Author: LoveNiceThings
Reviews.Content: A fantastic truely 5 star hotel. The hotel is set about 10-15 mins away from St Marks square on its own island. The hotel offers a free boat service every 20 mins back and forth to the square. The hotel was built in the 1100 and was originally a monestary which is evident by the peace and tranquility that you get as soon as you walk into the hotel. The ceilings are very high and the corridors are as wide as a two lane road!! The rooms are beautifully decorated and the bathrooms have baths with seperate shower cubicles. The breakfast is amazing and will really set you up for the day. The staff were exceptionally friendly and extremely helpful. Because the hotel is on its own island it is a bit of a chore to get back on the boat to get back to the main square just to look for a restaurant to eat especially if the weather isn't great. We found that we ate in the hote. The food was fabulous with service to match. A great fine dining experience. The second night we decided we fancied something less formal and so opted to eat in the bar which was the only other choice in the winter months. We had salads to start followed by burger and chips sitting on sofa's at a coffee table. All was lovely except it cost the same as sitting in the restaurant so not really value. I wouldnt stay anywhere else! We requested an early check in and had 3 rooms. All were ready on our arrival.

Reviews.Title: “The end to a perfect cruise aboard Sea Cloud II”
Reviews.Author: professorcooke_11
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this unique location on October 13th and 14th 2011 at the end of a fabulous cruise on the 3-masted windjammer sailing ship Sea Cloud II. The hotel is situated on a private island in the lagoon reached only by motor launch. The hotel has at least two private launches for residents which operate a regular complimentary shuttle service between the island and St Mark's Square, journey time around 15 minutes. The hotel was apparently a monastery and consequently the rooms and adjoining corridors are very well proportioned. The hotel was very clean and quiet, the only sound being that of the water of the surrounding lagoon. The hotel is set in extensive well-maintained gardens with a superb outdoor swimming pool and private dock for the hotel's launches which operate on a 24-hour basis. The hotel may also be reached by high speed water taxis which connect directly with the airport. The deal included a superb breakfast each morning but the planned dinner in the hotel was aborted by Noble Caledonia, the tour operators, on the basis of an apparent increase in catering costs over that agreed and a mislaid dinner booking for the group by the hotel. This is a very expensive hotel and the price charged for drinks in the bar can be eye-watering. This was a fitting end to an unforgettable cruise aboard the superb Sea Cloud II from Malta to Venice which called into Croatia and Slovenia before reaching Venice in the early morning.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Alternative”
Reviews.Author: bedelia13
Reviews.Content: We stayed here after other hotels in Venice were fully booked. I was pleasantly surprised by the size, quality and cleanliness of the room. We had a family suite and it was enormous enough for me and my 3 boys to be very comfortable. Fresh beautiful lilies in the room were a nice touch. We loved the tall and open hallways; and the spacious grounds were a welcome relief from busy Venice and were so quiet for sleeping. The complimentary shuttle was convenient (every 20 minutes) and fun for the kids without paying touristy gondola prices. Breakfast was very good with nice variety and quality. Dinner food quality was fine, service was good and they were kid-friendly. The concierge was helpful and friendly too. On the down side, the wi-fi was only in the lobby, which was inconvenient. The coffee took too long to arrive when ordered it at breakfast. The drain in our shower was slow and so the water built up around your feet. The bellhop never came for our bags and so we had to carry them out ourselves to not miss the taxi. But overall, the good outweighs the bad, and I would definitely consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very quiet location”
Reviews.Author: ghegedus
Reviews.Content: Lovely location on an island. Takes 10 minutes to Piazza San Marco by shuttle boat. A taxi from the airport to the hotel for up to four people will cost 120 Euros. Hotel restaurant is good, not great. The tagliatelli with white truffels was way below expectations. The rooms are of good size compared to other hotels in Venice. On a future visit would not stay in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A disappointment”
Reviews.Author: flossiesussex
Reviews.Content: I expected an island palace & got a converted hospital, workhouse building except for the entrance. The longest corridors immaginable with poorly designed lift lobbies do not add to the attraction. Our room looked over a working courtyard to the lagoon & Venice BUT the windows are so high there's no way you can sit & look out or see from the bed. The room was clean but absolutely no extras, not even water. Breakfast was good enough but the service wasn't up to much & tea was a pot of warm not boiling water & a tea bag, the same when ordered by the pool at the cost of 9euros. Mini bar prices were ludicrous, the result was we had no extras. This cannot be to the hotel's advantage. The staff were few & far between & with the exception of the concierge unfriendly or surly. Altogether an unpleasant hotel with avery poor atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Not as it should be”
Reviews.Author: worldtravellers051
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights for our wedding anniversary in mid October. The grounds and the building were very beautiful and our deluxe room was lovely. The staff were helpful although like most large hotels in Italy they were a little surly at times but thatâ€™s nothing unusual for staff in this type of place. The real problem here was the same thing that seems to go on in so many large hotels these days. They offer guests an impressive selection of bars and restaurants then decide to close them all as the visitor numbers drop when a week or so out of high season but still advertise them when you make your booking. The net result is that you choose a hotel which is a 15 minute boat ride from the main area of Venice in the mistaken belief you have plenty of options for food and drink when you return. Further more I suggest guests forget the spa as we were unable to get any form of treatments in the entire three days as their staffing levels in the spa were so low. Basically this meant the spa facilities did not exist for us either. Lastly their restaurant! This was nowhere near good enough Iâ€™m affraid, â€œJuicy porkâ€� as described on the menu was just a joke, completely dry for me and some other guests who ordered it and were complaining. Never the less they managed to charge the same high prices as the other much superior restaurants we visited within Venice its self. All in all there are two many disappointing issues with this hotel to ever go back and potential visitors should be aware what they are really getting is not as advertised. Lastly the fact that not was single review has been responded to by the management on what is the worldâ€™s largest review site tells you the overall attitude the management of this hotel have towards their guests. Be warned!

Reviews.Title: “I was frightened”
Reviews.Author: mia049
Reviews.Content: Ok now your all thinking drama queen - I did not know anything about the history - I truely believed the hotel used to be a palace ...........we got off the boat and thought wow ! this is magnificent then entered the reception and sadly greeted by an extremely rude young lady however I did not feel the bad vibe until I went to the bathroom and felt strangley uncomfotable then we were taken to the 3rd floor and on talking to the manager (I think) he was very nice he told us the building used to be a monastry and thereafter a hospital - in the pit of my stomach I felt horror and said to my husband I cannot walk this corridor alone it reminded me of the film the shining - the building gave me a feeling of tatal sadness and despair - I don't understand why but that is how I felt - I was very pleased to leave - sorry

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful location and building shame about the Staff!!”
Reviews.Author: WISDOMLondon
Reviews.Content: The San Clemente is a beautiful hotel. The bedroom was really wonderful. The boat journey to Venice was usually enjoyable. BUT the staff really let the place down. The food is really below par even the breakfasts. The dinner was very bad - what a shame because the view was absolutely stunning! Because of the staff and the food I will not be recomending this place to you. It is a great pity as the hotel is lovely, the island incredibly peaceful. If you are looking for peace and quiet this should be the place to come. I slept incredibly well. If you are over-worked and over-tired it is a wonderful place to rest!! Just don't eat here and you have to take the surly staff with a pinch of salt. Actually throughout Venice the people are pretty rude. It is a shame because it can spoil your holiday if you are not prepared. The swimming pool is poorly maintained and our child hurt himself. The staff were not too bothered about that - and we were furious!!. So the rating is quite low but it shouldn't be.

Reviews.Title: “Private island away from hustle and bustle”
Reviews.Author: Penny2010
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights as part of a trip around Italy. Hotel is in a fab old palatial building so all very spacious and grand, rooms are large with high ceilings and lots of character but modern. It's on a private island so there is a private water taxi which runs all day into the early hours directly from Piazza San Marco and takes around 20 mins. The trip to and from is very picturesque but after making the trip a few tines the novelty wears off - had I been staying longer I think it eventually would have annoyed me a little but it's a nice experience. Be warned, food at the resort is very expensive (even for Venice) so make sure breakfast is included in your deal. Breakfast is very good - great choice. The island itself is very pretty and it definitely provides a haven away from the teeming masses over in the main islands of Venice

Reviews.Title: “The Best....Except (and it's a big one)”
Reviews.Author: BelgoBelg
Reviews.Content: The hotel, an ex-monastery on its own island, with its own boat to San Marco every 20 minutes, has fabulous rooms and decor, clean and just plain beautiful. The swimming pool is marvelous. The whole thing is an oasis of calm after the tourist crowds in Venice. It should be the best place ever, but... Despite some very nice staff, service is just OK. For a luxury hotel, room service breakfast dishes should not stay in halls for hours. The restaurant has one of those dream water-side settings with a view over the lagoon or into a medieval outside/baroque inside chapel. It should be a place where people from Venice come for a great meal. But no. The food is poor, and that's being charitable. We tried a Venetian fish soup, and it was awful. On another evening when my wife decided we did not want to take the boat back into Venice (15 minutes or so, and beautiful), we thought we'll try the pasta. Keep it simple. No better than the fish soup. Conclusion--they desperately need a chef! Also, spa and gym tucked away in a back corner of the complex. Neither is up to snuff if it is important to you. A jog around the park, however, is super. Final point--computers available for guests did not work--allegedly something with the Vodaphone connection. OK, but for 5 days? Not acceptable for a hotel of this category, and price!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing. Great hotel but staff not making the most of it.”
Reviews.Author: venetianlover
Reviews.Content: The hotel building and surroundings were excellent, historical and beautifully renovated,but from the minute we arrived we were treated as if we weren't really necessary..I had read some poor reviews before we went and had emailed the manager to check that we would get decent service etc but it was as the review said....poolbar restaurant overpriced, limited menu and service poor. If you asked for anything it never came and bottled water was warm. There were not enough staff and those there were overwhelmed. The room was fine but air conditioning not really effective and our bathroom was not really clean on our arrival. The evening meal menu was limited, never changed and was very very expensive (As was the hotel shop). I wrote to the manager whilst we were there and handed the letter to reception but got no response. I emailed them when I returned home and got a reply to say they had not received my letter but there was a lukewarm apology. The best day was the last. I sat in the cool, deserted bar/lounge , read my book and had a bar snack and friendly service.

Reviews.Title: “great fun”
Reviews.Author: 2009italy
Reviews.Content: This was our first time in Venice and we really enjoyed the resort. Even after having read all the reports and books that mention how crowded Venice is, we weren't really prepared for it. After spending the day amidst all the crowds it was bliss to get back to the peace and quiet of this hotel. The shuttles ran often and were always on time. the room was very nice, with a view of Venice across the lagoon (room 186). Huge walk in closet and very nice bathroom. It's a large property so prepare to do a little walking to get where you want to go. Ate at Le Marchese the first night we arrived and it was fine. The breakfasts were really great and we ate outside on the patio. We also tried the Laguna restaurant out by the pool and it was fine. The last day I wasn't feeling great, so we decided to take a vacation from our vacation and spend the day on the island. We played two hours of tennis (nice rackets and fresh balls provided by hotel) and lay by the pool for a while. The only reason I don't give them a 5 rating is because the place could use better maintenance. The grounds are a little scuffy (not much, but just enough to notice) and there are some scratches and nicks in the woodwork, some trash laying around. We wanted to start the day with a run around the perimeter of the property but some of the path was piled with old junk, etc. A 5 star wouldn't have this, in my opinion. By and large, though, we were very happy there.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but in a very strange way”
Reviews.Author: cr8it
Reviews.Content: We booked this after reading reviews and talking to a travel agent. While this is a nice hotel, it is also an odd hotel. If you saw the movie - "The Shining" - you have a sense of what the hallways of this place feel like - and if you ever saw the movie "Shutter Island," you will also have a sense of it's remoteness on an island (and the fact that this hotel at one time served as the Mental Asylum for Venice). Much of the time, we felt like we were the only ones there. We knew there were other people (because they came over on the boat with us), but they would just seem to dissapear. As an aside, it is quite a long (but pleasant) boat ride from the main area of Venice (near the Dogge's Palace) to the hotel. We found the desk staff a bit snooty, but the rest of the staff was wonderful. We had room service for several meals (we were exhausted...but restaurant options at the hotel were limited to one place). Room service was fantastic and the presentation was divine. We would probably not stay here again, just because of the odd feel to us. It is not something that is even easy to put in writing, but you know odd when you feel odd. None the less, we can't really say anything bad about the place. It was impeccably clean and well maintained, and had the masseuse not told us the asylum part, we would have never known. If you stay here, don't miss taking a peek at the bar. There was never anyone in there - but it was beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “If only service matched the setting...”
Reviews.Author: Maggiesboy
Reviews.Content: A 3 night stay at San Clemente Friday to Monday. This was a return trip so we were well aware of the fact it is only reachable by free shuttle boat. This runs every 20 minutes either way, and takes 15 minutes to make the journey. This is an adventure in itself and we never tired of the views en route. Room was excellent though water pressure is perhaps lacking in the shower - an old issue as it was the same during our last stay. As weather was excellent, pool area was still in use as it can close in September if the weather turns cooler. This was a lovely area to relax in. Service overall was compromised however by the fact that there was a large(300+ guests) Russian wedding on the Saturday and staff were being pulled in all directions. Breakfast, though good, was chaotic at times and management should look at their organisation here. We complained and in fairness received a discounted meal in the restaurant at the church courtyard which is a lovely setting. Meal and service were excellent so they did make amends for earlier mistakes. Would certainly go back again, but hope management address the service issues to ensure that the 5 stars are fully justified.

Reviews.Title: “excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: Eileen S
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a sanctuary away from the crowds in Venice. How nice was it to get there after a very long day of fighting the crowds. Would stay there again in a blink of an eye.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious hotel on a secluded island”
Reviews.Author: emmals23
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights at the end of our Italian vacation. Only reached by boat, the island has it's benefits however it was hard to reach from the train station with our luggage. Our room was spacious and elegantly decorated. The secluded grounds were great for exploring and the view of Venice was breathtaking. Breakfast each morning had excellent service. Only criticism was that it took a 10 minute boat ride to get to the mainland, which arrived around every 20 minutes

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jbunti
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for two nights while on tour. The hotel is on a lovely island and would consider staying again. We did not have a chance to use the pool or have dinner there. The room is quite nice and roomy, but only a few rooms come with a view. Breakfast at the hotel is excellent . They provide a free courtesy shuttle to Venice every 20 min. The lower rating is due to the mold in the bathroom shower and a 10 minute wait for hot water.

Reviews.Title: “LUXURY HOTEL - IDEAL FOR HONEYMOON”
Reviews.Author: mrmilo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the San Clemente for the first 2 nights of our honeymoon & it was fantastic. The hotel is located on its own private island in a converted monastry - we had a standard room but it was large by European hotel standards with adjacent lobby/wardrobe & bathroom , furnished to a high standard and with a great bathroom. The hotel was peaceful and with friendly staff who made us feel very welcome .Extensive grounds with a fab pool area with its own bar - a great place to retire when Venice & the heat gets too much - St Mark's square was 30 minutes away by private shuttle boat. Great breakfast too

Reviews.Title: “5 star hotel shame about the restaurants and service”
Reviews.Author: n s
Reviews.Content: The San Clemente Hotel is a fantastic base for exploring the wonderful city of Venice. Situated a short 10 minute boat ride from San Marco on its own island in spacious, well kept and nice gardens. The rooms were extremely quiet and we were fortunate that they were interconnecting and spacious. Nice bathrooms and housekeeping was excellent. The concierges were some of the best we have ever come across. In summer it was quite superb, as we were able to dip in and dip out of all of the wonderful tourist sites, history and beauty of this special city. Being able to come back and use the swimming pool and tennis courts was fantastic and relaxing. There is a BUT though...... The restaurants and bars on site were very expensive and the service was some of the worst we have experienced,it was organised chaos with no semblence of order or direction from the maitre d's and very much not in keeping with the quality of the hotel. We would return but not to eat!

Reviews.Title: “An Excellent Choice Combining City and Resort”
Reviews.Author: wprensky
Reviews.Content: We spent two weeks at the hotel in August 2011 so got to know it very well. One week was our annual corporate retreat with our staff, and one week was holiday and relaxing. The hotel is an excellent combination of ease of visiting Venice itself with the calm atmosphere of a luxury resort away from the hustle and bustle of the tourists and town. The hotel staff from the managers and concierge to the support staff could not be nicer, although the hotel is huge and the staff spread a little thin when major events are happening at the same time that guests are in need of attention. But over all they did an excellent job of taking care of us. The food is very expensive as could be expected in a resort in Venice but of excellent quality, and there is a comfortable bar menu to chose from if you want to sit quietly throughout the day without a major meal. The hamburgers are extraordinary and worth the trip in themselves. The food and beverage manager, the front desk manager, the concierge, the head restaurant hosts and hostesses - all were professional and excellent and personalized our visit. You can easily get to the center of Venice with the free water shuttle that runs every 20 minutes during most of the day. The hotel has been extensively modernized over the past 3 years - internet service is excellent and free in the lobby and public areas, the air conditioning works like it should, and we were there in the worst heat wave in 20 years and were very comfortable. The rooms are huge by Venetian standards, and comfortably furnished. The pool is relaxing and well maintained and a joy for families. The spa is very well appointed and maintained, with excellent massage staff and a full gym. All together, for value, comfort, professional service, luxury, convenience and a relaxing stay, you can't do better. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Our wedding there was lovely!”
Reviews.Author: Travelotz11
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had our wedding at and stayed our wedding night at the San Clemente Palace. It is an absolutely beautiful hotel located on a secluded island off of the main island of Venice. Everything was absolutely beautiful and the food was amazing. The only disappointment we had was the service. My husband and I live in Italy, so we are used to "Italian Time", but for such an expensive place, it should have been much better. It took 30 minutes for us to check into our hotel room, however, once inside the room, it was heaven. The beds are extremely comfortable, and the large bathroom with garden tub and separate shower were a nice change from the typical hotel room. It reminded me a lot of a nice hotel room in Las Vegas at the Venetian. The service in the restaurants was also very slow, but once the food arrived, it was delicious. Just don't expect large portions for the high price. Overall, it was an amazing experience, and if you are willing to spend a lot of money on a special occasion, I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location - atmosphere cold - some small rooms”
Reviews.Author: LOMARJR
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights in this Hotel. Location on the island, the boat trip to get in and out are great. The room we had was very very small, the bathroom was outdated and disapointing for a 5 star "leading hotel of the world". The Spa was closed in the evening and closed the full day of our arrival. We could never use it. A shame, because the spa was one of the reason why we selected this hotel. General atmosphere of the hotel is cold, selection in breakfast is below 5 star standing, no hot food items on the buffet, available "a la carte" with supplement. Flat screen tv would as well a good investment for such hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Richard736
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the San Clemente for two nights prior to boarding a cruise. This hotel is truly exceptional. Situated in the harbor, just a 12-minute water shuttle from Piazza San Marco, the resort is an oasis of peace, quiet, and beauty. The complimentary water shuttle runs every 20 minutes, and is a pleasant ride across to the Grand Canal. After a hot day in Venice, we loved lounging around the magnificent, huge swimming pool. Other guests played tennis, shot a hole of golf, or enjoyed walking around the perfectly manicured lawns and gardens. The inside of the hotel is like a magnificent museum, with long and grand corridors, high ceilings, and stunning artwork and decor. Our room was huge, with a comfortable sofa, lounge chair, and writing desk. The bathroom was a stunning marble room, with a private door for the toilet, a walk-in shower, and a large bathtub. Although past TripAdvisor posts complained about the cost of wireless internet, it seems that they've changed the policy, and gave it to us for free. Breakfast was a grand buffet, which we enjoyed sitting in the pleasant courtyard. In the evening we enjoyed an informal light dinner and glass of wine from "The American Bar" as we sat outside enjoying the magnificent views of the water and all the boats whizzing by. The staff members were exceptionally pleasant and courteous in every regard. Although the hotel is expensive, it's worth every penny -- truly one of the most luxurious hotels we've ever visited. When we're in Venice again, we will absolutely return to this gem of a resort.

Reviews.Title: “What makes this a 5 star hotel?”
Reviews.Author: vivedetravel
Reviews.Content: Let's start with the reasons one should stay at San Clemente. The property is gorgeous! You feel wonder in the private boat and walking on the lovely grounds. Very clean and beautiful! The pool was a must for us and that is why we chose this hotel. During the dAy we relaxed by the pool and around 5pm we would travel to the mainland for touring, dinner etc... Very great idea seeing Venice is very busy during the day and HOT! Those items above are the only reason! If you are looking for any decent service this is NOT the place for you! The price of the hotel does not include anything additional. The concierge desk was always empty, the front desk had one maybe two people working it. The worst part of hotel is the lack of amenities. My husband (as well as multiple other guests). Could not get water. The gym did not offer water, the bowl in the lobby was empty and my husband. Kept asking for over 2 hours, the pool only had bottles at the bar you could purchas for 8 euro. Another guest from the UK reminded me that what're should be a right to us. Not a way of making money. It's in the Geneva Convention for gods sake. The pool had one server and he was slooooow. There is no waiter walking around taking orders and even a three star in Mexico does that. I understand that air conditioning is different in Europe, but at such a nice resort you would think you get what you pay for, but no. Just cool air.definitely not the temp that I would set the thermostat at. Multiple guests had the same problem. There are multiple signs stating that this is A Leading Hotel of the world. Well they will be getting a letter from me because service was not included in the price of the stay. Internet only free in lobby and pool. You must pay in the room. Another guest was irate about this. Again. You are paying to be on the property, thats it! 2 diet cokes came to 14 euro. So again not a great price. There were always dishes in the hallway sitting on ledges. We waited to see how long they would stay there for, about 24 hours. I've stayed at 3 star hotels with 10 times the service and amenities than San Clemente. One last thing the breakfast was fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “unreal..”
Reviews.Author: GreeceBen10
Reviews.Content: Incredible property....but quite eary at times...as this used tobe a Monastary.But dont let that put you off.....Unbelievable experience, and one which you have todo if you go to Venice...if only for a few days as its rather expensive.Must admit, this place makes you feel like your a celebrity ....specially at breakfast, drinking champayne.....the pool is an added bonus as it was very hot whilst we were there....We definately would return.

Reviews.Title: “A rare diamond in busy Venice”
Reviews.Author: suzysuzanne
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located on a private island: Very calm very relaxing huge hotel with very good rooms-nice restaurant- great terrace with live music- nice bar area- large swimming pool and tennis courts. Hotel breakfast is very rich in taste and variety. There's a complementary very cute wooden shuttle boat that goes to St Marco square every 20min. PS: do not open the window or else the mosquitoes will rush right in!

Reviews.Title: “Very good, but could be much better”
Reviews.Author: Seasonedpro23
Reviews.Content: Absolutely beautiful property but needs some work on the service. Lots of little things but in general, not four seasons quality on the service level. Many of the employees have a very indifferent attitude towards the customers, and my sense as an experienced five star traveler is that they are either under-staffed, poorly managed, or a bit of both. Rooms are as good as you can get in Venice. Great a/c, comfortable beds etc. Poor choice of toiletries, though and housekeeping is decidedly mixed. Breakfast buffet is adequate although replenishment is weak and again, service very mediocre. Little things like hot coffee on time and extra newspapers are met with blank stares. Boat ride to and from Venice is a delight, and a real plus is the pool and grounds. Would absolutely stay here again but would love to see this place reach its full potential. Properly managed, this could be on par with the Cipriani.

Reviews.Title: “One hotel, one island!”
Reviews.Author: oliveerpent
Reviews.Content: Coming from the airport or Santa Lucia station in a very busy city with water overall, you take the vaporetto until the San Marco Square where the private shuttle of the hotel waits for you. Don't be afraid if you miss it because you have a rotation every 20 minutes (depending on the period) After a short cruise to the south of the laguna (between 15-20 minutes) you finally arrive at the hotel San Clemente Palace, old monastery, transformed in hospital and than in a huge palace. Nice welcome by the staff speaking a good english, you receive your room aftyer your check in but don't forget to ask a map because this hotel is very big....and you don't find so many information on the wall to find what you look for... The reservation has been made via booking.com for a price per night of 210 EUR breakfast included and cancellation insurance included (we never know!) This 5* hotel offers you eveything you can expect in such hotel, heated swimming pool with bar, tennis, golf, gardens with rabbits!, spa, restaurant, shuttle to the center of Venice....aso... The quality of the room was very good with bath and shower separate, very good AC system and a comfortable king size bed. Good to know : you walk a lot because it's huge! The first night we had a short diner on the terrace outside and it was really a bad experience : bad service, mistakes, bad organisation, expensive and full of mosquitos at this period of the year, so I can advise to have your meals outside the hotel (personal point of view) In Venice, we had 2 diners : the first one on the terrace of the Londra palace in front of the San Marco square (nice terrace with only one service for 200 EUR for 4 people) The second diner in Venice was on the terrace facing the SAn Marco Square at the hotel Cipriani (very good but expensive 400 EUR for 4 people) Try Cannaregio part of the city, very quiet and easy to access via the vaporetto (ticket for 4 days costs about 33 eurPP) To make short : a very nice city for couples or familly but busy and expensive but anyway a "magnifique" souvenir

Reviews.Title: “Paradise in the middle of Venice”
Reviews.Author: diane160468
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel - decoration, furniture and facilities Rooms good sized with garden view, air condition that works, nice bathrooms and good beds Beautiful grounds including large pool, tennis courts and pitch and putt. setting is just amazing run a regular shuttle boat to Venice which is free Food is expensive Fabulous end to an amazing holiday

Reviews.Title: “A calm and elegant place in the frantic Venice”
Reviews.Author: AleePaola
Reviews.Content: Located on an island 20 minutes away from San Marco, in an awesome and charming historic building. We came here three times in the last three years and we always liked the place, even if the last time you could fill a bit of a lowering in the service. May be this is due to the owners problems and the likely change of controls. However , we enjoyed the stay a lot

Reviews.Title: “A paradise and we will return”
Reviews.Author: AER53
Reviews.Content: This is a perfect spot for travellers to Venice. It combines the opportunity to see Venice and vist the sites as well as getting away from it all. Rooms are excellent and facilities are very good. Downside is the food service and the cost of a sandwich which at 28 euros each is a bit steep.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Location. Staff Just OK though. Poor Internet Services. Dire food to be honest.”
Reviews.Author: CeeEmm
Reviews.Content: This hotel is lovely. The location is lovely and the grounds and property are well maintained and nicely renovated to a very high standard. Reception staff were great on arrival and we got upgraded to a Junior suite. However the problems are that the hotel breakfast is chaos! and DO NOT eat at the restaurant - terrible food and didnt care when we complained. Some reception staff are great, some are rude. But I would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel - really relaxing and fun”
Reviews.Author: Geraldine M
Reviews.Content: We stayed in The San Clemente in July. We had a fantastic stay. the hotel is on its own island and feels really peaceful although you are only 20minutes by launch from St Marks Square. The rooms are huge. Our two teenagers loved it as well. the facilites are good with a nice pool and a very small pitch and putt course. Overall a wonderful start to our holiday in italy. We will go back! One word of caution - wear bug spray if you are eating dinner outside. The Italian mosquiotoes made a fine meal of us!

Reviews.Title: “Top notch customer service.”
Reviews.Author: msiqbalmd
Reviews.Content: My wife & I had the pleasure of staying here for just one night but can't wait to go back. Situated on a private island just a few minute boat ride from Piazza San Marco, it was the perfect location for us. The resort shuttle, a luxury boat, easily transports you to the heart of the town. Yet, once the fun is over, it brings you back to the peace & serenity of your own little paradise. Whereas everything about this resort is first rate, the most memorable feature is the unmatched customer service, especially the concierge. By the time we reached the hotel, we were exhausted from all the traveling. Since, we were leaving the very next afternoon, we thought we had no time to do anything in Venice. Not so, the concierge planned everything for us in the most efficient way despite allowing us to rest up first. Resort itself is beautiful, has the elegance of an old renovated palace. Our room was spacious & very tastefully decorated. The resort has a ton of amenities, including a gorgeous pool area plus sauna & jacuzzi. The breakfast was sumptous & reasonably priced for a 5 star hotel. Regretfully, because of time constraints, we did not get to see or use everything this resort has to offer. But, we are planning our next, more extended, visit to Venice and, of course, look forward to another stay at San Clemente Palace.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful Venice away from the crowds.”
Reviews.Author: Lailonniel
Reviews.Content: This was the fourth and the last hotel in Italy where we stayed during our honeymoon this summer. And I'm so glad that out of all hotels in Venice we picked this one. Yes the stay was not totally perfect and yes there were some issues about this and that but overall it was still magical. First of all I have to say that this was the only hotel (out of four we stayed in) where we were congratulated with our marriage and what's more were upgraded to a better room which was very pleasant and was so unexpected that I even forgot to thank the lady at the reception properly. Right from the start I was very impressed with their shuttle service which never gave any reasons to be disappointed that you were on an island instead of Venice itself. With this you have a wonderful opportunity to spend a day or part of the day in a noisy and crowded down town and itâ€™s outskirt and then sale away to the peace and quietness of this wonderful island. Perfect combination! On arrival we had to wait a while to check in but it was not bothersome as the staff took our suitcases and we took a nice walk around the hotel grounds. The room was marvelous: nice furniture, huge marble bathroom full of light and a walk-in closet. Beautiful! The room was spotlessly clean except for the shower cabin though, which had spots of black mold in the corners. It was unacceptable and I should have stated this to management of course but didnâ€™t feel like taking care of it in those three days we were staying so we just took bath instead of showers most of the times. The staff was very polite, helpful and fast. One time we bought a bottle of wine in town and realized we didnâ€™t have a corkscrew in the room, so my husband called to the housekeeping which sent a man to us in no time, like a minute at most. We were very impressed. Although I have to admit that, as mentioned in other reviews, during breakfast the staff once forgot to serve us coffee we asked for, not that it bothered us much, we just called another waiter and asked again, but indeed this should not be happening in a place like that. I agree. The restaurant with a seaview they have is totally amazing. Food is great, view is breathtaking, staff are very polite. And oh that sunset! Even if you donâ€™t stay in that hotel, just book a table in this restaurant, take a shuttle to San Clemente and enjoy amazing peaceful sunset over Venice. Itâ€™s absolutely worth it! Probably the only thing we didnâ€™t like were the mosquitoes on that island. Somehow the management of the hotel obviously does nothing to fight numerous mosquitoes. Obviously some kind of traps should be used in a restaurant, otherwise if guest donâ€™t spray from head to toe they get eaten alive, as simple and as true as this. And there should be some nets in the vent and some traps by the windows in the rooms otherwise people just canâ€™t sleep properly. Iâ€™m just saying that itâ€™s an important issue that could possibly ruin guestsâ€™ vacation. So the management should think of something to take care of this problem. Overall we had a great time there and itâ€™s a perfect romantic getaway even for those who donâ€™t know Venice that well, because with the shuttle service this hotel proposes itâ€™s no problem to get to Venice very quickly.

Reviews.Title: “Beautifully quiet but only 10 minutes from San Marco”
Reviews.Author: DrPaulT
Reviews.Content: Left the kids with their favourite babysitters and took the wife to venice for her 40th birthday. This hotel is beautifully quiet on its own island with lots of green spaces. Contrary to some other reviews, the boat takes only 15 minutes from the island to San Marco and runs every 20 minutes from 6am until 2am the following morning. Most hotels in venice are more than 15 minutes from San Marco anyway, plus you have to walk. The San Clemente shuttle means you get transported to the centre of Venice without even having to walk! Ideal whether you are a first time visitor to the city or more experienced. The hotel is very plush and the service is impeccable. The staff speaks many languages. The restaurant is one of the best in Venice and you can sit out looking across the lagoon to San Marco watching the sun go down. Very romantic. Very happy we went to this hotel. With the swimming pool and a top notch spa, well worth the visit.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise”
Reviews.Author: TexasLuv2travl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the San Clemente for our 30th wedding anniversary. We were upgraded to a nice room with a view of the pool and grounds, right on the corner on the 2nd floor. The bathroom was modern, completely marble, with a glass shower and a separate sunken tub. The room wasn't huge, but it was definitely comfortable. There is a problem with mosquitoes in the summer at night, but the San Clemente does what they can to combat the problem. They warn not to open the windows and they provide an automatic mosquito repellant in the drawer of the desk if you need to use it in your room. We didn't need it, but we did get a mosquito before it got us! Breakfast is luxurious and filling with many choices, scrambled eggs (not usual for European breakfasts) and prosseco for mimosas if you wish. They have a beautiful pool to use in summer, which is nice for an afternoon after touring Venice in the morning. The boat was always on time and a nice ride to the heart of Venice. This is definitely a luxurious resort, and you will feel like royalty staying here. I loved that it was away from the hustle and bustle of the tourists. The staff was extremely polite and helpful. Venice is my favorite place on earth, and the San Clemente made it paradise. We took the public transportation from the airport to San Marco stop, got off, crossed the bridge back towards Piazza San Marco, and found the boat ramp for the free shuttle from the San Clement. There is a TAXI stand right at the entrance; it's a brown wooden structure. There is no need to pay expensive private taxi prices to get to the hotel, unless you have money to burn, which we do not.

Reviews.Title: “we we"ll be back!”
Reviews.Author: masyanya1981
Reviews.Content: very nice and beautiful place. swiming pool, one of the best restorant in Venice, every 30 minites you can go to San Marco by hotel's boat

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to come back, Best bang for the buck.”
Reviews.Author: SinghfamilyLI
Reviews.Content: It is a great value. Where else in Venice could you first play tennis and then cool off sipping Bellini's by the pool. The whole family enjoyed it.

Reviews.Title: “Not for first visits to Venice”
Reviews.Author: patacake3
Reviews.Content: We had a very good stay here and can only praise the hotel.
