However, as friends of ours who visited us there remarked, this would be a bit far out for anyone visiting Venice for the first time or who had only 2/3 days there. On it's own island (a situation which we like but we know Venice well) it takes 20 mins on the launch in either direction and after a certain time of evening the launches are not as frequent so you may end up hanging around a bit to return to the hotel. As we have been to Venice on many occasions and stayed in various hotels, apartments, etc over the years we don;t feel the need to spend too many hours seeing the sights and fighting the crowds so for us it is a perfect place. It's a relaxing place to stay and very quiet on the whole as befits an ex-monastery. We have never seen many children there and those who were, were very well behaved with sensible parents.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel - simply outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: BetinaAarhus
Reviews.Content: This hotel is magic! Everything about this hotel was great! Nice calm atmousphere, very stylish and elegant without being unconfortable when vacationing with children. But this place is definitely not cheap either! Located on one of the small islands the complimentary boat trip into Saint Marco's took only 12 minutes. Breakfast was the best I have ever experienced in Italy!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: jbamrick
Reviews.Content: Beautiful rooms, grounds, pool. Good service. So nice to enjoy Venice and then go to the hotel and be in a resort!!

Reviews.Title: “Shaken confidence”
Reviews.Author: lovetrav
Reviews.Content: Reading hotel (and restaurant) reviews on TA requires selective judgment.I am always struck by the discrepancy in ratings: how can a hotel-visited during the same period be rated 5 by one and 1 by another client and how do you make your decisios? I hope that looking at two successive (July 2006 and July 2010) -rave- reviews I have written about the SCP will lend more credibility to this one: frankly we were disappointed. Admittedly occupancy was 2-3 times higher than on our previous visits (never a good sign unless services can keep up with it) and this implied short stays by tour groups. Incidentally I wouldn't expect hotels to be run at economically unsound ocupancy levels but I do expect them to provide optimum service to returning customers. From the beginning we were struck by numerous examples of attempts at cost savings at the expense of client satisfaction (the most grotesque one being the discontinuation of supplying complimentary drinking water to the rooms). The hotels labels itself 5*L which should allow little gounds for complaints. The hotel with 200+ rooms providing 1 (one) computer for internet use for those not bringing their own laptops is also unsatisfactory. The pleasant poolside restaurant has been much reduced in size and the quality and choice of the food-at the prices charged-is inadequate. One has the impression that the hotel is searching for their business model. The property remains gorgeous and particularly suitable for a visit to Venice in the summer months but there is a deterioration in the levels of service which shouldn't be allowed. By the time we departed the only attributes to the 5*L (Leading Hotel of the World) rating remained the-exorbitant- prices for food/drink and laundry services. A pity!

Reviews.Title: “Marvellous Venetian Island”
Reviews.Author: Philipp76
Reviews.Content: We spent a weekend at the San Clemente Palace Hotel & Resort. From our arrival until the departure everything was perfect. The reservations office was very helpful when we contacted them before our arrival to make a reservation in a room that did fit our wishes. The resort proved to be the ideal location for a stay in the hot summer time. We could visit Venice in the morning and in the evening (when it was less hot and crowded) with the complementary boat shuttle, and the rest of the time we enjoyed the beautiful island with its park, pool and SPA. The staff was very friendly and helpful during our whole stay. We will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “A perfect destination to discover Venice...”
Reviews.Author: Lordie1
Reviews.Content: A lovely hotel with wonderful views and we'd certainly return in years to come. It allows you to escape the tourist trap of St Mark's square but at the same time you're only a short hop on the complimentary water taxi (runs every 20 mins) back. The grounds of the hotel are stunning and the facilities are excellent.. The swimming pool is an extra treat when you've been out all day discovering Venice. Venice overall was fantastic, it's very expensive but you just have to go with it. I would highly recommend the Time Out guide book.

Reviews.Title: “Venice away from the crowd ;-)”
Reviews.Author: Cruiser71
Reviews.Content: We had room 352 on the 3rd floor, clean and spacious but uninspired... could get the climate control to meet the desired setpoint and couldn't get the confort level expected. Overall like the location and experience but this didn't fell like the 5* it claims to be. Large public groud, with pool,tennis, putting... It was really hot while we were there and we opted for the indoor Jacuzzi to relax. In fact we would get up, breakfast then head to San Marco around 11am then back to the SPA areound 4pm til 6pm then back to San Marco for dinner... this worked out great everyday. Full buffet breakfast was included but it did sometime run low on bacon and eggs.. The hotel itself is quite large and located ona private island at about 10mins boat ride which runs every 20mins. Found that entertaining and easy to use, compare to the poor folks lugging their lugage across multiples bridges! If you're getting there by train or drop off a rental, I suggest you get on Linea 1 to make the journey down the Grand Canal. If leaving/arriving by plane(VCE), Alilaguna's Linea Blu will get you to and from the airport. Really like the location away from the main islands, the hotel shuttle boat was easy to locate, just a little before the first taxi stand after getting off at San Marco heading toward Doge's palace. Only one bridge (5steps) to cross before making it to the landing area.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel. Spooky? Bad service. Venice is Great.”
Reviews.Author: Mr_Vegas_OC
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just got back from a wonderful trip to Italy. We stayed at three of the hotels recommended on TripAdvisor, so I wanted to make sure I gave some feedback to others. Venice -- We stayed at San Clemente Palace. Now this is definitely a hotel where I have some mixed emotions. Let's start out with the good. If you want the "Wow" factor, this is the place to go. A 12 minute shuttle ride from St. Mark's takes you to a private island. You walk down a row of tiki torches to an old monastery converted into a hotel. The grounds are beautiful. The hotel is beautiful. The rooms were beautiful. The hotel is almost a little spooky (have seen some Shutter Island / Shining comments) as you rarely see anyone in the hallways. It is very large and I got lost a few times my first day or two there. One night we took the penultimate shuttle ride back to the hotel in a storm -- it felt like a scene from an old mystery/horror movie -- but in a very cool way. So great atmosphere. The breakfast was outstanding, and my wife and I usually don't eat breakfast in the hotel when we travel as we tend to grab something on the go. But the selection was great, and it was served in a beautiful dining room. The bad parts were the service, which was more than a little disappointing. For a few examples, my wife asked for an iron to press some things, and they told here this was not permitted by fire codes (we did get an iron in Rome, so this excuse seemed kind of lame). On our way back to the train station, we reserved a water taxi. About 20 minutes into the ride, we thought he might be taking us to the airport instead of the train station, and we told him. He apologized and said the concierge told him we were going to the airport (we had plenty of time, but for someone that likes to cut it close, this could have been a disaster). There was also a bottle of water left in the hallway by our room that seemed to sit there for a day and half -- thought the staff would have cleaned it up. And on the night that I mentioned where we rode back in the storm, there were five of us on the shuttle. We all got drenched sprinting to the hotel -- it would have been nice if someone could have greeted us with some umbrellas. Admittedly, these are all small things, but the service was noticeably not the best, and the staff seemed a little stiff. The other thing I would say is to think about the water shuttle. On the one hand, it contributed to the very cool atmosphere of the hotel, and if you time it right, you shouldn't have any major problems. But there were a few instances where we forgot to check the schedule closely, or where we missed one, and you may end up waiting a half an our at St. Marks to get to the hotel. This can be a little frustrating. Note also that in order to get to the hotel when you first arrive you will probably need to get a water taxi (Euro 70 - 75), as it may be a pain to get the vaporetto to the shuttle and wait (could be 1 - 1 1/2 hours total). If you have a lot of bags and just got off a long train/plane ride, you will probably want the convenience of the water taxi. That being said, I'm not sure many other hotels in Venice are much more convenient, and we did see lots of people hauling around their bags through the city which was kind of funny. So all in all, would I go back? If I were going for a romantic get away with my wife or girlfriend, wasn't very high maintenance with regard to service required, and thought that I would spend a little more time on the island (relaxing poolside or dining at the restaurant) versus going into Venice, I would think again about staying here. But if I wanted something a little more convenient, required a lot of service from hotel staff and/or thought I would spend most of my time in Venice proper, then I would probably try to get one of the more upscale hotels around St. Marks as it will be much more convenient.

Reviews.Title: “5 Star Facade & prices...3 Star Service & rooms”
Reviews.Author: Zephorla
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this 5 star hotel for 3 nights in June 2011 as the first stop on our honeymoon in Italy. The hotel is located on an island in the lagoon with a very regular and reliable free boat service to St. Mark's Square. Unfortunately we were not entirely sure of the geography of Venice upon arriving and spent â‚¬80 (a combination of 2 x â‚¬5 bus ticket and â‚¬70 water taxi) to get to the hotel. First impressions are that the hotel is indeed an impressive place, accessed as it is by the water to a well appointed jetty with a short walk to the front entrance. We were advised upon checking in that we had been upgraded and the helpful receptionist actually showed us to our room, which I can't recall ever happening to us before. It's just as well she did though as the Hotel is cavernous and you could quite easily wander around for an age without bumping into another soul. Our room was fine but no more than that although it did look back over the lagoon to Venice which was nice. We have been fortunate enough to stay in several 5 star hotels but the prices in San Clemente Palace were among the most extortionate that we have ever seen and we quickly learned to eat elsewhere and bring our own snacks to the pool (â‚¬7/â‚¬8 for small bottle of coke - â‚¬18 for 2 cups of tea!!!!). I suppose they are aware that the have a captive audience, as it were, and can charge what they like. For a 5 star hotel the breakfast was lamentable and the service terrible. On every day that we were there we had to ask several times for hot water, the 'hot' food was always cold and on the one day that my wife dared to ask for some warm scrambled eggs she was advised that they could not do that unless she paid. On the positive side the shuttle boat to St. Mark's Square was extremely regular and punctual and is a very pleasant way to travel and the pool area was nice with a reasonably large pool and plenty of sun loungers etc. The outside pool and the open areas are the main reason that we chose this hotel as they were a welcome relief from the hustle and bustle of Venice. If we were to go back to Venice again we would not stay here but would rather look for somewhere else with an outside pool - perhaps on the lido. And don't forget your insect repellant!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in a magical setting”
Reviews.Author: LondonFuninthesun
Reviews.Content: Really lovely hotel on it's own little island. Boat service is fantastic and v friendly. Food is over priced and drinks a little too but the whole experience made it all worthwhile. Think in the summer much better than staying in Venice itself. Would go back in a flash.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: leegoffin54
Reviews.Content: We booked here for our honeymoon and were not disappointed. Set on its own island, it is a haven to return to after the hustle and bustle of San Marco.The hotel is very opulent but clean and comfortable and we got a free upgrade as we were on our honeymoon. Our room overlooked the bay looking towards San Marco and the view was just wonderful.Our bed was large and very comfortable, and the bathroom very clean and well equipped. Breakfast was 7am to 11am and we ate outside on some mornings. There was a huge choice, from full English to croissants, breads, pastries, hams, cheeses, fresh fruit, cereal,yogurts juices etc.. There is a free boat shuttle service every 20 minutes throughout the day to 1.40am. This goes directly from San Marco to the hotel. It is a bit of a job to find at first as the sign is difficult to see. But if you stand in San Marco facing the lagoon it is to the right hand side behind the water taxi booking office, opposite the small market stalls.We only ate in the hotel one night and it was excellent but expensive. There is a fitness centre for hotel guests but we didn't use it.There is also a pool and tennis court. The grounds are beautifully kept and lovely to have a stroll around with benches placed at various points to sit and admire the view .Considering the size of the hotel we expected to see a lot more people but it was very quiet. The staff were unobtrusive, polite and helpfull and most spoke some English. Venice itself is wonderful. No English themed pubs,no chinese or indian restaurants. No litter. Just as it should be but it is expensive and it wasn't smelly as we had expected it might be. A gondola trip is a must but costs 80 euro for 35 minutes, and the average meal for 2 with drinks was about 40/45 euro. But you are only likely to go once so it's worth it.

Reviews.Title: “A 5 star hotel with 2 star service and attention to detail”
Reviews.Author: Pouter
Reviews.Content: Summary: - Beautiful setting - Beautiful hotel - Poor service - Poor attention to detail - Stuffy atmosphere I would not recommend this hotel unless you only travel with (delete as applicable) Prada/Gucci/Louis Vuitton/Bvlgari/Armani clothing and luggage in which case this will probably suit you perfectly. Firstly I must say this is a beautiful hotel, but the service is certainly not what you would expect from a 5 star L hotel. First impressions were good as we were welcomed from the boat by a broad smiling, polite porter, but from here it unfortunately went down hill. The member of staff at reception that checked us in seemed to look down his nose at us but did at least show us to our room (this did not happen for a lot of other guests and the hotel is cavernous, so being shown to your room is somewhat useful!) Having arrived at lunch time we decided to visit 'La Laguna' - the hotel's pool bar/restaurant. When we arrived the was the a large table still covered in napkins and glasses and although some of this was cleared the bulk remained even until we left. The food was mediocre at best, coffee was cold and it took 3 requests to gain the bill. The service was utterly attrocious, waiters snatched items off the tables and appeared superior to all guests. The waiters appeared to be dashing around with no real direction or purpose. Breakfast the following morning was a similar experience, again 3 requests to get a coffee, waiting staff that barely spoke English and that were again dashing around with no sense of purpose. On our final day my wife asked a member of waiting staff for some butter to which the waitress bellowed, "No! No! No!" and waved angrily at another member of staff. Other small gripes. No complimentary water in bedroom (7 euros for small bottle in mini bar), when I asked for an iron and ironing board I was told this cannot be provided for safety reasons (seems ridiculous to me but is this now the norm?) you therefore need to make use of the hotel's extortionate pressing service (10.50 euros for a shirt).

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel for a fantastic city”
Reviews.Author: kenjukes
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights in early June to attend a friend's wedding in Venice. The hotel was palatial, the service was first class and the food in the hotel was also excellent. It is a perfect location for a busy city like Venice. Spend the morning getting lost in the Venice alleys and then return to the hotel via the complimentary boat shuttle and relax by the pool. I can't speak highly enough about this place and certainly aim to come back

Reviews.Title: “nice island and public areas very nice but sterile, no flowers in gardens and staff unhelpful mostly.”
Reviews.Author: attilathehun23
Reviews.Content: view from our very nicely furnished room gloomy over an unkempt garden, need a lot of extra time for boat to st marks - half hour nearly each way. public spaces very nice. restsurnat ok but gloomy. pool staff rude and want to clean it at 0900 when many guests want to swim. ridiculous exchange rate for currency exchange at the reception. very cheeky rates. no free wifi in a 5 star hotel. very annoying..the room service got 3 orders wrong and some food arrived cold after long waits. tiny portons. a bottle of water from fridge in room 7 euros.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect hidden paradise in Venice”
Reviews.Author: geert_hespel
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights, and it was unforgettable. Near Venice, with a perfect working shuttle, and it is an island of rest and peace. Superb rooms, very friendly staff, very clean and organised. A fantastic breakfast at the outside terrace, good organised that everyone has the possibility to sit outside. A very nice swimming pool to refresh after a visit to Venice, with adorable staff also at the bar. If you stay there, try to have a junior suit (or suite) with lagoon view...really unique !! If you want to make your visit to Venice perfect, stay in this hotel, and go at least once for a diner to the restaurant "MET", all worthwhile every euro !!!

Reviews.Title: “lovely setting”
Reviews.Author: charwen_uk
Reviews.Content: lovely hotel and pool.Bit dissapointed on arrival as didnt know how to get to the island took us nearly an hour till we found a small kiosk that gave you a voucher for a water taxi.Got bitten very badly with mosquito bites as surrounded by water.Also we booked the restaurant every night and same menu all of winter and then same for all summer so got bit boring.Breakfast was amazing everything you could think of.Private launch took you over all the time.We would go again but would take mosquito repellants and not book restaurant every night.

Reviews.Title: “Nice,but not great,shame about the shuttle boat”
Reviews.Author: cuck00
Reviews.Content: Stayed 1 night on 8th may. Getting to the hotel proved to be a bit of hard work. We arrived at the hotel dock at san marco ,there was a sign for the hotel along with a timetable so we waited and waited . After 50 mins we phoned the hotel and were told because the pope was in town the shuttle boat had been moved. We made our way down to the new location, it was a waterbus stop there was no signs for the hotel and the staff knew nothing .We waited another30 mins ,phoned the hotel again and was told there would be a boat along in 40 mins. Finally got to the hotel it took over 2 hours!! The hotel had all my contact details ,there is no excuse for a hotel of this standard and price not to inform their guests of any changes to the service,after all it is the only way to get to the hotel .They could at least have put a sign up at the original dock. The room was very nice ,well equiped and very clean though no tea and coffee ,not even a bottle of water,of course you could have a 250ml bottle out of the minibar for a very unreasonable 7 euros.We had tea by the pool ,18 euros for a pot of water and 2 teabags that we had to unwrap, not a biscuit in sight. I have no problems with high prices in places like this,but it has to be done nicely .Breakfast was very average ,considering the prices. Would only stay here again in the summer when you can use the pool during the heat of the day , during the cooler times i think its better to stay more central

Reviews.Title: “Paid a lot and was really disappointed”
Reviews.Author: drag0n77
Reviews.Content: I wouldn't reccomend this hotel. Our heart sank when we saw the room- we'd booked a junior suite but it looked nothing like the website pic- just a bit dated and shabby looking. Having paid so much for our break, it's a bit of a kick in the teeth to be charged 5 euros for internet access, and unbelievably, ten euros just to borrow tennish rackets and balls for the tennis court !! At breakfast the selection was uninspiring and the service quite poor. ordered a latte and waited 20 minutes, finished my breakfast, only to be brought a tea. also we were told the boats would be every 15 minutes but on the weekend they were every 40 minutes so we spent a lot of time hanging around waiting to be shuttled back and forth. The grounds were lovely, but nothing else really made it special and ovrall we felt pretty ripped off.

Reviews.Title: “THE best place to stay in Venice by far.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 days. The hotel is beautiful, the location is just perfect and the staff are very helpful. It is an oasis of calm in the frantic choas of venice. After a hard day sightseeing, eating, wlking, drinking, etc in Venice we looked forward to the little boat ride that would spirit us away to our perfect little island.

Reviews.Title: “An incredibly beautiful hotel, in an incredibly beautiful setting, on an island in the Venice harbor”
Reviews.Author: MitzouTexas
Reviews.Content: Imagine that you are arrive by private (complimentary) motor boat shuttle from the Piazza San Marco in Venice. Leaving the dock, you walk past lovingly-tended gardens, filled with large trees, a broad expanse of grass, and you face a lovely palace hotel. The San Clemente Palace hotel, having been restored eight years ago, places you in a setting that makes you feel like you wandered into a private palace. The staff makes you feel like royalty. Every aspect of this hotel is well-done and luxurious, yet, at no time, do you feel that you "do not belong". Most remarkable is the number of families with children--strollers abound. And, yet, there is no noise, no sense that you've wandered into a children's park. Everyone fits together--the guests, the staff, even the location is perfect--for honeymooners, conference guests (yes, they have "meetings") and, it's away from the bustle and crowds and pickpockets of Venice. Yet, you are no more than 10 minutes away via motor launch...and those run every 20 minutes day and most of the night. The breakfast buffet is lavish, fresh, and delicious. Service is outstanding. But, the San Clemente Palace Hotel in Venice has earned our unwavering loyalty, not only for what we've mentioned above, but for their dedication and success in finding an English-speaking sitter late in the evening to stay with my husband in the hospital, after he had fallen and suffered a mild brain hemorrhage earlier in the day. I had tried to find someone at the hospital, but had not had any success. Upon my return to the hotel at 8 pm, I received a phone call from the General Manager, Mr. Vicenzo Pagano, who asked if I would like to have him find someone to stay with my husband. Flavio, a member of the concierge staff worked diligently, and a kind lady showed up at my husband's bedside within two hours. We are forever grateful.

Reviews.Title: “OLD FASHIONED grandeur”
Reviews.Author: lorrainp
Reviews.Content: This hotel is lovely but seems to be stuck in the dark ages. My two biggest gripes: 1. No free Internet access anywhere in the hotel. I really resent paying top whack for a hotel room, then paying extra for Internet access. Even the three hotel PCs in reception were chargeable wifi only. Seriously, how much would it cost them to hook those three PCs up to their corporate network? Internet access really should be free in a five-star hotel. 2. No complementary mineral water in the rooms. The mineral water in the mini bar was 7 Euros a bottle. Both of these things, in my humble opinion, should be included in the price of a five-star hotel room. I would not stay at San Clemente again purely because of these two things - I feel like they're trying to rip me off. Also, silly little things like the toiletries â€“ just one small bottle labelled â€œshampoo / bath foamâ€�, no shower gel, conditioner, cotton buds etc. Other than that, the service was excellent, and the staff very well-trained and helpful, without exception. The hotel occupies the whole island, with large gardens, however they don't really make the most of this. The gardens aren't particularly nicely landscaped. The pool is lovely, and a real bonus in a crowded city like Venice. We were there in April, which was just about warm enough to sit out at the pool, although it was very windy in the mornings, so people generally only used the pool in the afternoons. The trade-off to the space of the gardens and pool is the 15-min boat ride to Venice, which is a pain. Another reason I wouldn't stay here again. The hotel does the best it can, by running shuttles every 20 mins, but it's still dis-spiriting to have to wait for a boat after a long day walking around the city. The hotel, due to its past, is very inward-looking (good for celebs looking to escape from the public perhaps??). There is a 3m-high wall around the whole island, the only exception being a terrace where you can sit outside at tables on the waterfront, with waiter service from the (rather expensive â€“ E9 for a Peroni, E6 for a Fanta) bar, which is really nice. The inward-looking theme continues in the rooms. Our room (367) was at the far end of the hotel, right next to the water. However, the rooms look inward to the â€œgardenâ€� (trees), and the corridor gets the water view instead. I couldnâ€™t help wondering why on earth they didnâ€™t put the rooms on the water side, and the corridor on the garden side. It felt like all stud walls, so I think they could have done it quite easily. Some of the other wings of the hotel do have the rooms on the other side though, so perhaps we were just unlucky. The windows are very high in the rooms â€“ the sill being 1.3m high meant that you felt a little â€œlocked inâ€�. I believe itâ€™s the same in all the rooms. All we could see out of our window was sky and treetops! Itâ€™s really quiet at the hotel, despite having almost 200 rooms (I think?), and it was easy to get a good quiet nightâ€™s sleep. The spa is good and not too expensive for a 5-star hotel (1hr massage = E100, 80min facial, E110). The fitness room is a bit rubbish though â€“ very small, and WAY too warm, being located on a mezzanine inside the Jacuzzi room. Breakfast was fairly good, with a wide selection of items, all pretty good quality. Not the most extensive breakfast range Iâ€™ve ever seen, but pretty good for a continental Europe hotel, and enough to keep us both happy. The coffee however wasnâ€™t really that good. My partner knows good coffee, and wasnâ€™t impressed at all with their offering. All in all, nice to get away from the mayhem of Venice, but could do with a shake-up to bring it up-to-date.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: IanR62
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the hotel by Water Taxi and the hotel porter immediately took charge of our bags. Check in was courteous and efficient and we were taken to our room and shown where all the main facilities were - restaurant, breakfast room. bars, pool, spa - on the way. All the staff were brilliant. I can only fault them on one thing - the breakfast on our second morning was a bit dis-organised but on the other four mornings it was perfect. Buffet with a good range of breads, meats, cheeses, cereals, fruits and fruit juices. Oh and champagne. One word of caution, this hotel is on its own island and he shuttle boat takes about 15 minutes one way. For most of the day there is a 20 minute service but there are some notable 40 minute gaps around lunch time and at 6 and 7 pm. Before and after these gaps the boat is quite busy and you could be unlucky as the boat only takes 34 people max. The hotel can arrange a free water taxi to / from Murano but be warned and only take this offer up if you intend to buy some glassware - there is, as we expected, pressure to buy.

Reviews.Title: “luxury resort”
Reviews.Author: Whatnameiaat
Reviews.Content: excellent service, beautiful rooms, location is amazing. set on an island just off the central part of Venice. shuttle goes back and forth all day. stay was luxurious, highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Still a 5 star experience,”
Reviews.Author: MarionMontgomery
Reviews.Content: Yet another great stay at this superb hotel. We enjoyed the delights of Carnivale and whilst Venice was heaving the oasis that is San Clemente yet again proved why it is simply one of the best. We again secured a great deal for 3 nights and everything was superb, as it has been previously. The service was impeccable from the concierge to the maids, there was nothing significant to fault. We didnâ€™t use the restaurant as there was too much happening â€œover the waterâ€� but we enjoyed the serenity of the bar after a busy day. Breakfast continues to be superb with just one small complaint â€“ eggs were an extra, this seemed a petty and silly thing to do. This is a 5 star grand dame of a hotel, it is maturing with age. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “The staff could not be more attentive and the facilities were excellent.”
Reviews.Author: mouseHerts
Reviews.Content: I would fully recommend this hotel. It lived up to its 5 star rating. The staff could not be more attentive and the facilities were excellent. The concierge in particular was very helpful. If you want a haven of quiet in the midst of a busy and noisy city, this is the place to go. It is on its own island with pool, tennis court and mini golf. It also has a spa and small gym. It is 10 minutes by boat from St Mark's Square and the complimentary shuttle service runs frequently from early morning until past midnight - every 20 minutes at busy times. It is wonderful place for all to stay, but it is a magical setting for honeymooners or those celebrating a special anniversary.

Reviews.Title: “No wifi, sort of a hassle to get to”
Reviews.Author: hambonez
Reviews.Content: First of all the wifi would not work with our iPads. Not only that, but even if it did, it was outrageously expensive. As far as the location, you have to take their shuttle to get to Venice. So you always have to think the schedule through, which made it hard to back to the hotel during the day. There was only one boat in use so it was 40 minutes between pickups. We missed one one morning by a minute even though we were early, and had to wait 40 minutes just to start our day in Venice. However the hotel was immaculate and quiet, the jacuzzi in the spa was nice, though it would be good if it stayed open later than 7 pm. The breakfast was very good too.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: EMKBrown
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay at San Clemente, beautiful rooms, exclusive location, friendly staff, good food. The boat to San Marco was ideal and stopped the location being any hassle, although I was under the impression before we arrived that they were 24 hours and they actually stopped at 1.40am. Only issues - spa area was quite small, water pressure in bathroom not great, sink plug didn't work (although if we'd mentioned it they may well have fixed it). Breakfast was very tasty. All in all a very happy experience - wish we could have spent more time there.

Reviews.Title: “Good but not great.”
Reviews.Author: MIchaelBUk
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel at carnival time and stayed in one of the junior suites with a view of venice - which was as others have said a great room, but not a suite. Check in team are wonderfully efficient, maids superb, concierge average at best by 5 star standards. It is great to be away from the city but the hotel lacked warmth - we stayed 3 nights and were never greeted with a hello etc at the hotel entrance. We ate in the hotel restaurant as part of the package and the meal was at best average. I can imagine the hotel being great in the Summer and we would stay here again but I honestly think this hotel could be better.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel - jury's out about the location!”
Reviews.Author: MrsFfromtheUK
Reviews.Content: We just spent three nights at the San Clemente Palace. The hotel itself is unquestionably five star, from the service you receive to the decor and quality food. We were kindly upgraded to a bigger room as it was my birthday and it was very comfortable. We had a lovely 'night in' at the hotel bar, rain lashing on the windows outside, just relaxing in cosy armchairs, drinking delicious cocktails and soaking up the classical music (feeling very smug about our choice of not making the journey over to the main island!). My husband was completely ambivalent about the 15 minute boat trip to get you to and from Venice itself but I have to say that I found it a bit dull after the first couple of trips and part of me wished that we had plumped to stay on the mainland (especially as the boat was every 40 minutes so sometimes there was a wait on the dock in the rain if you hadn't timed things right). But the hotel can't be blamed for the weather and I imagine the grounds are stunning and a lovely respite in the height of summer. One final negative for me was that the spa was broken/closed for the duration of our stay and both masseuses had called in sick, so the main reason for booking this hotel was taken away from us. Very, very disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Very pricey but excellent quality hotel”
Reviews.Author: virenb
Reviews.Content: Located on an island about 10 mins away from Venice by water boat, the hotel is away form the hustle and bustle of tourist areas. That is a positive as well as a negative. The best thing about the hotel is that it has large landscaping area so in good weather you can roam around in the hotel compound. It is ideal if you wanna relax and do not want to do much of moving around. However we found the service to be a bit poor. We ordered for corkscrew and we had to call at least three times to make them send us the same. One of the wine glasses in our room was pretty dirty. Being a 5 star resort this should not have been overlooked. We were disappointed with the breakfast as the variety was very limited. There was hardly any vegetarian dish - no baked beans, no hash brownies, not even toasted bread. Toasted bread, omlette were chargeable and not included in the buffet breakfast. The room was pretty spacious and the amenities were of superior quality. However, the bathroom was pretty cold and was not having approrpriate heating taking into account that the outside temperature was around 4 degrees celcius. The WiFi was not working. We were informed that this was problem with Vodafone rather than the hotel. However the hotel staff did state that they can allow one of their computers for use by guests, if requied. My recommendation is go for this hotel if you want luxury and want to relax rather than move around a lot in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Superb”
Reviews.Author: Fengo
Reviews.Content: What can I say that isnâ€™t over the top? noting, this is a hotel on top of its game . Service is excellent staff are excellent (good English) and hotel is outstanding as well as the food. Breakfast is excellent but could have a egg chef but Iâ€™m nit picking there as the choice is top. Bar can be expensive like all 5 star hotels. I mentioned my wifeâ€™s birthday and we got room upgrade as well as a bottle of bubbly and strawberries. Boat trip takes about 12 mins and goes every 20 mins peak and 40 mins off peak but if you want a boat out of normal hours they will arrange one no extra charge. The grounds are outstanding and well worth a walk. All in all this is one of the best hotel experiences I have had and I will be back for sure. Another tip register with thi.it (Turin hotels international) here you will get room upgrade and more. John Dublin

Reviews.Title: “Romantic”
Reviews.Content: We stayed at San Clemente for our wedding anniversary and would recommend this hotel to everyone. Our room was very elegant and the staff was very friendly. We enjoyed the water taxi from the hotel to the center as San Clemente is on a private island ( day and night is lovely to see ), for some people may interpret this as an inconvenience but it depends on your spirit of adventure considering you are in Venice. I would recommend this hotel especially in the summer as the private island has a golf course, swimming pool and other amenities which we were not abble to appreciate. Indoor jacuzzi and spa are terrific to have the benefit of during the colder months.

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent Resort for your Venice Holiday”
Reviews.Author: Lorrence
Reviews.Content: Beautiful island resort, ten minutes from St. Mark's square with its own boat that runs every twenty minutes. The restoration of this monastery is exquisite. Large, comfortable rooms, wonderful breakfasts, a pool and tennis courts for the kids and other amenities. You can take a break from exploring Venice.

Reviews.Title: “An overdue post - a fabulous experience”
Reviews.Author: bmatraveler
Reviews.Content: My wife, our 3 small children and I stayed at the San Clemente in early August of 2010 and had a most memorable stay. The grounds are simply stunning, the service top rate and the breakfast of the highest quality (and quantity). Although some might find the distance from San Marco, I actually looked forward to the shuttle boat rides... the boats are pristine and the captains highly professional. I shall never forget the (highly supervised) "turns as the wheel" that each of my girls got. We found this a perfect place for our family as I was able to spend the heat of the day at the pool with the kids while my wife shopped in town. In the late afternoon, we joined her for some more shopping and dinner. If there is any drawback to the hotel it's that other than the incredible breakfast buffet, food options are limited to the pool bar and formal restaurant, each of which are very highly priced. We will be back. (P.S. Although nothing to do with the hotel, STAY AWAY FROM MURANO!!! I am kicking myself for not remembering how awful an experience it was on my last visit to Venice 20 years ago. There is no reason to subject yourself to an hour of browbeating in a showroom of glass figurines. They will gladly wisk you over there, but good luck getting back....)

Reviews.Title: “Just love this hotel - I am happy returning visitor!”
Reviews.Author: WinnerMoscow_Russia
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visit Italy several times a year, but usually Rome and Toscana region. But this time weâ€™ve decided to start our trip from a 3 nights stay in Venice and in San Clemente in particular. This was my second visit to San Clemente â€“ the 1st one was in 2008 during business conference. Back then for 1 extra night apart from the conference I stayed at Luna Bagnioli in the very city center which was also great, but to start our vacation in Italy this time I had no doubts in choosing San Clemente. And this time our trip was a success â€“ we liked everything, though we have not been using SPA facilities and did not try any of restaurants in the hotel except for breakfast. And we just loved to sip our drinks at the bar as digestive after great dinners in the city. We were located on the 3rd floor and had a room with a marvelous view to San Marco and water. And I just loved to open the window and breathe fresh Venetian air! Special thanks we would like to say to Alessandro Caraceni at Front Desk â€“ very professional, keen to detail and devoted to his work. And all the concierges were doing their job just great, giving good advice on all the questions asked. The only minus Iâ€™ve experienced personally was related to sea-sickness I developed couple of times during mooring of the boat. As we were in Venice at the very beginning of November the wind was quite strong and my body felt rolling very well developing sea-sickness. So 1st steps on the ground were not always easy for me even considering that you spent on the boat about 10 min each time you come to/from San Marco. It has nothing to do with this very special and great hotel though, I just shared it in case if you are very sensitive to sea-sickness and/or travel with kids as you are to use the boat several time during the day if you wish to leave this loveliest island isolated hotel. Anyway, even in spite of my small personal inconvenience above I would just LOVE to return immediately to San Clemente and highly recommend it to everyone travelling to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “A great escape”
Reviews.Author: ChilliChef
Reviews.Content: As wonderful as Venice is, the experience was heightened by staying at thebfabulous San Clemente Palace. Wonderfully elegant and palatial, the hotel is welcoming and very comfortable. Staff arevfriendly and professional and all ofnthe amenities, from the pool to the bar are first class. Would reccomend highly and look forward to visiting again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel... great staff”
Reviews.Author: aliciajones
Reviews.Content: We had the most wonderful experience here! It is located on a small island but only 12 min from the center of Venice activity by boat.... made our trip to Venice even that much better!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but away from the main centre”
Reviews.Author: JayneEgan
Reviews.Content: A large fairly clinical hotel but good sized rooms and comfortable

Reviews.Title: “What a great place to stay!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: HappyRetiree22
Reviews.Content: Along with another couple, my wife and I took our first trip to Italy. What a great place to stay to kick off a wonderful 3 week trip through Italy. The hotel sits on it's own island just minutes off of the Grand Canal. For the convenience of the guests, the hotel offers free boat service every 20 minutes to St. Marks Square. After a busy day in Venice it is nice to get away from the crowd and enjoy some peace and quiet. The hotel consumes the entire island. The grounds, the pool and the views from the island are beautiful. The hotel is beautiful also! Every area of the hotel is as neat and clean as you would hope. The staff is very very friendly and helpful. We had breakfast included in our stay and the breakfast was outstanding. We sat outside in the courtyard every morning for breakfast. Very nice!!! Our experience at the San Clemente Palace Hotel was outstanding. We would highly recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely location”
Reviews.Author: chocolategoddess
Reviews.Content: I can thoroughly recommend both a visit to Venice and a stay in this hotel. Venice is astonishing and the hotel very comfortable. My husband and I stayed at the San Clemente for 5 nights at the beginning of September. We chose this hotel primarily because it has a swimming pool and good sized gardens. I was convinced that Venice would feel claustraphobic if staying in a hotel with no outside space during hot whether. I was very pleased with my choice because after sight-seeing there was nothing nicer than coming back and lounging by the pool. The hotel is on a small island about 15 to 20 minutes by hotel boat. The hotel's boat stops right next to San Marco so is very convenient. The boats are charming, and as I like boats, this added to the holiday. They run about every 20 minutes. Our room looked over the water to Venice. It was a beautiful view. The room itself was, as you'd expect, good quality, designed in standard international hotel style. It was very comfortable and attractive. Again, as you'd expect the bathroom was marble and worked well. The breakfast was excellent. There was lots of choice, both hot and cold, and everything was attractive and good quality. We used the hotel bar on several occasions. Expect to pay about Â£18 in total for a beer and a prosecco. Overall, I would thoroughly recommend this hotel. I would happily return. Prepare yourself for high prices for the room, the drinks and the meals. However, everything in Venice is expensive so 'in for a penny, in for a pound'.

Reviews.Title: “Truly 5 stars”
Reviews.Author: BelgianLady
Reviews.Content: We arrived late at Treviso airport (booked transfer from www.daytrip.it which included private pick up and drop off then water taxi directly to hotel pier for same price as taxi and public transportation from Piaz. roma), immediately felt welcome: drop off at san Clemente pier, welcome by concierge; walk down the garden lit with tiki torches. Huge room, very high ceilings, venician palace atmosphere, all usual amenities for 5 star hotel. The room was very quiet; we never heard cleaning ladies or any noise at night or morning. The (free hotel) shuttle to San Marco was convienent with service every 20 minutes, never had to wait much. For busy professionals, we appreciated to be a little outside the city hustle and bustle while at a nice 15 minutes boat trip from San marco, the hotel grounds are huge, well kept and very relaxing. There is also a free direct service to Murano that the concierge can arrange (otherwise you can purchase a tourist boat pass and go by yourself, via San Marco). We didnt eat there; as we enjoyed eating in the city, but had a few cocktails in the garden, right by the sea which was really nice.Hotel staff was always nice and helpful. Great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Gardens and position”
Reviews.Author: 4Noels
Reviews.Content: It was my first time to Venice so I didn't know what to expect. The water taxi in a speed boat from Marco Polo Airport directly to the Hotel which is positioned on it's own Island. It was an Old Monastry converted into a 5* Hotel sat amongst vast green lawns and beautifully kept gardens housing the outdoor pool with bar/restaurant. The room was comfortable with modern amenities, good shower, great bed, fabulous views of the grounds and then beyond the surrounding waters. The staff were accommodating, efficient and helpful. It wasn't cheap, but then again this is Venice, and frankly we paid the same amount in poor restaurants just outside San Marco so we were quite keen to get back to the hotel to eat in style. Breadfast was one of best I've had. Everything fresh, croisants baked that morning, choice of many juices, etc.. Very little entertainment, but that wasn't the style of the hotel, this was discrete and upmarket. Would definitely re-visit.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: diogenesthecynic
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here as part of our honeymoon and had an absolutely wonderful time. The staff were fantastic and went out of their way to make our special occasion even more special, with lots of thoughtful extra touches.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful wedding lunch - Thank you”
Reviews.Author: LondonJc
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the hotel before and loved its unique and romantic setting. In July we decided to marry at the Palazzo Cavalli on the Grand Canal and that we would stay with our family at San Clemente. All of our guests were made extremely comfortable and a private lunch after the ceremony on the terrace overlooking the Lagoon was exceptional. This really is a first rate hotel and I recommend it highly. In the summer, the beautiful grounds and swimming pool are a real bonus for a venice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful With Unacceptable Service”
Reviews.Author: simonmorse
Reviews.Content: We are staying here right now and are very disappointed. The hotel is beautiful and well appointed; however, the service is unacceptable. Sometimes, cannot get reception on the phone. Door key would not work and they would not send someone with a new key. Had to go back to reception. In the room, the scale did not work, the shower head was partially clogged, the temperature cannot be adjusted without calling reception (good luck!). The TVs are old-no flat screen in our room. Internet service is fee-based, and when you puchase, say a 1 hour block, your time ends 1 hour later. You cannot spread the hour over several days by signing off and on. The bar prices are ridiculous. We paid $50 US for two vodka tonics. Don't know the room rate since we were on a pre-paid tour but suspect it is a poor value. It also is isolated, on its own island. There is boat service to and from the main island but we would like to have been able to leave our room and just be where the shopping and dining is. Not the hotel's problem but a point to consider.

Reviews.Title: “An island of sanity.”
Reviews.Author: elveril007
Reviews.Content: It woud be very hard to find a better place to stay in Venice than the San Clemente. The building is awesome, there is a free 12 min. boat trip to St Mark's and back which runs every 20 mins. all day and all evening till 11:40pm then every 40 mins till 1:20 am, the food is of a high quality though not Michelin star standard or anywhere near. The hotel has a pool which is fantastic to relax by after a morning of intense culture followed by a good lunch in Venice. Down sides to be aware of: No free WiFi - you have to pay by credit card for it. Very expensive bar which is usually empty for that reason. No hot drink making facility in room. No toast with breakfast No egg chef at breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: milllon
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 days with our 2 young children. The hotel is spotless throughout and the rooms are very well presented. The rooms are large and airy (the ceilings are very high) with great views over the lagoon. The beds are exceptional - v. large with superb firm mattresses and the most beautiful bed linen. The air conditioning is a problem (as noted by a previous reviewer) - despite having a digital control in the room it is actually not possible to change the temp in the room by more than one degree either way. It took a day for reception to admit that this was the case and then to 'adjust' the temperature centrally. However it takes 8-10 hours for the temp to change and then unfortunately it was too cold - and we needed extra blankets to sleep!!! The breakfast was good with a full range of fresh fruits, pastries, juices etc. Service could have been a lot better - very slow to bring a hot drink and no smile!! Be warned - any cooked food from the kitchen will be charged as an extra (e.g porridge is 8 Euros!!!) Boat service from the hotel ran very well and to time - the return service was not as punctual. The boat stop was really well located - v.close to St Mark's Square. The boats were clean and comfortable. The hotel is set out v.well in a large open space with lovely grounds and great views, The pool areas is very well laid out with plenty of beds and a pool bar. Unfortunately the beds are not v.comfortable and awkward to adjust. There are insufficient umbrellas and a complete absence of shade - no wonder so many guests were sunburnt!!!! The pool had no shallow end and there is no children's pool. Overall a good hotel and an enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “... how is it possible to criticize this hotel?”
Reviews.Author: RuthSwitzerland
Reviews.Content: PERFECTION!!! How can anyone find anything negative to say about the San Clemente: Venice is crazy... and the San Clemente was our saviour. It is, quite simply, the loveliest hotel. Our suite was enormous, and the sense of space here is wonderful after a day in the crowded city-centre. Breakfast in the courtyard was fantastic, dinner in the restaurant looking out over the water to the city at sunset was breathtaking and the grounds - vast, immaculately kept... I could go on and on... but I'll get to the point... just go and see for yourselves!!!

Reviews.Title: “It was nice to be back!”
Reviews.Author: lovetrav
Reviews.Content: I have reviewed this hotel in July 2006 in very complimentary terms.Since standards tend to slip (rarely improve) I thought it worthwhile to report on my findings for the benefit of future visitors. I have no reason to change anything I wrote then. This time we had a much better room (upgrade) which was a plus. The frequency of the boat service to San Marco has been reduced (every 40minutes, instead of 20) but adequate for our purposes.One slight hitch in the swimming pool.It appeard to be somewhat overrun on the week-end (non-resident visitors?) As a result: a rationing of towels on the following days-which shouldn't happen. Compared to other 5*L hotels the hotel price is not unreasonable.Still loved it

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous,Faultless,your own oasis.”
Reviews.Author: jackpalance
Reviews.Content: We had just returned from a six* cruise so we were expecting the best from this hotel & we certainly received it. The hotel is huge but fabulously renovated. The rooms are large with wonderful bathrooms. The gardens & pool area are the best with service from the pool bar really excellent. We had one dinner in our two night stay which again was faultless, to sit on the terrace eating & drinking whilst looking out at San Marco is really special. Venice is beautiful but hard work if you want to see everything so to come back to San Clemente on your own private boat to relax & recuperate is the way to do it! For your return water taxi to the airport, try to share with another guest or two as it is â‚¬106! unless you use the aquillana (not advisable). If there is one down side it has to be the cost, it is expensive but worth it, there are plenty of "extras" thrown in & the staff are brilliant, with nothing to much trouble. We will stay again when in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Hated San Clemente Palace”
Reviews.Author: lisalane23
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately we stayed at the San Clemente Palace for 3 nights recently. I will go into details, but overall the front desk and concierge were rude and incompetent, the rooms were shabby and dirty and the atmosphere is more like the mental hospital that it once was than the hotel that it tries to pass itself off as being. From the moment that we arrived we were unhappy. We had traffic getting to the hotel from Florence and did not get in until 9:40 pm. We originally had a 9 pm reservation at the hotel restaurant. The concierge told us that if we were not seated by 10 pm, that they would not serve us. After getting our luggage, we rushed to dinner and made it by 10. While we were sitting in the restaurant, several parties came in after us, one even arrived at 10:30. We were upset that we did not even have time to freshen up or change before dinner. The hotel has a strange appearance and creepy feeling. You never see any people even though it is quite large. The hallways are enormous so there is no charm or warmth. There were red stains on the carpet in the main hallway leading to our rooms and half of the large lanterns used as lights for the hallways were not working. It reminded me of Shutter Island and the Shining wrapped up into one hotel/hospital. We learned that it was once a mental hospital that was closed because of inhumane treatment to its patients. Our rooms were also not what we expected. The bathrooms were dirty and the shower grout and tile was missing in spots. The furniture was dingy. In the bathroom there was one sink and the toilet was almost in the shower. When you showered, there was only a trickle of water coming out of the spout and the water temperature kept changing from hot to cold. The toilet never flushed properly. July in Venice is hot and our air conditioning did not work. It would not go below 22.5 degrees celsius. We found out from someone else staying at the hotel that you needed to ask them to lower the air conditioning for your room at the main computer. We did, and it worked for our room, but did not work for our children's room. After complaining all day about the heat in my children's room, at 12:30 am, the maintenance man admitted that the air conditioning in that particular room never really worked properly and asked us if we would like to switch rooms. At that time, 2 of our 3 children were sleeping, so we did not change. On our last night, we arrived back to our hotel room after dinner and one of our windows was open. We are not sure why the housekeeper opened it, because it was oppressively hot outside. However, there was a rain storm that night and our packed bag that was sitting under the window was drenched. A Louis Vuitton clutch (a gift for my husband's mother), 4 watercolor paintings we had purchased of Venice, and my son's movie poster were all ruined. The bag was soaked, as were the curtains and the carpet. We called down to the concierge to complain. The concierge, the only person on duty at the hotel at night, barely spoke English and said that there was nothing he could do to help us. Housekeeping was closed so they could not even dry the bag. The hotel never apologized or offered to do anything to make up for the damage. When we finally left the hotel, the bill was incorrect. They tried to charge us inflated rates for both of our rooms. We showed them the written confirmation from our travel agent, and they lied and said that they had sent her an email changing the rate. We called our travel agent who confirmed that they had never changed the original price. My husband, fed up from our whole terrible experience, gave them his credit card, but told them that he was not paying the higher fee-he would take it up with the credit card company when we got the statement from them. When we went down to the dock to get into our water taxi for the airport, the hotel kept the water taxi at the dock and would not let us leave. They essentially held us hostage until my husband agreed to pay the inflated rates. We almost missed our flight. It was a terrible experience. To pay so much money to stay at a hotel like that is insane. We have never been to such an awful hotel and would not recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “"Shelter from the storm"”
Reviews.Author: Tallmantraveling49
Reviews.Content: This is your own island and the boat ride back/forth to San Marco square alone makes it worthwhile...no cheaper/better view in Venice. The escape from the San Marco hustle/bustle is most welcome...and then you come to a really first class hotel. We were very pleased with the service (there is a waiter, Roberto, who is about the best we have ever experienced), the quality of the rooms and public spaces is superb, and it is its own resort...one afternoon sitting by the pool with great pool side service was a welcome and unusual Venetian experience. Yes, some things are a little more expensive...but you are on an island! Breakfast was first rate and our one dinner experience (with kudos to Roberto) was superb. Be prepared to WALK it was 100 meters just down one magnificent hallway to our room. Don't overlook the chapel...a little quality tourist/historic site in its own regard...and part of the history of the place. Magnificent and different place...worth the splurge...never mind your always ready private launch to San Marco Square.

Reviews.Title: “Impressive, sumptuous but a little austere”
Reviews.Author: Hampstead186338
Reviews.Content: I went to the San Clemente with my partner who was attending a conference there. Its location, on an island in the lagoon, a twelve minute boat ride from San Marco, seems to be its major selling-point and, initially at least, it's great to escape back to the hotel after the crowds of high-season Venice. After a few days however, I found the to-ing and fro-ing a teeny bit wearisome, despite the glorious views everywhere and the highly efficient shuttle service on the hotel's private launches i.e. you can't just pop out for an impulsive stroll round the city as you could from a more central hotel; it becomes a slight expedition, albeit a pleasant one. The hotel buildings are VAST and slightly austere with endlessly long corridors and, despite the extreme luxury of the transformation, it is easy to see the ghost of the huge hospital it used to be. It could never be called an intimate hotel. I'd rather like somebody to bulldoze the existing edifice and create something on a more human scale. By contrast, the gardens are exquisitely landscaped with a beautiful pool , a family of tame rabbits and fantastic views out over the Lagoon in every direction. There is also an impressive semi-restored church attached to the hotel and an outside waterside restaurant for summer dining which must be one the loveliest places to eat anywhere in the world, looking across towards the campanili of Venice. Our room was very large, impeccably decorated with excellent beds, loads of hanging space and a massive and luxurious bathroom. I notice another reviewer commenting on the old-fashioned TV set. Who cares? You're in Venice; go and look at a Titian instead. The staff were all very friendly and extremely professional - a delightful group of people. The San Clemente is undoubtedly extremely expensive. At the pool, a tiny bottle of Perrier (three gulps and it's gone) was 5 euros. A club sandwich with fries in the bar was 24 euros (intrinsic value about 2 euros I'd guess) And don't have the room service breakfast - for 22 euros, I got ONE teabag and five very sad-looking rolls - by bizarre contrast the buffet breakfast downstairs is generous enough to keep you going till dinner. To summarise, I really enjoyed four days there. One would have to be a spoiled brat not to do so. It is however very expensive and the island location, however much of an oasis from the crowds, I personally found to be a double-edged sword. I was there in perfect weather and could enjoy the gardens; I'd not like to have been marooned out there in the rain.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay at a wonderful oasis”
Reviews.Author: KMAC12
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the San Clemente during our honeymoon for 3 nights and we are so glad that we did. Loved that the hotel is on a private island. Venice is very crowded and it was really nice to be able to be away from it for it a bit. They knew it was our honeymoon and when we got to our room (a junior suite) a bottle of prosecco and chocolate covered strawberries were waiting for us. Our room looked faced the lagoon with a great view of Venice. It was a great way to start a visit to Venice....which we loved. We arrived to Venice by train and took the vaporetti (water bus) to San Marco. Once there, we located the shuttle to the hotel, about a 20 minute ride. My husband at times gets motion sickness and I was a bit worried about having to take the shuttle to/from San Marco, it was no issue at all and we had rain everyday in Venice. Our rate included breakfast. There were eggs, breakfast meats, rolls, pastries, cakes, cheese, yogurt, lots of fruit. They also had a gluten free and diet section. There is something for everyone. They also have prosecco by the juices....I made a mimosa everyday. One reviewer mentioned that it wasn't opened. I only experience that one day and I asked one the the wait staff to open it. Think I may have been the only one drinking it that morning. There was plenty of staff and they were very attentive, getting coffee/cappuccino, clearing plates. The grounds are lovely to walk around and at night the path to the water shuttle has torches lit, very nice to come back to after an evening in Venice. The pool was opening the week after we were there so we didn't get to use it, but it looked nice. Our room was very nice... junior suite with a king size bed. Bed was comfy and the room quiet. I like to take a relaxing bubble bath, the tub was deep and filled up pretty quickly. We were traveling in Italy for 2 weeks and didn't want to pack a lot. I didn't bring a lot of toiletries, I used the ones provided by the hotel and they were very good. The concierge staff was very helpful, especially the gentleman that worked during the day when we were there, wish I could remember his name. We need a train ticket changed and he took care of it for us. As well as providing recommendations/reservations, etc.. We arranged a trip to Murano from the hotel and instead of having us brought back to San Marco, which is usual, they arranged for us to be taken to the Jewish Ghetto which we wanted to see. We enjoyed our time in Venice and staying at the San Clemente enchanced our experience. We really enjoyed being a bit away from the crowds.

Reviews.Title: “Good 4 star hotel with great potential to be 5 star”
Reviews.Author: love_steve
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 3 nights in April. Had a junior suite room via Amex with the rate of 390 Euros, which included breakfast buffet plus 85 euros hotel credit (credit per stay, not per night). Positives: The property has very large and beautiful gardens. The setting was simply fabulous, with the gorgeous hotel buildings. This would be the strongest point of this property. And the property is very quiet. Good relief from the hustle and bustle of Venice. Pool was closed in April so we can't provide any comment on it. Welcome fruit plate with some chocolate on arrival (along with a welcome card from hotel management) was of good quality. 5 star service. A small bottle of water was provided -for free- for each guest everyday at turndown service, this is just a normal 5 star service though. Hotel bar was wonderful. Very good ambience with great quality of drinks, aside from its cheap BGM (a bit too casual I felt). My husband says he had his "best daiquiri ever" there. The lagoon view from the room was amazing. Also the great point of this property. Negatives: Room- it was good-sized enough, nicely appointed, with a large walk-in wardrobe/closet. But speaking of the room category, the room wasn't of a 'junior suite' class but just a normal 'deluxe room' which you'll expect when in 5 star hotels. As a deluxe room in 5 star, it was very good I must say. But a junior suite?? No. Wrongly labeled. Also, there was no DVD player nor iPod connectivity in the room. The TV was not with large screen and was of outdated. We also didn't like the fact that no coffee or tea making facility was there inside, no mug cup was there even. So inconvenient and disappointing. It's not a 5 star again. But later in Milan, we found the same was true with the room of the Four Seasons Milan!! WHY was that, Four Seasons?? Perhaps this might be an Italian hotel standard, since they don't care for 'regular coffee' I guess. -Sorry if I'm wrong. Internet- The pricing was very expensive. About 15-20 euros per 1 day but I forgot the exact fees, sorry. The truth is that the internet service here is managed by Vodafone Italia. Therefore, the hotel doesn't accept any responsibility for any internet malfunctions or pricing. We also didn't like their way either. Anyway, when you try to use internet in the room, you'll be firstly connected to Vodafone web page, which explains the fees and conditions. Also you'll have to type in your credit card info for the settlement. This means you can't make it included in the bill of your stay. In Tokyo, almost all the 4-5 star hotels provide internet service for FREE. So we really didn't like such a high pricing, but, later in Milan again, we found it was even higher in FS Milan than in San Clemente... Breakfast- I agree with all the negative comments about the breakfast buffet. To us, the biggest problem was the quality. Not tasty, just mediocre. Far from 5 star's quality . Even as a 4 star hotel, it would be 'only just par'. After the first breakfast of our stay, we totally gave up the idea to have dinner/lunch in the hotel. We also didn't like the fact that the buffet selection was never changed during our stay; same pastries, same hot meals, same cheese selections for example. It's not a 5 star hotel again! Speaking of Prosecco, Italian sparkling wine, yes there it was - but we never saw the bottle uncorked during our stay. So, just help yourself or wait for someone, or have someone to uncork the bottle. Bathroom- Beautiful marble bathroom with a separated shower booth, however, we didn't expect a single basin when staying in the 'junior suite'. And so, it didn't have enough space for putting make-up items on. But the main problems on the bathroom were; 1) Shower was very weak, and sometimes wasn't hot enough at all. 2) The hair dryer was out of date and immovable (fixed to the wall). Hot air from the dryer was also weak, plus you'll have to keep on pressing the button to get it on. Service- Just hit and miss, overall. Tips: City/Hotel map is provided on the writing-desk in the room. Very handy and convenient. But if I were hotel management, I definitely would print the shuttle boat timetable on it... Don't forget to get the timetable at the concierge before you go out. Curiously enough it wasn't provided in the room. WHY?? Perhaps you might have difficulty in locating the jetty to the hotel (means the shuttle stop, from Venice to the hotel). You can see the image of the jetty in my pictures. Here's the more details how to get there; From the nearest Vaporetto or water-bus stop (named San Marco XXXXX), you'll walk for just a few minutes to the jetty. Please remember, if you come to the Ducale Palace, you've already gone too far. If you find the shuttle jetty for the 'Hotel Cipriani', which is much easier to find, you just should step back. Look around and you'll find a small wooden 'TAXI' station/stall(see my picture 10/10) nearby the Cipriani jetty. The San Clemente shuttle boat stop is located a few meters away from the taxi station, a few meters away 'to the direction of' the Vapporetto stop. All in all, I would call it 'a good 4 star hotel with great potential to be 5 star' , as in the title of my review. The location and the settings (both gardens and the buildings) are really unique and fabulous, just right for a 5 star level. However, if the hotel remains just the same, in particular about the breakfast, we might look for another 5 star hotel next time. When all is said, it was very good hotel for the price we paid. If it were a real shining 5 star just like Four Seasons, Mandarin Oriental, Ritz-Carlton or whatever, you'd not be able to stay here at this price range in Italy.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Honeymoon Days”
Reviews.Author: FZaluski
Reviews.Content: I was planning my honeymoon trip using the Trip Advisor and I've found the San Clemente. Almost all reviews were good and i decided to check prices. It was not the cheapest one, but in comparison with the others hotels in the same category (and most of the rest on inferior categories) was awsome. I've made the reservation and when we get there it was a Dream! Upon you arrive at Piazza San Marco, you have the free shuttle (boat) to the hotel - yes, it is in an Island - wich is very charming. On your way to the hotel, you pass just in front of the (expensive) Cipriani where you may see some celebrites if you're lucky. The hotel is magnific, the lobby is very beautiful and the concierge helps you on all your needs. We've got a free room upgrade as I'm a member of the leading hotels of the world. The room was very spacious and have an excelent view of the Venice Lagoon (PS: the hotel left for us a Prosseco and strawberrys with chocolate as a welcome). They clean and organise the room twice a day. The hotel area is huge and have a golf camp, fitness center, spa, jacuzzi and many other things to do. But watch out for the service room. They have different prices for everywhere. The menu in the room is different as your order is made before or after 10PM and is different for the bar and for the restaurant. Even the drinks have different prices, and you might order the same wine or prosseco from the restaurant cheaper than the Bar, even if you're seated at the bar (ask for the menu from the restaurant). Ah! And the breakfest, wich is amazing (but be sure to have it on your reservation, as it is incredible expensive if you order it there). After all was one of the best - not to say the better - part of my honeymoon trip.

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: judyspan
Reviews.Content: After reading many varied reviews of different hotels in Venice we booked this one to celebrate our 10th Wedding Anniverstay, and were not disappointed. It was fantastic, they knew about our anniversary and upgraded us to a junior suite overlooking the gardens and the lagoon, and a bottle of champerss with strawberries dipped in chocolate awaited us in our room on arrival. The perfect start to our romantic stay. The hotel was immaculate and beautiful, the bed was comfortable, spa was lovely, All the staff were extremely helpful, and made an effort to remember your name. The shuttle boat into venice was fantastic, every 20 mins during the day, and only a 10/15 min boat ride away. Booking on the Island, meant coming away from the hustle and bustle of Venice to the tranquility of the hotel was just right. I would reccomend this hotel to anyone looking for a romantic break. Probably not the best place to stay for children though..... a little bit too grown up!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent; truly first class”
Reviews.Author: sparklerhino
Reviews.Content: We stayed a the San Clemente Palace over Easter, and couldn't have had a better time. We chose to book a private water transfer (through the hotel), and it was the perfect and very glamorous way to arrive. We had been upgraded to a room overlooking the lagoon, and the view was very special indeed. The hotel is beautiful, absolutely spotlessly clean, the service perfect. With regard to the hotel I could not find one thing to compain about. When looking for a hotel I had being undecided as to whether to stay on one of the islands or whether to stay in Venice itself. On arrival and during our stay I was very satisfied that I had made the decision to stay on the island. Venice was very very busy, and the other hotels I had looked at (all Leading Hotels of the World, from their website) in Venice were no-where near as beautiful. It also felt very glamorous to be arriving & departing by boat each time - somehow suitable for the location! If I was to find one downside, apart from breakfast ,I probably would not chose to eat at San Clemente - I had probably the worst club sandwich ever, and on Easter day there was a set meal in there restaurant that I had the impression was slightly over-ambitious and failed to meet my expectations. This should not etract from the hotel however, which I would totally recommend.

Reviews.Title: “THE HIDDEN GEM OF VENICE”
Reviews.Author: stlcruisegirl
Reviews.Content: Yes, there are many beaufiful hotels in Venice, and everyone wants to stay as close to the Piazza San Marco as possible, when in Venice, but with the popularity of Venice, its difficult getting away from the crowds, even in the best hotels on Venice Island. So the answer is to stay at the San Clemente Palace, located on San Clemente Island just 5 mins across the lagoon from Piazza San Marco. It is on the island by itself and used to be a cloister. The rooms are large, the property offers every amenity, and it is a quiet and peaceful escape from the noise and the crowds in Venice. They offer complimentary shuttles to and from the Piazza San Marco every 1/2 hour - 24/7 and will provide you a complimentary shuttle to the glass factory on Murano. (skip the tours to that include Burano and Torcello, there's nothing to see on those islands). The buffet breakfast is excellent and offers a wide selection of breakfast items including juices and prosecco (Italian champagne). The bar inside the hotel is a great place for a nightcap and the patio bar and restaurant next to the lagoon are a great place for dinner and to while away the evening. At dusk the hotel lights torches along all the pathways on the island and its an indescribable sight when you return from Venice on the launch and walk from the dock to the hotel with the path lined in torches. The hotel also offers a beautiful pool, which you can't find at any hotel in Venice island. After a morning in Venice, its nice to come back to the San Clemente Palace and take a cool dip in the pool and relax before returning back to Venice for a gondola ride. You can stay in a cramped, overpriced room in Venice near the Piazza San Marco, or you can get a nice large room, and a relaxing get-away, with anytime access to Venice by staying at the San Clemente Palace.

Reviews.Title: “The most memorable vacation ever”
Reviews.Author: mishy
Reviews.Content: I was whisked off to romantic Venice for a surprise 40th birthday present from my wonderful hubby. To jump off a plane on to a speedboat was one thing (very James Bond) but i could not believe my eyes when we pulled up outside the most exquisite hotel. From that moment on it was like stepping into a fairytale - i felt like royalty. This hotel cannot be faulted - its just luxury, good service and elegance through and through. And of course Venice is just amazing - we had the most fabulous time and its a trip i will never ever forget.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing place!”
Reviews.Author: unwired77
Reviews.Content: What an amazing place! If you are considering staying at the Clemente Palace then all i can say is do it! The staff were fabulous and the hotel faultless. The breakfasts were without doubt the most amazing i have ever had, the rooms were spacious and the bathrooms impressive. Arriving by motorlaunch in the evening with the hotel lit by torchlight in the distance is a thought i will always hold!

Reviews.Title: “25th Wedding Anniversary”
Reviews.Author: djkginger
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the San Clemente for the first 2 days of our 10-day Italy vacation and getaway. It was recommended by our travel agent, and she did not steer us wrong. This hotel is truly a palace, located on an island 15 minutes from Saint Marks Square. Hotel water taxi, free of charge, runs every 20 minutes. Hotel accomodations, including our guest room (which was upgraded on our arrival) was all first rate. Hotel staff from concierge, restaurant crew, maid staff, and shuttle personnel were among the best we ever encountered. Daily breakfast buffet was most memorable. Dinner in restaurant was a bit pricey, but normal for this type of accomodation. Staying off the mainland, a quiet destination such as the San Clemente, was an excellent decision. Very serene and elegant. We would return in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful... 1920 film star venue!”
Reviews.Author: FT2006
