Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel is designed to make you feel special; from my first e-mail communication with the staff I knew that it was going to be fantastic. The staff are helpful, friendly and fabulous and the hotel is just as perfect. Wow, even the approach to the hotel is excellent, across the water on the hotelâ€™s own beautiful boat, you approach the island and are greeted by smiling porters to help with your baggage. Check-in is smooth as silk and the reception staff show you to your room through the magnificent, sky high corridors, beneath the exquisite chandeliers. Everything about this hotel screams Bond. This is not a cheap hotel so donâ€™t quip about the rates or the price of drinks... if you want that experience, book through a tour and stay at a 3 star. But, on the budget note, get breakfast included in your rate as the buffet is 33 Euros a head. The rooms are fantastic, specious and silent. I have stayed all over the world and can say that I have never stayed in a hotel as quiet as this one. Even when there was obviously a party going on (lots of posh Italian frocks about) there was no noise at all.... Bliss! We had a view over the lagoon and across to St Mark's as room 332 is on a corner. It was superb. As I said, the staff are amazing, we booked into the hotel restaurant for dinner and in the morning at breakfast the breakfast host greeted us, took our room number and said, â€œAhhhh Mr Thompson, we are expecting you in the restaurant for dinner tonight, no?â€� superb service! Food is good, both breakfast and dinner, the boat service between the hotel and St Mark's is regular and we never had a problem being off main venice, in fact it was great to be out of the hustle and bustle. We walked everywhere, it was perfect. One of the things I liked best about Venice was the lack of car noise. It isnâ€™t until itâ€™s not there anymore that you realise how much it grates. I could rave about this place forever! Go! Enjoy! Itâ€™s worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “If you love Venice you'll love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: mrsglobe
Reviews.Content: High ceilings, large rooms, genuinely nice staff, beautiful gardens, and quiet, quiet , quiet! The perfect place to relax between hops to St. Marks square for shopping, eating, and sightseeing. The TV's are small, but you shouldn't be watching TV in Venice anway. They don't offer in-room coffee and tea kettles, but room service is reasonable and bottled water is provided free-of charge. They are on their own private island - it is only a 10 minute shuttle to St. Marks square (they have complimentary shuttles every 20 mn), the ride is lovely and my children especially enjoyed themselves. If you have been to Venice and loved the city but not where you stayed, then come again and stay at San Clemente.

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Engagement.”
Reviews.Author: rikkijay
Reviews.Content: My Fiancee and I got engaged at San Clemente Palace Hotel on November the 5th and I just wanted to say how perfect and romantic the setting and how special we were made to feel by all the staff. The service was second to none especially by the concierge who went above and beyond to make our romantic night so perfect. Thank you for an amazing time.

Reviews.Title: “Lofty vision of luxury that does not get realized”
Reviews.Author: Imladris
Reviews.Content: I just arrived in Venice today and am going to stay here for 4 days. The reason I am writing this review on my very first night instead of waiting till I return home is the fact that already in one day I am deeply frustrated with this hotel. I cannot believe that this hotel is rated 5-STAR and voted the "best hotel experience" by some notable travel surveys. It is beyond my comprehension to connect this hotel with luxury. The rooms, the service, the benefits - is all tantamount to 3-star at best. It's OK to be OK but don't say you're amazing when you're just alright!!! To start with, I arrived after a brutal red-eye flight from the US and could not wait to get to my room. But the people at the reception desk themselves escorted each guest to their respective rooms instead of hiring people to do this. This "luxury escorting service" caused a hold-up at the reception where people (including myself) had to wait until others were shown their room before they could be checked in. The next thing that hit me were the large lifeless corridors with no artwork, and - better still - NO PEOPLE. Looks like this hotel is not doing that well (rightfully so) as there are not many guests here at all - and they've shut three of their four restaurants! Then the room itself. Archaic television, old-fashioned furniture (under the veil of being charming), boring drab room design, no iron, no coffee machine, no free internet! What's more, they offer a ironing service at 35 euros for a suit. Room service and internet are equally expensive. The poor guest is left with little choice but to pay these high rates for standard services that one would expect even from a 4-star hotel, leave alone 5-star. This is extortion in the disguise of luxury. As icing on the cake, the air in my room did not work and I wanted the AC on. So I called the front desk and they SWITCHED OFF THE AIR IN MY ROOM. The explanation - no hot air so this will cool your room !?! More so - when I got back from an evening excursion around Piazza San Marco there was a huge flying bug waiting to welcome me in the room. It took some acrobatics to catch and kill it. With regard to the much-tooted about swimming pool - it is open only a few months every year (during the summer). So it pretty much did not exist for me. The gym was extremely basic. I still have to check out the "free" sauna / turkish bath but am not expecting anything out of the ordinary there. How then does this classify as luxury!! Here are some good things - the free shuttle service to San Marco every 20 minutes is convenient. But they have to have it in order to compete with other better 5-star hotels in the heart of the city. The concierge was polite and informative. The bathroom was all marble and very clean. The view from my room was nice. But weigh these against all the cons and you have an average, midscale hotel experience. DO NOT EVER STAY HERE!!!

Reviews.Title: “Would get top marks .... just the Restaurant ....”
Reviews.Author: Prokop62
Reviews.Content: Very good place ... on an island 10 min from St.Marcus sq. with Private boat ... what`s special about the place is the very kind crew at the front desk , Andreas, Giacomo, Francesco.. everybody very helpful - always willing to go the extra mile .... Rooms very nice (got upgraded to a suite...that helped i guess...) Breakfast very good, good gym ... so all i all (if you get a deal on the net) it would be really good .... BUT guys pls. work on the restaurant - as so many reviewers mentioned before - never mind that it is (even for venice) .. far to expensive... itÂ´s just plain bad cooking .... we were paying 2 btls of wine and food for 4 .. 440 Euros ... And then again, service team very kind and nice ... just fire the cook !! Anway ... if you know the above just go and find your way around in venice for food and then you`ve got a real nice place !

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: LizzieDB
Reviews.Content: A palace - luxury at it's best. Away from the hustle and bustle on it's own island with a complimentary shuttle boat to St Mark's Square every 20 mins. Friendly attentive staff. Comfortable rooms and beds Good breakfast. A bit pricey but well worth it. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Really lovely away from the bustle of the city”
Reviews.Author: fcmoll
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to Venice with another couple for 4 nights. We all had a great time. We had chosen this hotel for its location and facilities. We were able to go by hotel boat to Marco Polo square everyday and sightsee then return to the hotel play tennis, swim go to the gym or just relax. We had beautiful rooms lots of space and comfort. The food and drink was very expensive and did not merit such a price. The staff were all very friendly and did everything to assist - thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon Palace”
Reviews.Author: kabecker
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 days at the San Clementi Palace for the Venice part of my honeymoon. I chose to stay here because its isolated from the main areas of Venice, choosing something more quiet. The place is really a palace. The hallways are REALLY long, the ceiling are REALLY tall and its very quiet inside. I booked it through lhw.com and received an upgrade to a fantastic room with super comfortable beds. My biggest complain about hotels these days is how thin walls are and how easily noises from other rooms and hallways can be. I didn't hear anything from other rooms. Its as soundproofed as you can get. The breakfast buffet as the hotel is unbelievable. The selection of food was so diverse and delicious, I am drewling right now just thinking about it. Make sure you try the freshly squeezed orange juice. The one drawback to this hotel is that its a 15 minute ferry ride from St Marks Sq. The ferry runs every 30-40 minutes during the weekday and during weekends I think it runs more frequently. On the other hand, its on its own private island, secluded and quiet. I liked that they had good quality umbrellas to borrow when it rained. It came in very handy when it just completely poured on one of the days. I ate at the hotel's restaurant one night for dinner, and it was on the expensive side and not that great. In fact, I found the food in Venice to be mediocre at best. Go to Florence, Bologna or Rome if you want good Italian food. Hotel had wi-fi internet in the room but be prepared to pay an arm and leg for it. Also, try not to ever take water taxi's in Venice. They are ridiculously expensive. Also if you come from the airport and take the Vaporetto, when you get off the stop in St. Marks Sq, go left when you get off the Vaporetto to find the hotel's ferry. I went right with heavy luggage not knowing where I was going and ended up in frustration taking a water taxi which was 70 euros. Don't make my mistake.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel, il miglior albergo, en iyi hoteli”
Reviews.Author: stavrolga
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 7 night from 13th to 20 September It was the best ever hotel we stayed in our lives. It was super clean with the staff changing the bedsheets twice per day. Breakfast was of a royal level and the staff was excellent! The link with Venice was frequent and precise. Prices at the resto and the bar were reasonable comparing with the rest of Venice. The concierge was very helpful and the manager friendly and approachable and very kind. We would to thank THI for the great service. We recommend this hotel to everybody. grazie a tutti!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic - Splash out and trreat yourself”
Reviews.Author: mikelp
Reviews.Content: Visited Venice on 18 & 19 September, a treat from our two daughters. Our overall opinion is that it must be one of the best hotels in Venice, with helpful and friendly staff, but who are not overbearing or pretentious, good food and a fantastic setting, and as others have said an oasis of tranquility and well worth the extra cost over more ordinary hotels. We will definitely return to Venice one day and would not consider staying in Venice itself as it was far too busy and hectic, and will return to the San Clemente Palace, which we would highly recommend, and provided you are not going to nitpick over minor faults or worry too much about the relatively high cost of rooms and food, you will enjoy it. Apologies in advance for the length of this review, but I have included the things that I would have liked to know before I went. Getting there Although there is the vaperetto from Marco Polo airport to St Markâ€™s Square, which I would suspect takes at least 30 mins and gets very crowded, and then the San Clemente Palacesâ€™ private boat to the hotel we were advised to book a private water taxi. Looked at various on the web and many wanted to charge euros 300 for the return trip, but made an enquiry at www.motoscafivenezia.it , who are a consortium of taxi operators with more than 100 water taxis, who quoted euro 105 each way or euro 200 return, about Â£180, which we booked plus 20 euros for private minivan to save the 8 minute walk from the airport to the water taxi pier. Arrived 1 hour 30 mins late due mainly to flight delay, met by Motoscafi, driven to water taxi pier, straight on to water taxi and a high speed, sometimes bumpy ride, felt like we were in a James Bond movie, direct to San Clemente Palace in about 30 minutes. Return journey picked up exactly on time. From our experience would highly recommend Motoscafi, but if you book with them they donâ€™t have an online payment system so I paid over the phone, donâ€™t ring their main number on their website as no-one speaks English, but spoke to Mario tel no [--] who was very helpful and took my payment and. San Clemente Palace Hotel First impression on arrival very good, friendly welcome at the boat dock, luggage taken for delivery direct to the room, quick and courteous check in, escorted to room, with commentary about the hotel on the way, deluxe room no 413, a pleasant 3 minute stroll from reception, with a view straight across the lagoon to Venice and St Markâ€™s, couldnâ€™t ask for more. The hotel is on a private island and used to be a monastery and has extensive grounds, swimming pool, two tennis courts, 3 hole chip and put course and a beauty and wellness club. Our room was elegantly furnished, comfortable bed, two armchairs, writing desk and chair, cupboard with ancient CRT tv, only one English channel, BBC World News, but watched Arsenal v Wigan as it was the live game on Sky Sports, with Italian commentary. The air conditioning worked well and was reasonably quiet, with the ubiquitous minibar and the normal expensive drinks, but surprisingly no tea or coffee making facilities, so if you want a cup of tea or coffee first thing in the morning, you will need to take your own travel kettle, tea, coffee etc. Good size marble bathroom, with separate shower, low water pressure, and bath, bathrobes, slippers and good quality toiletries. Reasonable amount of hanging space and drawers, but possibly a bit tight if you were staying for a week, with a safe, no charge for use, and Wi-Fi hot spot, but surprisingly for a relatively expensive 5 star hotel you have to pay to use it, a bit mean in my view. Housekeeping was excellent with tooms serviced twice daily and bed linen and towels changed daily. The interior of the hotel is very elegant, see photos on various websites, with high ceilings and was relatively cool despite the outside being quite warm, with lots of chairs and sofas spread around and a number of small sitting areas, could be accused of lacking atmosphere but we found it tranquil and quiet, which after the hustle and bustle of Venice was most welcoming. Breakfast is taken in the Gli Arazi rooms, but as the weather was warm/hot and sunny most guests had breakfast in the adjoin courtyard, no view but still very pleasant. Breakfast is typical of a high quality European hotel, with cereals, breads, cheese, meat, fruit, scrambled eggs, bacon etc with fresh orange etc and even Prosecco if you want to that early in the morning. Staff very friendly and helpful and all food good quality and plentiful. Only ate at the hotel on one night at the Ristorante Le Meschere, booked a table and glad we did as they were full and had to turn some guests away. Our table was next to the water, in the courtyard to the small San Clemente church/chapel and was lovely setting for a meal. The main gourmet restaurant Ristorante Caâ€™dei Frati was closed. Wide ranging menu, my wife had home made ravioli filled with sea bass, clams and clams sauce and zucchini, and I had fillet of beef medallions from the grill served with baked potato and vegetables, which together with one glass of Pinot Grigio, one bottle of water and one coffee, came to a bill of euros 84, about Â£75, which by Venice standards is not particularly expensive and which for the location and quality of food and service was excellent value, especially as it included a very nice Amuse Bouch of fried tagiatelli with mushroom sauce and a glass each of Prosecco. The swimming pool is very pleasant, freshwater not seawater, and is quite large, with lots of sun beds, towels etc and we presume that it is heated as the pool temperature was very comfortable to get in and not at all cold, and is a most enjoyable retreat when returning from Venice, which was packed to the rafters when we were there. The pool is next to the Ristorante La Laguna for lunch and snacks and the bar Le Conchigli for drinks, but both are relatively expensive with soft drinks, tea, coffee or a beer costing about euros 8 â€“ 10, about Â£8. When we were there the hotelâ€™s motor launch, which I believe can carry about 30 â€“ 40 people, ran every 20 minutes starting on the hour, both from the hotel and from St Markâ€™s Square, and is a 12 minute, not 5, 10 or 15 as suggested by others, enjoyable ride through the lagoon, probably not taking much longer to get to St Markâ€™s Square than from many Venice hotels, but a lot easier, and was very reliable always leaving exactly on time. It runs 24 hours a day, but from about 1.00 to 5.00 am it is by arrangement and not the normal day schedule. The view of St Markâ€™s and Venice when arriving on the motor launch is unforgettable and probably a good enough reason in itself to stay at the San Clemente. There was a good mix of guests when we were there, with different nationalities, a fair percentage being English and Italian, and age groups, mainly 40 plus but a nice sprinkling of younger couples, some with young children, which contributed to our most enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Like The Shining with good food - bizarre stay!”
Reviews.Author: UpgradeQueen
Reviews.Content: We had an almost surreal experience at this hotel. It's beautiful, no question about it. Lovely rooms, luxurious bathrooms, large, wide hallways, gorgeous public spaces. But for some reason, the place felt like the hotel in The Shining. My husband was attending a business conference. At check-in, we were told the hotel was full and no rooms with a view were available. But there seemed to be no one in the hotel except for our (small) group. Eventually, we did get a room with a lovely water view (#276) - I've learned to be persistent. No A/C was turned on, and if you opened the large windows, lots of mosquitos flew in. We made the best of it. Room was lovely, and had a gorgeous bathroom, with a large tub under the grand window. I believe they did turn the A/C on eventually. It felt like there was NOBODY there. You never saw another person. I went to the bar for a sandwich and never got served. We did have lunch on the patio right on the canal the first day - a DELICIOUS meal and lovely server - but when we tried to go back for dinner, were told it was closed. Same thing next night for dinner. The indoor restaurant was less than half full (our group), but we were told there was a half hour wait. I went to the spa and tried to get a manicure or massage appointment - no availability (it was EMPTY!) Weather was beautiful, but you couldn't eat outside. First week in October, and the place felt shut down and deserted. Obviously some very bad planning on their part. Very bizarre. But gorgeous!

Reviews.Title: “perfect and amazing - just book it!”
Reviews.Author: mrset
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights at the San Clemente on our 1st anniversary trip and it was perfect - far beyond my expectations. The staff were amazing - all very attentive and the breakfast staff remembered our name from the 2nd morning onwards which we thought was very impressive given the size of the hotel. I read with interest the reviews which say that the hallways of the hotel are spooky and hospital like and I could not disagree more. They were beautifully decorated and spacious and not at all spooky. The chandeliers were amazing! Our room was fabulous â€“ very high ceilings and a view of the canal. I had let them know it was our anniversary and they left champagne and chocolate covered strawberries in our room for us on arrival which was a great surprise. Breakfast at this hotel was to die for â€“ make sure its included in your rate as its EUR33 per person! The hotel water taxi was something that I found it hard to find out about before I left so here is the run down â€“ It starts at the crack of dawn â€“ around 5am and the last water taxi is at 1.40am (we were on this a few times!). It either runs every 20 minutes or 40 minutes throughout the day/evening. There is a schedule of times that they give you when you check in. We did not eat in the restaurant at the hotel at all (except for breakfast) and ate in town every night â€“ the concierge was very helpful and recommended places to eat and was happy to book them for us. My husband was concerned that we would miss out not being in the thick of it but we both agreed that being a 10 minute water taxi ride away was not a problem at all and we would stay there again if we returned. Hotel gym and spa were closed on random days â€“ although when we wanted to use it they opened it for us and left us to it! This hotel is one of only 4 that has a pool in Venice and as we were there in the summer this made a massive difference. It looks very small on the website but is a big pool with around 100 sun-loungers around it â€“ enough for everyone. On one day the bartender came and gave everyone around the pool orange juice iceyâ€™s for free. Which was a nice touch. The hotel staff and guests were not pretentious at all â€“ noone cared if you were in designer clothes or ones from primark â€“ everyone was treated the same. I could not recommend this hotel enough and would retrun tomorrow if I could. I was very sad to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury hotel with a fantastic view of Venice”
Reviews.Author: smileysheep11
Reviews.Content: We stayed at San Clemente for 6 nights as part of our honeymoon, and could not have chosen a more magical setting. A top notch hotel with friendly staff and a free shuttle boat service throughout the day to St Mark's square. The room was just the ticket (large, with mini bar and stunning marble bathroom with gorgeous toiletries). They were cleaned twice daily, if we had one grumble if would the prices of extras, as with everything in Venice it can be expensive. Our top tip would be find a supermarket in Venice (yes there are some near Rialto) and buy water and snacks from there. If we could afford to we would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Get away from the hustle and bustle of Venice”
Reviews.Author: BJGBath
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the St Clemente for 3 nights and thought it was fantastic. The staff were very helpful and efficient and we were given a wonderful room with views over St marks. It is much better in every respect than the Cipriani and the huge grounds make it a peaceful haven away from the hustle and bustle of Venice in August. Interesting reviews make me think that some people must have used a speed boat to get to St Marks as the trip by launch is 15 minutes not 5 minutes. However the trip was great and we never had to queue or wait for a boat. The restaurant is very good , and like everywhere else in Venice quite expensive. Breakfast was very good served in a delightful courtyard. The hotel main building is vast, some 150 metres from one end of the corridor to the other - heaven help you if you leave something in the room! The pool was a much needed chill out area after museums and St Marks, only spoiled from my Mr Meldrew perspective of there being too many noisy children accompanied by parents unable to keep their little darlings quiet! One of the hazards of having to holiday in August. Nevertheless the pool was clean, cool and special. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone. One of the traveller photos is of room 360. That was our room too and it was very good!

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel in a breath taking location”
Reviews.Author: Svt7
Reviews.Content: beautiful hotel a 5 min boat ride across San Marco in Venice; magical location even for a place like Venice...; quiet, gigantic, well appointed rooms, to die for breakfast, immaculate service. Absolutely stay there if you can afford it! Summer prices are drastically reduced off season.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing experience in San Clemente Palace Hotel”
Reviews.Author: juliaTogliatti
Reviews.Content: I subsribed the membership for the swimming pool oof San Clemente Palace Hotel for the summer season . At the beginning everything was pleasant, till I became infected. I was sure I got infection in the pool, so I called General Manager to clarify the matter. He was away on vacation, so they put me through to the General Manager Assistant Ms E.Vianello. Her answer was : "Our pool is clean. If you got infected it is not out problem. You have to go to the medical doctor. Sorry, I have other things to do now" Thanks God it was five star Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Your own private hideaway...”
Reviews.Author: HotHospitality
Reviews.Content: The San Clemente was a breathtaking resort - typical Italian Palace style. Positives - the staff were very friendly but I didn't feel they communicated well internally as I had plans to go to the Cipriani and the Concierge said the shuttle would drop me off the Cipriani and then head onto Venice San Marco - but he didn't. So I had to wait for the Cipriani shuttle which is on call 24/7 - and it took 5 mins - that's service!! The Hotel itself is beautiful but very sparse - it used to be a mental institution and still has a touch of that atmosphere to it - think The Shining. Long hallways, white walls...kinda creepy if I was by myself. But I am exagerrating, it was lovely. The pool is great but definitely made for the average sized European, not Asian. I had to stay on a last step like a child so I didn't drown. They have one lovely Cabana Type bed and personally i think they should get more. Good looking pool boys though. Negatives: It felt like it didn't refurbishment. The flush was sort of broken as after you did flush, the water kept running. We got a Junior Suite which was nice but I didn't feel it was worthy of that title. The water pressure in the shower wasn't strong enough and the tv in the room was really small and old - not what you would acquaint with a Junior Suite. It is on a separate island to Venice which sometimes is nice cause when you leave to go back, you leave the tourists, etc all behind but having said that it is a shuttle like a bus and if you miss it then you wait another 15-20 mins for the next one unlike the Cipriani. Next time i'll definitely stay on the main land - easier. Overall a beautiful property - make sure to check out the old church still on the island - its beautiful!! walk all the way to the back of it for a gorgeous fresco.

Reviews.Title: “Third time staying there. Always the same. Nice.”
Reviews.Author: Raidinator
Reviews.Content: Dig the San Clemente because it is away from the crowds of Venice. 7 minute boat ride from San Marco. Always quiet, always Molto Bella.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Oasis from the Venice heat”
Reviews.Author: jyell
Reviews.Content: We are so glad that we chose The San Clemente Palace as our hotel in Venice. We booked a garden view room and we were upgraded to a junior suite. The 15 minute boat ride was a welcome escape and even nice to sit and relax and unwind from the crowds and heat of Venice. We loved laying at the pool in the hot afternoon and then showering and getting ready for dinner very refreshed and cool. The air conditioning was blasting throughout the hotel which was wonderful. The dinner restaurant is lovely and overlooks the water. We ate at sunset and it was very romantic and delicious. It is easy to hop on the boat and return to Venice at night. The crowds are gone and San Marco square is a lot of fun. A night time gondola ride is a must and was the highlight of our days in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Loved idea of staying on Island - but not top class”
Reviews.Author: SwissWish
Reviews.Content: We had not visited Venice for 15 years. We had been many times before that and thought it was time to introduce our daugher - first checking that it was not high tide. Remembering Venice and the standard of food (poor) rooms (small) cheap hotels (terrible) we decided to spalsh out to "guarantee" some of the things we can now afford. First thing. Venice was just as beautiful and in some respects even better than we remembered. We found some great food in new places (la calcina for lunch) - and our old "cheap" favorite "Alla Madonna" was still noisy, bustling, rude and good quality value seafood. (You cant book but hotel managed to do this !) Even at Easter weekend the crowds were not too bad. The shops are more upper class chains than we remember and gone were most of the individual little shops. The idea of taking a posh hotel taxi to your private island is fantastic. Its really great being away from Venice and the crowds at the end of each day. We found the staff very good - the concierge was very helpful. The manager was also good. The room we had ( a junior suite) was plenty large enough - but furnished more like a conference hotel. New but not good. However bed was comfortable. Shower was weak. Agree with previous comments about the souless hospital feel and characterless corridors. The BIG disappointment was the "Easter Dinner" that we had in their lagoon view restaurant. I don't think we've ever seen such chaotic service and disappointing food. Given that they had pushed it so hard we were really looking to our 7 course menu overlooking the lagoon. Each course was supposed to come with a different wine. The overworked staff couldnt cope with the full restaurant. The wine turned up when we complained or someone else compained and they took opportunity to fill up others. They even ran out of glasses ! The foos was dumped down on the table by a sweaty stressed waiter. The food degenerated as the courses progressed - and the eventual main course of lamb loin was basically ALL fat. We think the chef had given up by the end of the meal or more likely has run out of lamb. It was so disappointing. The F&B manager was very apologetic the next morning and clearly cared but not so much as to offer any reduction of bill etc. He probably knew we wouldn't be returning. We didn't make a big fuss but this was one of the truly worst meals that we had ever had. We don't excatly know what went wrong - maybe they were not ready for a full house ( the hotel is very quiet in the evening) and I hate to say this - maybe they charged too little for the meal - charge more and deliver. This place is good to get a guaranteed big room and some space and breath outside Venice. Its a lot cheaper than the some other great hotels which trade on their reputation. The dinner (and breakfast too crowded) were bad. The staff were generally professional but not the established top quality hotel kind. We can't say that this was a waste of money as really it is quite reasonable as a 4star in venice and at least the room is big. We also think that the dinner disaster was a blip that would be corrected. Stay here if you want a comfortable hotel with a big room in Venice. Stay at one of the "names" if you want quality..

Reviews.Title: “WOW. PARADISE IN VENICE”
Reviews.Author: Willtaylor123
Reviews.Content: Just stayed her for 3 nights with my wife for our wedding anniversary. Wow, this is truly a wonderful hotel. The hotel is luxurious without being over the top. The staff are friendly and helpful. The location is great. One of the best hotels I have stayed in. BEAUTIFUL!

Reviews.Title: “An oasis away from the rat race”
Reviews.Author: JB4
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the San Clemente Palace for 4 nights with my wife. Venice is lovely,majestic,interesting and romantic and is a must for all travellers in their life time. The hotel is luxurious and is a great escape after a long day walking around Venice. Yes it is 10 minutes away by private hotel boat from St Marks square but this is all part of the holiday experience. Peace and solitude is what you get here and being a widely travelled person I would not hesitate in recommending this hotel.You really won't have any major complaints. The Hotel restaurant "Le Maschere" is excellent and is outside with it positioned on the edge of the lagoon with a lovely view. The food is expensive and so are the drinks. The only small gripe would be that the bar prices should be more reasonable priced and a bigger area outside to enjoy these drinks would be a nice addition. But for someone who is super critical a lovely luxurious leading hotel of the world.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RodWebb
Reviews.Content: All things considered, this would rate as one of the best, possibly the best, hotel Iâ€™ve stayed in for a holiday. The hotel is set on its own island a 10-20 minute trip away from St. Marks, which is made by the hotelâ€™s regular ferry service. Our welcome on arrival was slick, and every member of staff we had dealings with during our stay was professional and courteous. Our room (we were upgraded to a junior suite) was very comfortable with a very large bathroom. There are a couple of downsides to staying at San Clemente: 1) Itâ€™s not easy to â€˜pop outâ€™ to a local bar, so youâ€™ll probably end up paying the hotelâ€™s top prices for a night cap at some point during your stay, with prices comparable to those charged in St. Marks. 2) If you forget something, youâ€™re going to have to catch the boat back to get whatever it was. But there are some really great positives too: 1) Itâ€™s great to be able to get away from the crowds in the summer. 2) In the winter, you might be glad of the hotelâ€™s spacious public spaces if the weather is bad outside. 3) The service is fantastic. 4) The hotel is beautiful and has a lovely setting. 5) The terrace provides a lovely place to sit out and watch the world go by on warm evenings. 6) Rooms are large and well-equipped. 7) The hotelâ€™s ferry service takes you directly to St. Marks. Handy if youâ€™re new to Venice and not familiar with its confusing muddle of streets and canals. And itâ€™s great way to arrive at/leave your hotel every day. 8) It provides a wonderfully romantic setting for honeymoons and anniversaries. 9) Youâ€™ll never forget it!

Reviews.Title: “Superb, wouldn't hesitate to recommend it”
Reviews.Author: LucyClaude
Reviews.Content: I was booked into this hotel by a medical conference and how very lucky I was. I had a deluxe room with a view over the lagoon to Piazza San Marco and felt it couldn't really get any better. The room was large, the bed and the sheets superb quality. The bathroom is tiled in marble and has a bidet with a bottle of intimate cleaner, must confess I wasn't quite sure what I was supposed to do with the substance!! The staff were very friendly and helpful. Only a couple of very minor glitches: the internet service was down when I wanted to skype the kids at home and there were mosquitos which woke me but didn't bite me. Breakfast was ample with a huge selection and of course good coffee. The hotel truly seems like a converted palace, massive spacious corridors with chandeliers so you can pretend you're royalty if you wish, a haven of tranquility after bustly touristy Venice. If you do book, ask to have a room on the church side, this is the side with the best views.

Reviews.Title: “Top quality hotel in all respects”
Reviews.Author: BQD
Reviews.Content: The San Clemente Palace is a ten minute free shuttle boat ride from St Marks Square and occupies a small island all of its own. The hotel only opened six years ago and is beautifully appointed with grand staircases and magnificent corridors. Facilities are comprehensive (spa, outdoor pool, computer for guest use next to bar, pleasant gardens, etc) and service is consistently outstanding (on a par with the best Ritz Carltons or Four Seasons). Bedrooms are spacious, well furnished and well serviced. Bathrooms are finished in marble with separate shower and bath. Television was cathode ray not flat screen. There was a complimentary bottle of Prosecco and a greeting card from management in the room on our arrival. There are two restaurants. Ca' dei Frati is closed on Sunday and Monday nights so we ate at La Maschere which relocates to the Ca' dei Frati dining room on Sundays and Mondays. It's a lovely dining room with an open beam roof and superb views across the lagoon. Food was good and excellent value for money (around 200 euros for two) compared with lesser quality cuisine on Venice mainland. Breakfast was included in our room rate and served in a pleasant dining room with an oval buffet arrangement in the middle. The selection of food was alright but nothing special; the space around the food felt a little pinched. On request, the concierge will organise a free trip to Murano to see the glass makers in action at a few minutes notice. A water taxi takes you there and back (if you were paying it would cost about 50 euros each way) and on arrival you are met by a pleasant representative from one of the factories. You will be given a fifteen minute demonstration of glass making by a small group of artisans and will then be invited to view various galleries displaying the work of the master craftsmen. It's stunning stuff but be warned, nothing costs less than a couple of thousand euros. Once you've sheepishly admitted you're not inclined to spend that kind of money on an impulse purchase, you'll be taken to the shop at the exit, where you'll be so relieved to see more modestly priced items (and remembering that you're dependent on your attentive host providing free transport back to the hotel) that you'll happily spend a couple of hundred euros buying a token something. Well there's no such thing as a free lunch! The hotel runs a free shuttle to and from St Marks Square every 20 minutes (every 40 minutes in the middle of the day) until 1.00 am, and it's extremely reliable. The journey takes 10 to 15 minutes and gives a chance to see some of the other islands and the waterways. Some might find that offputting but, it was so easy, we didn't find it a problem even when making the return journey twice a day. Overall this is a first class hotel with exceptional service.

Reviews.Title: “Without doubt one of the VERY best in Venice”
Reviews.Author: TM99
Reviews.Content: This hotel is excellent and is far better than many of the TA reviews would suggest. This is a real luxury hotel with staff to match. We stay in many superb hotels (suites in 4 Seasons, Ritz Carltons etc) and the San Clemente is definitely in this league. The hotel is large with wide corridors and glorious high ceilings - decor is excellent and expensive throughout. First off, it is a great relief to be in a spacious hotel on a peaceful island, as Venice is very busy and crowded. The gardens were delightful and my son loved watching the rabbits bound around the lawns. In the summer it would be fabulous as there are tennis courts and an outdoor pool too. Access to San Marco is effortless, as the hotel's shuttle is both frequent and very punctual. Hotel staff were - without exception - extremely professional, friendly, warm and welcoming. With the exception of the Penha Longa in Portugal, I have not encountered such consistently genuine and high levels of service anywhere in Europe. We took a junior suite with a gorgeous view. Bathroms are good - marble, separate shower and full tub, bidet, loads of tolietries provided and refreshed. Turndown at night is the PROPER job - full towel replacement in bathroom, tidy up not just turning the bed down. Breakfast buffet is adequate; I certainly wouldn't rave about it but it was included in our roomrate so it was fine. We ate in their formal restaurant overlooking the lagoon one night - good food, elegant surroundings and it is good to have the option to dine well in the hotel if you don't feel like going back into town after a day's sightseeing. All in all I think it would be hard to beat this hotel in terms of space, quality of decor and comfort in Venice and I would highly recommend it to anyone who values their comfort and service levels.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location”
Reviews.Author: Paul044
Reviews.Content: The location of the island is amazing if your looking for a memorable and romantic holiday and are prepared to pay for it then this island hotel is for you.We got engaged on the island in the beautiful gardens,it was the perfect setting.However i felt the breakfast and room cleaning not to be 5 star. Still a weekend i/we will never forget.

Reviews.Title: “A world leader hotel !”
Reviews.Author: marianina
Reviews.Content: i think that anyone who wants to vizit Venice they should book to the San Clemente Hotel! the atmosphere of this palazzo takes your breath away from the first look! we had booked a room that was upgrated to junior suite , and as it was also our wedding anniversary a bottle of sampange was waiting in our room! the room was a venetian look like with a large bathroom! the stairs...the coridors... the decoration..everything was speaking to our loudly the history of this hotel!! the restaurant at the 3rd floor was with a brathtaking view to San Marco and the food also perfect!i think that if you would like to feel for real venice that's the right hotel to do it!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place. almost faultless”
Reviews.Author: lingiulla
Reviews.Content: About me: 35, Italian, work in the hotel industry, i usually travel for leisure, preferred choices Leading hotels or small luxury. I was at the san clemente in Venice the last weekend of November to attend a party. Upon arrival at San Marco we took the private boat of the hotel and in less than 10 min. we were at the san clemente island. I donâ€™t think the island is far away from the city of Venice, it is actually so great to have peace and tranquillity after a day spent walking. The boat service runs every 20 min. and it is available on call during the night hours. Arriving at the hotel you feel that this is not ordinary place; a short walk and once inside everything is grand. Check in was fast, professional with lots of people smiling and welcoming you. I donâ€™t know what kind of room I had but it was nice, well decorated with all the amenities you would expect from a Leading hotel. Bathroom with marble and a very good hairdryer. This might seem a minor detail but it is so annoying when you have to use those hairdryers that barely blow some hot air. All the public rooms are simply grand! Corridors, boudoirs, riding rooms are all stunning. Everywhere views are amazing, ranging from the garden, the courtyards to the private chapel and the lagoon. The wellness centre is well equipped and a very nice option after a day of rain. It is not big, but everything you need is there and the staff are all very very nice. They also provide you with swimwear if you donâ€™t have yours. The bar is very stylish and the head barman was previously at the Danieli. Needless to say, perfect service in a perfect place. Everyone is going the extra mile to attend you, always ready but never intrusive. Many remembered my name even if I stayed only one night. The reason I didnâ€™t give it a 5 rating is that unfortunately my Leaders C. was not honoured. When travelling i am used to find a welcome gift in my room, to have a real upgrade and some little touches that really make the difference. That is also why I travel with the leadings hotels. I guess this was a management mistake but I was really disappointed. Oh, I got a card saying a gift was expecting me in a store in Venice. Since I didnâ€™t shop I got a perfume sample !!! What a waste of time and they were also rude. I think that the old wine bottle in the room or the complimentary drink is much much nicer than a sort of propaganda for a store. Would I go back ? yes As I wrote before this is an amazing Palace and I would not consider other options ( I usually used the services of the europa and regina ).

Reviews.Title: “perfection!!!”
Reviews.Author: Crndfs
Reviews.Content: wow!! that's all that can be said about this hotel. My boyfriend and I travelled here and get engaged on the private island where the palace is situated. This hotel really made our experience of Venice magical. Due to the vast size, you almost feel as though you have the palace to yourself. The private shuttle boat which travels between the palace and st mark's square is like something from james bond; cream leather and mahogany interior. The breakfast as the hotel is magnificent and can be enjoyed in a gorgeous little courtyard. The only drawback is the cost but I suppose this adds to the exclusivity. I would recommend staying here to make an occassion truly special and if you want to live like royalty for a few days!

Reviews.Title: “Hmmm - not sure”
Reviews.Author: Frankie_Sydney
Reviews.Content: OK - lets start with the positive....it is a beautiful island with great shuttle boats to get you to and from. We really enjoyed having the option to get away from the crowds in Venice and relax in an Island oasis. Breakfast is also fantastic and something to savour. Bad stuff - Hotel is very expensive (both to stay in and also be in). Food and drink options are very expensive in the hotel. I understand that 5* luxury hotels are pricey but this really embraced the Venice culture of charging very high prices that almost leave you feeling mugged.....20Euro for a regular run of the mill beer. I have to add though that the food we had in the hotel restaurant was excellent but overpriced. OK - so the mental institution bit.....although it is called a palace it never has been, it is very much like an institution. Bars on windows, internal courtyards (no escaping!) and when walking around the gardens you cannot help but notice the high walls and no views....again - don't want you escaping :) I found it all a bit creepy and my new wife had nightmares. Long empty corridors certainly make you feel like you have a palace to yourself but it also reminds you when you hear the echo on the floors and the hospital feel that it is not a palace. Very luxurious comfortable rooms, attentive staff but wouldn't return to this hotel.....and if you want luxury and not bothered about the history I would certainly visit. BTW....it could have been worse. The next island over was a leper colony!!!

Reviews.Title: “Carneval-stay at old psychiatric hosptial”
Reviews.Author: ElyetteNess
Reviews.Content: A business trip turned holiday during the carneval this past winter was very memorable, in a large part due to the experience at the San Clemente. In the middle of winter this very spacious resort takes on a baren look that adds to the charm of being in Venice in the winter, along with the boats rides to-and-from the resort through the misty water. The hotel is very spacious - with large corridors & high ceiling (it was previously a monastery then psychiatric hospital) - our room featured a large entry-way and very nice-sized bathroom. Understated luxury decor, excellent taste, effective staff. Have been to Venice before - staying on this private island really added to the experience this time.

Reviews.Title: “Truly a Palace!”
Reviews.Author: alextn99
Reviews.Content: Went here for my honeymoon... a bit late of a review but just wanted to say the hotel was fantastic. My wife loved it.. truly a royal experience. Taking the boat to get to down is a bit of a drag... but besides that it is truly amazing getaway and it is like your own little palace.

Reviews.Title: “I want to go back!”
Reviews.Author: yb1uk
Reviews.Content: I rarely want to go and stay in the same place BUT this is different. The whole experience was excellent, stunning views from the suite windows, comfortable sitting area, excellent bed and professional`staff. The boat ride across to St. Marks Square takes 10 minutes and runs regularly even int the early hours. Returning to peace and tranquility. Great way to experience Venice. Gardens are quite and relaxing, good size swimming pool, good food and attentive restruant staff. Go and have a good time - can't wait to go back

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: adliv12
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel away from all the noise and congestion. My wife and I booked a Jr. Suite and when we arrived,the front staff moved us to a full Classic Suite.Beautiful room. Staff were very helpful. Hotel restaurant was nothing special,then again,we didn't find anyting special on the main land either. Great hotel,great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Five star experience”
Reviews.Author: bluetail47
Reviews.Content: A great hotel on an island away from all the noise of Venice. Shuttle to St Marks square runs every 20 minutes. Hotel staff are first class, check in and out was very simple. Rooms are clean, large, and nicely decorated. Lots of marble in rooms. Only downside was breakfast. scrambled eggs not cooked enough, hash browns cold, bacon seared and cold. When booking, I recommend not including the breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet spot in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Ezis
Reviews.Content: That is really great hotel in wonderfull surroundings. All island is just this hotel plus abandoned church dating from 12th century. My room was nice and spacious, bathroom had both bath and shower (both excellent). Island as such is quiet and serene and is good resting place after Venice. Only keep windows closed - I got bitten by mosquitos at night time. But beeing isolated from other Venice means you are charged inflated prices for food and beverages. And quality is average. Apart of breakfast I tried American Bar (OK, except tiramisu) and pool restaurant which had mediocre food. I had WIFI Hotspot sign in my room, but unfortunately signal was so weak I had to go and work to lobby (and that's not free of charge!). And if you want something from hidden history of building you can still feel slight smell of it in some places: till 1992 here was a hospital.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hawtrey
Reviews.Content: The hotel is just a ten minute complimentary launch ride from St Marks Square. In August, when it is very hot and crowded in Venice, it was very relaxing to escape to the hotel, the pool and gardens. The staff are excellent and the service is attentive and prompt. The concierge team is excellent. Breakfast was served inside or in a courtyard and there was an enormous selection on the buffet. We didn't eat lunch or dinner in the hotel restaurants but one day ordered light lunch at the pool. It was poor, we complained, they apologised and deleted the charge. We had a suite which was very comfortable. The view was rather boring over a courtyard but the hotel was full and no other room was available. Next time we would request a lagoon or garden view. Overall an excellent experience at a top class hotel.

Reviews.Title: “It doesn't get any better than this”
Reviews.Author: Hudson_Sydney
Reviews.Content: This is by far the best hotel I've ever stayed at. The service was amazing - staff remembered our names, where we were from, where we were going and checked in with us each day to see how our trip was going.

Reviews.Title: “Venice is romantic. This hotel added something extra.”
Reviews.Author: friesy
Reviews.Content: I and my girlfriend decided to go to Venice for a break. Venice was very romantic. This hotel just added in something extra for this romantic city. First of all, the location of the hotel is perfect. It is only about 15 minutes away from the city by complimentary boat, but yet it takes you away from a very busy city centre. I can say that I did feel a sudden relief from those touristy environment when we arrived onto the island. The service is great. The food is very good. However, it is quite expensive. I tried both Gli Arazzi Ristorante (outdoor) and Ca' dei Frati (indoor fine diner). Although the Frati is very expensive, the food is absolutely fantastic. The cook was Italian but trained in France. The atmosphere in the restaurant was lovely too. I proposed to my girlfriend there and was a success! We always loved a resort type holiday. Given that Venice is so expensive, I do feel that this hotel is value for money. Overall, a fantastic experience. I do not think one would fail loving this place. We loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Fantasic, fantasic, fantasic”
Reviews.Author: mollyash
Reviews.Content: We have just arrived back from a long weeked at the San Clemente Palace. It was our 10th Wedding Anniversary and what a wonderful weekend it was. It was perfection from start to finish, stunning room, wonderful staff, superb food and the pool area is such a retreat from the hustle and bustle of St Marks Square. If you ever get the chance in your lifetime do not miss out on this little gem. Total luxury at its finest.

Reviews.Title: “Go - you wont be disappointed”
Reviews.Author: JaneyJaneEngland
Reviews.Content: Just felt I had to write and say what a wonderful experience my husband and I had at the San Clemente Palace. It was luxurious from the moment we arrived to the when we left. We particularly enjoyed the complimentary boat over to San Marco, it was certainly an experience dodging the through traffic! Our deluxe room had a lovely view and was very comfortable and the swimming pool was such a treat to come back to at the end of a tiring day in the heat. We never ate in the restaurants but found the breakfast to be of a very high quality, it kept us full for hours. The staff were very professional and friendly and would go out of their way to help. I would definitely return here again.

Reviews.Title: “perfect romantic get away”
Reviews.Author: Chez-Hart
Reviews.Content: As our first weekend away without children in 10 years, this was always going to be a special trip. We had to ring the hotel to find where the motor launch was supposed to collect us, as the sign had been taken down. A beautiful wooden launch was then dispatched, 10 minutes later we were whisked away and it felt like the start of a real adventure . Some reviews say that having to get the boat to and from the island was tiresome, but we found it delightful. It was particularly breathtaking speeding across the water towards St Marks Square at night, watching this beautifully lit city come into view. The hotel was clean and our standard room was very comfortable, with a very nice bathroom. The hotel had left us complimentary chocolates and champaign for our anniversary, along side a congratulatory card, which we thought was a nice touch. The breakfast buffet had plenty for everyone and was extremely good. We did not eat at the hotel as it was very expensive (as is all of Venice) but we soaked up the ambiance. One clear advantage to us was that, given how busy Venice is, it was lovely to return to the tranquilty of St Clemente Island. Take advantage of the water bus passess and do some sight seeing that way. Also try the traghettos if you want to go on a real gondola but can't afford the high prices. They only take you across the Grand Canal but cost less than a euro. Not for the faint-hearted though. If only we were rich enough to go every year!

Reviews.Title: “Read before you book.”
Reviews.Author: maguire_taylor
Reviews.Content: This large hotel occupies an island approximately 15 minutes by the hotel launch from St. Mark's Square. The hotel has the air of a palace with wide, long corridors and spacious common rooms with high ceilings and an elegant main staircase. There is a delightful outdoor swimming pool and sun lounger area open June to September. Surprisingly, there is no indoor swimming pool. The Spa has two large jacuzzis [side by side] and a sauna. Our accommodation was poor in relation to rating of the hotel and it's palacial design. The bedroom was small overlooking an enclosed courtyard. A large TV looked totally out of place. The wardrobes in the entrances area looked cheap, were poorly fitted and lacked sufficient draw or shelf space. The bathroom door edge just missed the poorly located washbasin of an otherwise adquately sized room. The fabric of the room seemed cheap and worn but adequately maintained. Toiletries, towels and bathrobes were of the quality expected on this class of hotel. We only used the American Bar and Breakfast Room. The staff were attentive and very charming. The standard of services, food and drink were good. The hotel is kept clean, tidy and uncluttered both inside and outside in the grounds. The courtesy hotel launches operate every 20 minutes to and from St. Mark's Square only. Otherwise, the only way to cross the lagoon is by water-taxi.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely wonderful - will definitely return”
Reviews.Author: ColetteLondon
Reviews.Content: It is extremely rare for me to be speechless upon arrival at a hotel, but I was when we pulled up at the jetty of the San Clemente Palace. My boyfriend had booked a surprise trip away so I had no idea where we were going - and I wasn't disappointed! We got a private boat transfer from Marco Polo airport (the only way to do it in style and without getting stressed) and from the moment of arrival were impressed with the location, the hotel itself, the room, the grounds and the staff. The interior of the hotel has been beautifully decorated and the long corridors simply add to its sense of exclusivity and tranquility. The room itself was lovely with a view of the manicured gardens and the lagoon. It was very clean and we had our complimentary bottle of Prosecco waiting for us. Being March, a majority of the hotel's added features were closed such as the outdoor swimming pool and restaurants but they make this very clear on their website and it certainly didn't affect our stay in any way - in fact, I can't wait to go back in summer so we can have a completely different experience of the hotel! It is very easy to hop on the shuttle back and forth to St Mark's Square and it's a lovely little boat ride so it isn't a problem. Besides, by the time you've experienced the hustle and bustle of inner Venice you can't wait to go back to the peace and quiet of the San Clemente. The concierge were absolutely brilliant - very welcoming and fun and they made a real effort to make our stay memorable. The spa was very nice - we spent a lot of time basking in the double jacuzzis and turkish bath whilst we were there. The breakfast was lovely, very continental which is perfect for us but if you do like a good fry-up then you may have to order off the a la carte menu. We didn't try the restaurant whilst we were there purely because we'd never been to Venice before so we wanted to try places outside but if we had stayed an extra night then we would have gone as the menu looked excellent. The hotel is expensive - but no more than you would expect for a 5* hotel, particularly in Venice. If you're used to 5* then you won't bat an eyelid - to be honest, you'd be foolish to go there and expect a bargain. Overall, we had an absolutely wonderful time at the San Clemente Palace - it even rained for a day and a half whilst we were there, but not even that could take the shine off a truly memorable stay. I cannot wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Go There!!!!”
Reviews.Author: essexshoequeen
Reviews.Content: We celebrated our 10th anniversary at this hotel, and it really is a "palace" in every sense. We were upgraded to the suite to die for, given a free meal at the stunning restaurant, and were absolutely enchanted by the whole Venice experience. Whilst we were staying, there was a wedding held in the chapel within the hotel grounds - how beautiful, probably the most romantic wedding I have ever seen. Do treat yourself and go, and one tip........ arrive in Venice at night and take the water taxi through the city and then across the lagoon to the hotel, you'll never forget it!

Reviews.Title: “an oasis of calm”
Reviews.Author: eime
Reviews.Content: I cannot recommend this hotel highly enough.I stayed here for my birthday with my boyfriend. It was fabulous. A hotel boat ride takes you to this incredible hotel ( previously a monastary I believe). Gardens are beautiful and breath taking entrance hall ! Beautiful antiques everwhere. Room was huge, lovely toiletries, and there were chocolate dipped strawberries and a bottle of proscetto waiting for us in our room. The pool area is well maintained and comfortable. Pool side snacking available, be warned very pricey! although you probably expect this when you stay at a 5* hotel. The bar in the hotel is also nice for an evening tipple. The restaurant was also beautiful with heavenly views and lovely food.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing.......”
Reviews.Author: Monkey38
Reviews.Content: Have just got from an amazing trip to the San Clemente Palace. The location, about 20 min boat ride from/to San Marco was a great way to start and end the day, and then again for the evening. The sunsets going back to the hotel as you leave Venice were great. The Staff were very helpful and nothing was to much trouble. Francesco 'the man with the bags who meets the boat' couldn't have been more helpful. Would recommend this hotel to anyone. As for the previous comment about no heating - all you need to is increase the temp on the air condictioning panel!!! Probably this is the best time of year to go to Venice as not so many tourists. Top tip would be - To the see The Grand Canal at its best, at the slow pace and not take a re-mortage for a gondala ride is to catch the Water Bus from San Marco No2 or N. This is a round trip that will take you right up to the Train Station then bring you back via San Frisola and San Giorgio.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: love2sightc
Reviews.Content: What more can I say really. It is stunningly beautiful and the service was excellent. It is a very impressive and large building with lovely grounds. I stayed here as a romantic treat in October with my now husband to be as he proposed by the basilica at midnight. I was slightly worried with it being such a 'posh' hotel that the staff may be snooty but they treated everyone equally. The breakfast was tasty and catered perfectly for me as a vegetarian and set you up for busy days in venice. Our room was large and ornate. The ceilings were so high! The bathroom was enorous as well. There was some English channels on the TV as usual when in a foreign hotel, and whilst in Venice who needs the BBC! The long wide corridors were impressive with wonderful chandeliers. One tip when arriving if you take the water taxi to St Marks Square is that the dock for the Palace shuttle boat is not well sign posted. It is not far from where the taxi drops you off. If you walk over the little bridge taking you to the square you have gone too far! Take a right where you get dropped off but not far, it one of the first docks by the benches and where the stalls are. There is often a boat every 20 minutes. The boat is splendid as well and always on time. You will have an amazing time if you choose this hotel, we absolutely loved it, no where else in Venice could possibly compare!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely splendid hotel”
Reviews.Author: sofieuk
Reviews.Content: This is a truly sumptious hotel with a wonderful feeling of light and space. It was absolulely wonderful to escape the hustle and bustle of St Mark's Square with all its tourists and find your own relaxing little haven. All the other hotels around St Marks Square had tourists milling in and out all of the time not so the St. Clemente Palace, one hardly saw another guest other than at meal times. The only negative comment I would make is that the coffee served at breakfast is appalling as is their selection of breads. Italy is known for its fantastic bread but there was nothing to be had at breakfast except the bog standard white loaf and white rolls. The staff are helpful and courteous and I would love to return again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: lovetotravel047
Reviews.Content: We stayed here at the begining of November to celebrateour 25 th wedding anniversary and were delighted with our choice. We were blessed with 4 sunny days which added to the overall ambience of the hotel and the lovely grounds which were pleasent to stroll round. From our arrival at reception until departure we found the staff to be pleasent courteous and attentive and nothing appeared too much trouble . We had a wonderfully spacious room with a view of the lagoon and spacious marble bathroom.Champagne and chocolates greeted us on arrival which was a nice touch. The bed was huge and very comfortable and unlike many hotel there was no noise what so ever from other rooms We found the boat service to Venice to be efficient and prompt with regular timetabled trips although it did mean planning the day carefully to avoid too many trips.On arrival at san marco there is no notice for the shuttle but the landing stage is directly infront of the wrought iron gates of a park about 20 metres from the alingua dpop off. Breakfast provided everything you could wish for and was served in delightful room . The hotel was very quiet while we were there and only a few other guests were at breakfast so no queues and polite prompt service. We used the spa and we were the only guests, everything was of the same high standard as the rest of the hotel.Wonderful to soak the tired feet after pleny of waliking in venice Reading other reviews maybe we were lucky with the service we recieved but we could not have had a more wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “A quiet romantic gataway........”
Reviews.Author: Magpiesnest
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my wife before getting the Orient Express to London. This hotel is in a fabulous setting even by Venice standards. Please note that this is on an island about 20 mins from Venice so if you want to walk around the sights of Venice then pop back for an hour before going back out, then think again. However if you're in Venice for a few days for a romantic getaway this is the place - the room was huge and the bathroom was fabulous. The bed was the biggest and most comfortable I think I have ever had in a hotel room. Our room also had large windows with views accross the lagoon to Venice and it looked fantastic by night or day. We were here in the first week of November and the Hotel was very quiet - I think there must have only been about 20 or so guests which might have been the reason for the excellent service. This hotel is arguably the biggest I have ever stayed in so you really need to be quite mobile to get around - even the walk from our room to reception took a while. The room service menu was limited but the food was very good and arrived hot and quickly. Couldn't really fault this Hotel at all - probably not much to do for children and older guests may struggle with the guest motor launches if going out to and from Venice.. otherwise excellent!!!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed with almost every aspect of this expensive hotel”
Reviews.Author: 50scoupleManchester
Reviews.Content: We had so looked forward to staying at this hotel as a real treat - we had paid for the deluxe room which, whilst very clean and having a very large comfy bed, was not somewhere you could sit and relax in after visiting the city The room felt austere and cold. There was only a top view of the old church from our windows - you had to stand on a chair to see it!! There was no tea /coffee making facilities. / no UK TV channels - why? / no iron / no heating when it had turned a little cold overnight ... Beyond the room there was no indoor pool and the outdoor one was closed (this means that there are no swimming facilities for the majotity of the year). The vast long corridors leading to the ridiculously expensive restaurant and the very low key health centre - this is suppsed to be 5 star! - combined with large vaulted ceilings and drab light fittings made it feel like an institution rather than a hotel - impossible to disguise that it was a monastery in days gone by!! If you do not relate cost to value then you will willingly accept the extortionate charges for everything from bar snacks and drinks to room service tea (14 euros for a tepid pot of hot water and a couple of t bags!!) but charging a lot of money does NOT make this a luxury hotel!! The boat shuttle in and out of the city was very reliable and easy to use but after the first few rides the novelty wore off and there was nothing to see or do at the hotel in the evening meaning a trek back to the city by boat (15 mins) which made us wish we had booked in the city despite it being busy and full of tourists. Overall we would not book into this hotel again- it was disappointing. We loved Venice - would probably not choose to go at a weekend again as the huge blocks of flats called cruise ships disgorge zillions on passengers into what is already a heaving city making St Marks and streets around practically unnavigable... Would go off seaon in a hotel just off beaten track but in Venice and would prob catch train from airport and then pay the 60Euro boat taxi for a transfer - at least you are looking at the Grand Canal!! St Maks basillica was stunniing as were views from bell tower. Gondaler ride is a must and just wondering the backstreets away from the main part of San Marco is candy for the eyes.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property, large rooms, friendly staff - still need training”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaLori
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my two daughters August 6-10, 2007. We had a junior suite with an additional roll away bed. The rooms here are fabulous! Large and luxurious with every possible amenity. Enormous bathroom. The property is lovely and the pool was a big plus during our hot summer stay. We enjoyed escaping the chaos of Venice at the end of the day and the complimentary shuttle boat was a quick pleasant ride back to the hotel. The concierge staff was very helpful in arranging tours and dinner. On the downside - the food at the poolside bar and grill is outrageiously expensive (30 euros for a small marherita pizza!) and there needs to be more staff avaialbe. There also appears to be very little (if any) security at the property and we did have our camera stolen right from under us in the hotel lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: MisterWhite
Reviews.Content: This is a grat hotel. We booked through the Leading Hotels of the World which offers some package deals with inclusive dining. The hotel concierge arranged our transfers by taxi which met us at the airport and drove us to a waiting water taxi. On check in we were upgraded to a great room with a view of the lagoon and St Marks. The room and service throught was fantastic and we have just booked to return at Christmas. The hotel is very quiet and relaxing and the 15 minute boat service to St Marks was always running on time throughout our stay. (Dont worry they run every 20 mins both ways ). Its a great place to retreat from the crowds in town.

Reviews.Title: “Undoubtedly the best hotel I've visited”
Reviews.Author: aahjnnot
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in many five star hotels, but none has ever matched the consistent excellence of the San Clemente Palace. Location comes first. Venice is outstandingly beautiful, but it's also claustrophobic, crowded and exhausting; to me, the city is best appreciated in a series of short, sharp bursts. And that's where the San Clemente Palace scores - it's only 10 minutes by free shuttle from St Mark's piazza and a short taxi ride from anywhere else in the city, but it's a haven of peace and tranquility. You can spend the morning in the city, return to the pool for a few hours to escape the heat of the day and then head back to the city in the cool of the evening. Few other Venetian hotels offer that perfect combination. The best way to arrive is by water taxi. It costs EUR100 from the airport, but you didn't come here for a cheap holiday. You certainly don't want get off to a bad start by battling the crowds on the vaporetti or looking anxiously for the unmarked jetty near St Mark's piazza where the San Clemente shuttle boat docks. The taxi ride takes about 30 minutes and gives you magnificent views of the Venetian skyline - quite apart from the convenience, the fare is fully justified by the enjoyment of the ride. We were immediately taken care of when our taxi pulled in to the hotel. Our luggage was promptly offloaded and taken away while we strolled through the beautiful gardens toward the deserted reception area. Our deluxe room was upgraded to a suite (our package offered an automatic room upgrade, subject to availability) and the helpful receptionist escorted us to our rooms and talked us through all of the hotel's features and services. The hotel and the room were magnificent - serene, spacious and elegant. The decor skillfully mixes traditional and contemporary design elements, generally understated with exquisite detailing, and everything is maintained to a very high standard. Our room was large and light with an enormous bed, and the marble bathroom was similarly spacious with a separate toilet, two sinks, a walk-in shower and a bath. Earlier this year I stayed in a so-called 5* hotel where my entire accommodation would have fitted comfortably into the bathroom in the San Clemente. We used both principal restaurants in the hotel, and both were excellent although neither was cheap. The gourmet CÃ  dei Frati caught me out (along with several other guests) as it does not permit men to wear short-sleeved shirts, but the maitre d discreetly found me a jacket to spare me from returning to my room to change. The food was delicately refined, both in flavour and presentation, and the atmosphere intimate and formal without being stuffy. We also ate in Le Maschere. Like all the diners that evening we ate outside near the water's edge and enjoyed the nighttime views across the lagoon. The menu in Le Maschere is much more typical of northern Italy and the flavours are correspondingly more robust. My wife and I both slightly preferred this restaurant but we would regard either as being outstanding if it were transported to our home in Wales. Both restaurants share an extensive wine list, although, unlike other parts of southern Europe, rose wines were very scarce with only two listed. Prices started at around EUR30 for a bottle. Against this excellence, breakfast was slightly disappointing - pleasant enough but typically unmemorable hotel fare. Service was perfect at every level throughout our stay. The closest we came to bad service at any time was when my wine glass was allowed to remain empty for about a minute. When I moved to refill it the waiter realised his error, called an apology across the restaurant and literally ran to correct his mistake. His evident embarrassment at such a tiny incident demonstrates the standards that the hotel expects of its staff. The pool was very quiet, especially around lunchtime. The staff there were very attentive, greeting us with towels and periodically rearranging my parasol to ensure the shade remained exactly in accordance with my wishes as the sun moved across the sky. We left by taxi. As I had by now come to expect, our bill was correctly calculated and waiting for me on my departure. We arrived at the jetty five minutes ahead of schedule, but our luggage and the taxi were already waiting for us. Perfect. Will we return? You bet we will!

Reviews.Title: “For us the perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: patacakeUk
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in July, our second visit. We loved it. We know Venice well. We sometimes stay at hotels, sometimes we take an apartment, but the San Clemente is somewhere we would happily stay again and again. The service was faultless, the breakfasts wonderful and the room delightful though we only had a standard room on this visit. We were amazed so many people were at breakfast, our room was so quiet you would have thought we had the hotel to ourselves. I'm surprised there are some negetive reviews. Our only complaint was the behaviour of an American family with children who made so much noise in the pool we left early. The father was the loudest of all and we had to endure what he'd been doing during the day and what he thought of this, and what he thought of that when chatting to other people in the pool. On our first visit last May it was too cold to use the pool so we were disappointed by the noise level this time around. We were only staying 4 nights on this occasion and prayed that they would be leaving before we did. Alas, no. We certainly would stay there again, though we were alarmed to hear the father say that he would stay there again too as he thought it was better value than the Cipriani!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Service Especially the check out process.”
Reviews.Author: VSS13
Reviews.Content: I was staying at Saint Clemente Palace Hotel from Aug 29th - Sept 1st. Two bookings were made for this stay. Aug 29th - Aug 31st was made from the website . Since there was no classic rooms available for Aug 31st - Sept 1st. This booking was made thru orbitz and was prepaid. When we checked in on Aug 29th, we explained this to clerk and a credit card guarantee was provided. The problem started on Sept 1st, the morning we had to check out. We had a 11:23 train to catch from Venice station to Rome. I went to the front desk around 9:35 requesting that I need to check out. There were two ladies at the check out counter. At first the lady told me that there was nothing to check out since everything was prepaid. I said no I had no prepaid for two days and I needed a bill in any circumstance. She said she would not be able to give me a bill since everything was prepaid. I asked her to check once more. She said she would prepare a bill. Meanwhile i had requested for someone for help with my luggage from my room. The luggage was picked from my room and left under the staircase.So my husband had to go behind the guy for the luggage. In between there was another guest who came with some questions and the other person at the front desk was attending to her. The lady who was supposed to prepare my bill, went to listen to her. Finally at 9:55 one of the ladies gave me a bill. She did not ask me to provide my card again just gave the bill which I thought was final,since my card was already on the records to charge to. I went to shuttle boat to catch my 10;00 Shuttle so I could reach the station in time. But at the gate , I was detained by the security saying that I had not paid my bill . My bags were removed from the shuttle. So I went back ot the hotel . This time, I talked to a different gentleman . He immediately relooked the bill had in 2 minutes got my card and gave me a receipt . This time the guard let me through. but the shuttle which i needed to catch the train had left. So not to mix the train I had to take a water taxi and pay 70 Euro extra. The whole morning routine was frustrating . I have no idea why it takes 25 minutes to check out someone with two people at front desk and two people total in the queue. Meanwhile there were other guest complaining about luggage's which had not been picked on time. We made complaints both at the reception and to the site but no has yet responded. It looks like they don't care about the service.

Reviews.Title: “Serenity found in Venice”
Reviews.Author: ATNDubai
