Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently spent five days in Venice, booking our Hotel upon arrival, at the airport. We were looking for a high-end accomodation and ended up spending 3 days at the San Clemente Palace and 2 at the Bauer. The San Clemente Palace was one of the best value for money that we've had the pleasure of experiencing, at the uper end of the market, and on our sixth trip to Venice. It is ideally located, pleasantly quiet on its own island, food was good (albeit very expensive), service was excellent, rooms were plesant with modern and well equiped bathroom as well as in-room internet access,spa staff and treatments were perfect, pool was great after a day walking around town, and the boat ride back to your hotel makes you feel...different... We shall definitely be returning upon our next trip to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Thank you Luigi and San Clemente Palace staff”
Reviews.Author: Willitsgoodtotalk
Reviews.Content: From August 26th 07 for 5 nights my family and I stayed at the San Clemente Palace Hotel in 2 Junior Suites 345 and 346 top floor overlooking the breakfast courtyard and with some sea views i have read all comments re the hotel before we went and now after returning, all I can say is everyone has different experiences where-ever they stay, so with that in mind here is our experience at the San Clemence Palace Hotel. Before arriving at the hotel we asked for 2 junior suites to be on the top floor next door to each other as our children are aged 12 and 15 any problems at least we would be nearby. We arrived at the hotel by their own shuttle launch after receiving detailed explanations from the hotel on where it would be by St Marks square no problems at all, the boatman was absolutely brilliant in helping with our cases etc, we used the shuttle a lot during the 5 days in which there were different boatmen, each one showed the same level of curtesy to myself and my family. We arrived at the Hotel docking area and was met by the person that was in charge of all boats docking and dropping off their cargo or clients, our luggage was identified and was waiting for us in our rooms no problems at all. At the reception area we were welcomed by a male staff member unfortunately his name escapes me, but his level of care and detail does not, even showing us up to our rooms (and yes we did get what we asked for previously) and pointing out some hotel features on the way, so we thank you if you are reading this. The rooms were a delight and no problems at all in appearance everything that we expected from a 5 star was there except for tea / coffee facilities it was lucky that we had brought with us our trusty travel kettle. The same time that we were staying at the hotel there was a Society wedding and reception (Tamara Beckwith) taking place which did interfere with my sleep on the 27th as outside by the church end their was a stage that was built for bands etc, unfortunately the music rebounded into our rooms the thud thud thud of the beat, so at 1.20am I phoned the duty manager he was not there so I left a message with one of his staff to ask him to call me, 1.50am I phoned again to ask why the duty manager had not phoned me and was told "dont worry sir he will phone you in a few minutes" at 2.30am I wrote out a letter to the General Manager to complain about the lack of respect that his duty manager was showing me in not returning my calls re the noise. About 9am I delivered my hand written note to reception went off for breakfast and then to St Marks square, unfortunately due to the lack of sleep we returned early to the hotel, where upon we had found out that the General Manager had called a meeting with the relevant staff and asked his operations manager Luigi to contact us which he did, the outcome was that the Hotel aplogised they had assumed that by placing us in the rooms we would not be disturbed by the music, they apologised for the lack of respect shown to me by one of their managers and what could they do to rectify the problem, the upshot was that my family and I had a superb evening meal with ALL drinks free of charge so I must say my complaint was handled very very quickly to my satisfaction. Everywhere we went within the Hotel be it the breakfast room, restaurant, swimming pool, shuttle boat, reception, concierge, in the hallways, the staff were brilliant, always polite. We stay at 5 star hotels on a regular basis, this hotel is my wifes favourite and wants us to come back again for xmas so our experience all in all with San Clemente was a pleasant one. Oh and Tamara looked radiant in her wedding dress as well.

Reviews.Title: “Lacking Attention to Detail in Certain Areas”
Reviews.Author: pineconemania
Reviews.Content: I booked this through Leading Hotels of the World, as a member of their Leaders Club. This was a short stay of only one night. When we went for the boat to the island we had the problem that the boat jetty doesnt have any obvious signs that it is the correct place. The boat driver wa courteous. When we arrived the receptionist was very friendly and we had a nice chat. Our room wasnt ready yet (we were a little early) so we decided to have a little stroll around the hotel. The American bar looked very nice so we stopped for a drink. It was reasonably priced for a hotel of this category and the service was prompt and friendly. So far we were quite impressed. We checked in around half an hour after we arrived and our room was nicely decorated (paintwork on the walls was a little scuffed but this didnt hamper my opinion of the room). The bathroom had everything I would expect in a five star hotel, the toiletries had their own labels. I read an earlier post which mentioned they had no hair conditioner - this must have been rectified as we had some in our room. Prices in the minibar were steep but we expect it in hotels like this. We used the spa (the lady looked surprised to see anybody) which we had to ourselves. There was two jacuzzis, steam room, sauna and relaxation area. There were no changing rooms (just a toilet which surprised me as I dont like to get changed in a toilet cubicle) but there were lockers. There was no availability of water to drink which also surprised me. We then went to the pool (the walk through the grounds is lovely) but found it very shambolic here. The lifeguard was in the middle of cleaning out a cupboard with piles of random things everywhere, so didnt look like she was the person to see for keys for the lockers (or to get pool towels from) but she was. It took a while to realise that. The atmposphere at the pool wasnt the best. People were smoking on the side of the pool and not using an ashtray which is a bit offputting. Also, there were alot of children jumping in and out of the pool - not the hotel's fault though, and this would be a good thing for families I am sure. Just a small thing that irked me was that a family arrived who wanted three sunloungers together facing the sun, while we were in the pool. The lifeguard came and moved our sunlounger (with our things on it) along to accommodate them, but in the process moved our loungers out of the sun, not so accommodating to us. Turndown service was a bit poor - I'm used to getting a little gift but they only left a bottle of warm water. Restaurant for breakfast buffet was not impressive at all. The room was tiny and had very little space between the tables, therefore we had no privacy as both tables around us were occupied. And there were small things that werent right, like there were no small spoons to eat the yoghurts with, and there was no butter to be found when I was looking for it. They keep it in a big basket away from the breads and it had run out. Very odd. The choice was ok, not great but ok. It is worth mentioning that the staff were very good (except the lifeguard) in particular the concierge, receptionists and the restaurant, but everybody was pleasant and anyone you met in the corridor would smile and greet you with a friendly word or two. It's a nice hotel but I wouldnt return here if the Cipriani was available (unfortunately it was full when I checked), but it is still better than the Danieli (my least favourite hotel in Venice).

Reviews.Title: “To be avoided at all costs”
Reviews.Author: victoria17
Reviews.Content: An echoing, soulless morgue with very variable levels of service. We decided to stay here as we have two teenage children and we thought the gym and swimming pool would help them to balance the culture on the mainland, particularly as we were going at a time of the year when Venice is hot and overcrowded. I knew it was expensive , but no-where in Venice is cheap. We stayed there for four nights and in that time I had to complain about a number of things but the main elements were; a filthy bath when we arrived, shower door falling off its hinges, dirty plates remaining uncleared from our room for two days ( I eventually left them outside in the corridor|),no hot water ( two phone calls and a trip to reception to sort this out), returning from Venice at 14.00 one day our rooms were untouched and the beds unmade,. There were other things but I think that this conveys the general sense of bad management. This is not a five star hotel by any stretch of the imagination. In an effort to be fair I would have to say that the two attendants at the swimming pool were unfailingly charming and helpful. If we go back to Venice again in the summer we will stay again at the Hotel des Bains on the Lido, where we stayed last time and which was delightful and worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect getaway from near-by Venice”
Reviews.Author: TravelfanNewYork
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last summer for 4 nights. It is really a fantastic hotel. This was part of a 2 week trip to Italy that included stays at the Hotel de Russie in Rome and the Savoy in Florence, both really beautiful properties, and the San Clemente compared favorably with both and slightly less expensive. Yes, it's a large hotel, but it is the only property on a private island, so even fully booked the hotel and grounds felt spacious and uncrowded. The building is ancient and gorgeous. The hallways are very wide and gracious, and the overall feeling is very luxurious. Our room (a deluxe) was very nice. The floors have enormous ceiling heights, so my guess is that even a regular room would feel spacious. The pool area is terrific. The little 3-hole pitch-and-putt golf course seemed a little out of place, but again, the fact that there's space for such an amenity makes the whole palce seem large. What is really exceptional about this place is how much of an antidote it is to the craziness and tourist crowds of Venice. We really enjoyed riding the launch from St. Marks to the hotel, which feels really serene after leaving the hordes. I find I rarely agee with complaints I read about service in hotels, particularly those in the 5-star catergory. Maybe our needs are simpler than most people. Basically, there were staff people everywhere, a very accommodating concierege to make suggestions and reservations for restaurants, pleasant front desk people and wait staff, a great buffet breakfast. Overall, a terrific experience.

Reviews.Title: “Resort Like!!!”
Reviews.Author: FadiandSara
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights in this hotel as our last stop on our honeymoon.. the Palace was AMAZING as it is an island with many facilities on deck! the shuttle boat to and from the city center was very useful but from the train station its a little tricky to catch if you didnt do the research (as you will still need to grab a taxi or walk for a good while until you get to the city center where the Palace shuttle awaits).. the room service was very nice and the rooms were quite spacious and modern.. the conceige desk could be a little more helpful but they can do the basic stuff.. the swimming pool was great and they have a spa on site which we didnt get the chance to try.. taxi boat to the airport took 95 euros which was ouch but the only convenient way to get to the airport in time!!! will go there again for sure

Reviews.Title: “SUPERB, BREATH OF FRESH AIR”
Reviews.Author: matthew-newbie
Reviews.Content: Have just come back from a long weekend in Venice staying at the San Clemente Palace. What a perfect treat absolutely fabulous, a welcome break from the hustle and bustle. Could not fault it.

Reviews.Title: “An outstanding hotel in a fabulous location - we loved it.”
Reviews.Author: The_Muzungu
Reviews.Content: I booked the San Clemente for a wedding anniversary trip, staying three nights having flown direct from the UK to Marco Polo. This is a wonderful hotel - one of the best we've ever stayed in and I highly recommend it if you are looking for somewhere special to stay in Venice. We booked through [--]and the BA flights plus three nights here came to just over Â£1,000, which honestly wasn't that much more than lots of the average hotels I looked at. As you will have read, it has its own island, which is a very pleasant 15 minute ride in their luxury, air-conditioned, two cabined boat (the journey time is halved at night when they tend to ignore the very tight speed limits). The boat leaves from right in front of Gardini Reali, which fronts St Marks Plazza - it couldn't be more central. It is also about 20 yards from the San Marco Alilaguna stop - which is the public transport from the airport (although our recommendation is to really consider the very expensive, but sooo much cooler water taxis from the airport to the hotel. Some of the Alilaguna public bus boats only have closed windows that are very dirty from sea spray - they take ages, and for groups of four or more the price difference starts to narrow - it's the one thing we'd have done that we didn't). The boat is very punctual, and if you miss it then there is another in 20 minutes - and given you will either have St Marks Plazza or the hotel's beautiful grounds to wander around while you wait - well, you might find yourself like us, sometimes missing it on purpose! On arrival our bags were carried to reception as we walked up the pathway through the beautiful wooded grounds to the entrance. We arrived late evening, and there was only one receptionist, so we had to wait a little - but that was the only negative experience with the hotel the entire time. We received an upgrade from the standard room to a deluxe, and ended up in a beautiful room on the top floor, with views over the grounds and towards Venice (see my photos). The room was perfect, stylishly furnished, a strong Venetian feel, but not over the top. Comfortable bed, cabinetted TV with good films and usable internet access with an infrared keyboard. The room also had wifi internet access, which appears new. A very nice bathroom with huge shower (pressure was fine, if not very strong), large bath and a delightful set of bath and shower gels. We had very comfortable robes and slippers, and to top it all, a chilled bottle of champagne with a personal greeting from the staff was waiting for us. The room was prepared twice a day, once in the morning, usually while we'd been to breakfast, and then the beds were turned down in the afternoon - very nice. Breakfast was superb - an excellent range of everything you could hope for, cereal, fruit, continental and cooked (including perfect scrambled eggs - a good thing to judge the cooking by) There was also a bottle of bubbly (to make bucks fizz each morning with the freshly squeezed orange juice), prompt service, and lovely outdoor courtyard if you prefer to sit there. On our first night we went a little crazy and ate in the top restaurant, the CÃ  dei Frati. It was the best meal we have probably ever eaten - and one of the most expensive. The waiters were charming, knowledgeable and kept just the right balance of attention and leaving you to yourselves. We went for the fixed price 'Gourmet menu' at 110 euros each, plus wine starting from about 30 euros a bottle (or 10 a glass). This five course meal ended up at about eight courses, as the chef prepares various little surprises that the waiters bring to you with large smiles. The food was superb - and as I looked at the prices, it was only perhaps 20% more than the 'casual' restaurant at the hotel - Le Maschere, which others said was very good too. What CÃ  dei Frati also has however, is possibly the best view of any restaurant in Venice! Located the top floor of the hotel, in a timber beamed room (it used to be the drying room of the monastery's laundry) it has HUGE windows that look out over the lagoon and Venice beyond. Make sure you book so you are there for the sun setting - it was unforgettable. The pool was lovely, we snatched some time there on our last day. Very clean, a good temperature and set in beautiful grounds just outside the hotel. They have started doing evening barbecues there which seemed to be the best value eating at the hotel. I had a quick trip to the (free) spa which had a nice sauna and turkish bath area, plus two large jacuzzis. I didn't see the small gym upstairs. Massages start at around 40 euros I think. The concierges were excellent, confirming our tour of the Doges Palace for us (search the forums for the 'Secret itinerary' tour details, it was a great behind-the-scenes visit for not much extra than the normal entrance price). They also recommended an excellent, classical venetian restaurant owned by a lovely couple, called Osteria Oliva Nera, not far from St Marks, which was delightful for our last night. I can't recommend the San Clemente Palace highly enough. If your budget can stretch that little bit further, and you can find a good deal, then go for it - it's fabulous, and great value at the price we got. View my photos to get a better idea.

Reviews.Title: “A breath of fresh air”
Reviews.Author: amenophis
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful property. It's a big hotel with conference facilities so if you're looking for a small, intimate hotel with lots of charm, look elsewhere. Booked through a web site. There were 3 categories of rooms ; standard, de luxe and junior suites. As the junior suites and de luxe rooms were the same price, I took a junior suite. However on arriving we were given a deluxe room. The room, 234, was beautiful with a marvellous view towards St Mark's. It seems to be the one shown on the hotel's web site. However, one is not in the room sufficiently to justify the additional â‚¬120 a day this view costs over a standard room, which is what I would take next time. The staff were very discrete and helpful. The boat service to St Mark's works really well. It leaves every 20 minutes and the ride takes 15 minutes. It was great to be able to leave the hustle and bustle of Venice to get back to the peace of the San Clemente a few minutes later. The pool is excellent. WARNING . The umbrellas do not protect very well against the sun. I got burnt despite being in their shade. Contrary to what others have posted, the tennis courts are excellent. One is hard court, Green Set type, the other is synthetic grass. Both are in excellent repair and the nets are fine. As others have mentioned, food and beverage are outrageously expensive. I confirm, a small 2dl Coke costs â‚¬7. However, all the tourist areas in Venice are also exorbitantly expensive. Compared to other places, and given what's on offer, the San Clemente seemed almost reasonable. We were sad to leave the San Clemente after a week's stay. The taxi to Piazzale Roma costs â‚¬70. Would definitely stay here again, although I would take a standard room next time.

Reviews.Title: “Magical hotel”
Reviews.Author: Shelly75
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the San Clemente Palace hotel for the first 3 nights of our honeymoon in Italy and had the most fantastic experience. We were greeted by very friendly hotel staff and were upgraded on arrival. The hotel itself was a very attractive building with lovely gardens. We didn't use the pool but did play on the 3 hole pitch and putt which was great for a bit of fun! The hotel is very well located and although a 10 min trip on private taxi service is well worth it to get away from the sometimes overwhelming hustle and bustle of St Marks Square and the tourist-heavy areas of Venice centre. The room itself was both spacious and luxurious and well-befitting of the five star status of the hotel. The bathroom was beautifully decorated in marble and both room and bathroom were in immaculate condition. We are looking forward to our next visit to the San Clemente Palace!

Reviews.Title: “Unreal!”
Reviews.Author: The4Explorers
Reviews.Content: This palace sits on a small island in close proximity to 'mainland' Venice. Truly amazing, like something out of a book. All hotel staff were extremely friendly. The grounds were immaculate. I felt like I was a princess in my own castle. All amenties were extremely luxurious and clean. The complimentary breakfast was out of this world--everything was fresh and gorgeous if you can describe a breakfast setting like that! It would be the only place I would stay if I get to go back to Venice one day. The private ferry service to the hotel was very efficient. Our train arrived late which put us at the ferry docks rather late. We had to wait quite a bit but it probably only seemed long because we were in a foreign place and not sure if we were in the right place to get to the hotel ferry. There is a small church-San Clemente right on the grounds of this hotel. Definitely take time to explore the entire island. You are spending a fortune on this once in a lifetime vacation to Italy, right? Indulge, stay here, even if it's just for a night or two!

Reviews.Title: “perfect choice”
Reviews.Author: byrony7
Reviews.Content: We have just come home after a 5 nights at the San Clemente. It was a great experience. Our classic suite was spacious for the 3 of us ( myself and my 2 teenage sons) and the bathroom superb although water pressure low in the shower cubicle. We particularly enjoyed the pool and got into the pattern of coming back to the hotel at around 3/4pm for a swim etc and then going back into venice for dinner. Food/drink in the hotel was prohibitively expensive - a small bottle of coca cola 7 euros. However meals out in Venice were also very pricey and there was too much nouvelle cuisine particularly for my 17 year old son. The hotel boat was comfortable and very reliable and the courtesy trip to Murano great fun. I had originally booked another hotel in Venice centre and definitely feel that I made the right decision in cancelling it. The staff were helpful on the whole particularly the concierge, Francisco. Breakfast was included and excellent. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Resort”
Reviews.Author: TravelingXX
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a 5 star, deluxe property, yet at reasonable rates, compared to other Venice properties. The hotel water taxi, bellman, front desk staff, and concierge staff are superb, and most speak several languages. The property is beautiful, inside and out. If you are looking for a place to be pampered, that is quiet, sophisticated, romantic, and elegant, this is the place to go. The pool area is beautiful, as are the views, all around. We stayed in suite rooms, and they were spacious and well appointed. I travel frequently, and I highly recommend this hotel. If you like fine dining, their upscale restaurant is superb, with an exceptionally good wine list, great cuisine, and a lovely wine list.

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: David-RR
Reviews.Content: Just back from the San Clemente, this is just a fabulous hotel. We had deluxe lagoon view rooms the marble bathrooms are some of the best I have seen. Service was excellent we had a problem with not enough soap rang housekeeping and this was sorted in less than 5 minutes. The private launch to St Marks is the best, we did not wait more than 10 mins. Ask for the private boat to Murano you do get taken to just one factory but it is a good one and they will take you back to the hotel or to St Marks free. St Marks is a bit of a rip off but you learn to pay up and grumble . Food in the hotel is expensive two cokes and two burgers on our first day Â£56 which is more expensive than Dubai. I found the hotel a relaxing oasis from the heat and crowds in St Marks you really start to look forward to getting on the launch to get back. I would love to go back for me this hotel is just perfect

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Grounds but Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: LaVida
Reviews.Content: This hotel has beautiful grounds and the rooms were clean and luxurious. We were disappointed with the service. We carried our own bags onto the boat as two hotel staff watched without offering to help. The same thing happened when we got off the boat and we carried our own baggage to the front desk. Only after we checked in were we offered assistance getting our bags to the room. Of course at that point, the walk was much shorter. The water is extremely hard and the hotel does not supply cream rinse so make sure you carry your own if you have long hair. I was able to find some in the spa (even though the front desk told me the spa did not have cream rinse) for 20 Euros. The front desk also told us that that we'd have to leave the island to purchase a toothbrush if we forgot one. The breakfast buffet is fabulous and the wait staff at the restaurants are kind and responsive. But the prices are extremely high -- we paid 63 euros for 4 glasses of sprite and 2 beers. Finally, the Conceige recommended a tour of a glass factory that turned out to be simply a high pressure sales job. We spent 5 minutes or less in the factory and were ushered to the sales department. One wonders if the Conceige is paid a commission when this routine is succesful. If we return to Venice, we will stay at a different hotel -- and that would be our decision even if price were not a factor.

Reviews.Title: “so relaxing”
Reviews.Author: burlington7
Reviews.Content: I took my beutiful wife there last year around the same time for a 40th suprise birthday and we loved it so much we had to go back again this year. If this can be possible we enjoyed our stay even more, the staff are all very freindly and Mario the manager of customer relations so helpful we had a room up-grade and a bottle of bubbly in our room which made the start to our weekend so nice. Venice agrees with us as the weather was sun-blue skys and the water still like a mirror. The pool area is so relaxing and the staff work very hard to make things comfortable.The spa area is worth a visit as it is very quiet and we had the jacuzzi to ourselves. We will definatly be going again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, a bit quiet and well over priced”
Reviews.Author: andybrown999
Reviews.Content: We stopped at the SC with our friends and both couples were celebrating wedding anniversaries; it was our 23rd and our friends 21st. We let the hotel know about this in advance and anticipated some â€˜royal treatmentâ€™ (having read about all the lovely upgrades that other reviewers had received) and we were disappointed. The hotel was hosting an Italian/USA joint committee event and so was fully booked so we were left with our standard rooms (ah well, never mind). I did think though, that we might get a complimentary bottle of bubbly, or a bowl of fruit or even a â€œhappy anniversaryâ€� from the staff â€“ no, nothing: nadda â€“ I thought that some kind of acknowledgement would have been nice. We paid a high price for the hotel (for a treat) and expected a very high standard of service, which generally we did get â€“ though the booking in process was messy and we ended up grabbing our key cards and seeing ourselves to the room because of the long wait (not really the best start with a five star hotel). The place itself is a bit weird because it is so big. The corridors go on forever and so the overall atmosphere is â€˜austereâ€™ rather than â€˜niceâ€™. The hotel is on an island and has a beautiful pool and some breathtaking views of the Lido and Venice. We enjoyed the food at the pool (25 Euros for a burger so bring a fat wallet!) and in the Restaurant "Ca dei Frati" we enjoyed views over the lagoon and a nice meal (a nice way to spend an evening, dress to kill and empty your wallets!). I thought the waiters to be a bit â€˜up themselvesâ€™ and I cant be doing with all that palaver when serving food (two waiters serving plates in synchronisation with each other etc) though the meal was nice and there was an excellent waiter â€“ a nice guy very attentive and smiley. I asked for a beer from the head waiter guy (an un-smiley one) and got the sour faced treatment which I didnâ€™t like (I got my beer though â€“ the customer is always right). The cocktail bar is great and very atmospheric and the boat to and from San Marco was smashing. Iâ€™m glad we went â€“ we really enjoyed it but it was over priced and we wouldnâ€™t go back (sorry).

Reviews.Title: “Luxury and serenity in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Traveller885
Reviews.Content: This hotel is an oasis of calm in the lagoon a short shuttle boat ride from St. Mark's, far from the touristy crush of Venice proper and regal in its grounds, furnishings, and spaciousness. Staff is ultra-professional and friendly; the breakfast buffet is bountiful and delicious; bathrooms are marble mini-palaces; in fact, if I keep mentioning various aspects of this property (the superior quality of the linens and towels; the complimentary overnight shoe shine service, which one no longer finds often in hotels around the world; the peaceful, olympic sized, well-designed outdoor swimming pool; the top-notch beds) it sounds like I'm exaggerating. In fact, this is a hotel that not only lives up to its advance billing but exceeds expectations in virtually allm regards. Note: When I arrived at the hotel, a G-6 meeting was going on, which meant that secret service types from all countries involved were prowling the grounds of the hotel, the hallways, and even the lagoon. All guests went through security checks on arriving at the island (and each time coming back from Venice) with metal detectors just as is done in airports, but the staff managed to make this seem a minor inconvenience and showed complete aplomb during this event.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise”
Reviews.Author: jp7124
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at many Four Seasons and Ritz Carlton's, both domestic and international. The San Clemente Palace is as fine a property as there is. It is on a private island only accessible by the hotel's boat. The scale of the hotel's sitting areas, hallways and rooms must be seen to believe. The service and staff was at a level of what should be expected at a hotel in this class.

Reviews.Title: “Room with a View and Best Spa Retreat”
Reviews.Author: FatPrincessTraveller
Reviews.Content: As first time visitors to Venice I couldn't have been more enchanted with our stay at San clemente hotel, Venice. It is absolutely ideal as it is set on it's own dreamy island only 10 mins ride on glamorous (complimentary) boat to the centre of Venice itself. The room we had was with the most spectacular view across the water to San marco itself (no other view like it in Venice as it's so tightly packed). The best view is from a slight distance with the sound of tolling bells across the water. The sense of 'escape' after a day trekking around the twisting turning tourist packed streets of venice is such a welcome relief. The use of the spa is complimentary (and the staff gentle, attentive and caring). If you have your huge breakfast and then go straight to the spa until after midday you virtually have it to yourself as everyone else is huffing it around Venice. I'm tremendously body conscious so to me this was total heaven - I didn't have to worry about my cellulite once!I I recommend hitting Venice mid afternoon after chilling in the Spa and staying in Venice for Dinner (if you can afford to but I recommend eating in the hotel). The staff at the Hotel are marvellous. There are complimentary things you must ask about such as a FREE boat ride to Merano (glass factory) provided as part of staying at the hotel - you practically speed boat it to Merano in 15 minutes like a movie star on the deck of a boat! ...(but you have to get the vapouretti back - who cares - not I). The foyer, seating areas, bars and restaurants are absolute heaven, really tastefully decorated with big fluffy pillows and leany things. BIG TIP: We learned that is is about the same price to eat IN the hotel restuarant in glamorous settings as it is to eat IN Venice (where you WILL BE RIPPED OFF horribly - average, basic meal 50 pounds for two) and the ambiance is like a greasy egg and spoon caf in most places! The newly opened top notch silver service restuarant at the hotel is HEAVEN with views of venice in distance - you can eat eat there if you have two courses as there are lots of 'compliments of the chef' dishes between courses. Three courses are for 'millionaires, Rodney' - but well worth it I'm sure. The waiters are lovely as they are polite and charming and flirt with you slightly even if you are ugly. Everything to the constant supply of fuzzy slippers and robes (used in the Spa and rooms etc) to the marvellous food and courteous and professional staff will make this a holiday of a lifetime whatever your age (looks and financial situation). The ONLY criticism I would have is that there was no free internet access either in main computer areas or in your room but if that's my only winge given that I am a 100% princess when it comes to travelling...then you are on to a winner! Do NOT hesitate with this choice. It is the best choice for Venice as it is secluded but so near to the everything when you want it.

Reviews.Title: “One of a kind”
Reviews.Author: Kasslyn192
Reviews.Content: This hotel must be one of the best that I have ever stayed in, the location was brilliant, especially as you feel so safe there in comparison to the hustle and bustle of St. Marks and the centre of Venice. But on the other hand, it wasn't that hard to get to because of the shuttle service. I can't convey how relaxing it was, the food was without fault, the service was really attentive and everything was so clean. It was flawless, worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “Just Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Fab&Finy
Reviews.Content: This is it! Loved the place, no exception! Our exec suite was fantastic (apparently the one where Sofia Loren stayed a couple of years ago) with a lovely view of Venice, facing San Marco square. Service was outstanding, always there when needed and friendly, yet far enough to leave us our space. Not sure why someone indicated they felt the personnel were â€œcoldâ€�. I though, they were perfectly trained to provide the level of service a 5 * Lux hotel should provide. Everyone speaks English and Alessandro, one of the concierges would always take time to explain in detail anything. To us this was just a perfect place

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous honeymoon hotel”
Reviews.Author: rosmus
Reviews.Content: Venice in September is mad - so how lovely to get away to your 'own' island and glorious peace and quiet. Plus our room was stunning - with an incredible view of the lagoon. Big hotels usually mean noise - but not here. Restful, delightful and great service. Before we went we weren't sure about having to take a boat to get into town - but you never had to wait more than a couple of minutes and the journey was short and really lovely. Pretty much everything was as you'd want - the breakfast was good but not amazing but there's no other criticism we can come up with! And definitely recommend candle lit dining outside on the terrace. Not cheap - but seemed to be far more reasonable than any of the other five stars in Venice - and from what we saw of them we were very pleased with our choice

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful if a little impersonal”
Reviews.Author: ZiggyAiredale
Reviews.Content: Whilst this is a beautiful property and the service can't really be faulted, it is a bit large and impersonal for my liking. Whilst I can't really fault the room it lacked warmth and atmosphere, and surely that is what Venice is all about. I love nothing better than to stroll the streets of Venice after a long dinner, and found the San Clemente left me feeling a little cut off - although the boat is magical. I don't think it compares to the Danieli or the Cipriani, or even in my opinion to less expensive gems such as Palazzo Abadessa which has twice as much atmosphere. We visited in winter though, and in summer I can imagine the san clemente palace would be a welcome retreat.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, pricy, quiet, perfect if you have the bucks”
Reviews.Author: magical127
Reviews.Content: My friends, family and I stayed at San Clemente from 9/29 through 10/2 and it was an absolutely beautiful hotel. We stayed during peak season and did not mind the shuttle to and from St. Mark's (actually it was better than staying in Venice proper as far as I'm concerned, since you avoid the traffic and noise). I think the longest I ever had to wait was about a half hour (and this was very late at night when they don't run as frequently- in the event you miss the last shuttle of the night, a phone call to the hotel will send a shuttle to come get you no matter what time it is!). Usually the wait was only 5-10 minutes, and there are benches nearby if you don't want to stand to wait (there are also street artists with their works for sale right nearby if you feel like shopping to kill those 5-10 minutes). From there you are a 2-minute walk to St. Mark's Square and about a 30-second walk to Harry's Bar. Water taxis and vaporettos are also right there. The shuttle takes about 10 minutes and it's a beautiful, scenic ride. Don't get offended at the boat driver half-yanking you to help you into and out of the boat- they just don't want you going in the drink. The rooms (we stayed in the classic rooms and a few friends stayed in a classic suite, which was large and excellent) were not overly spacious considering their price tag, but definitely had enough room for 2-3 people to negotiate within it. The bathroom was absolutely gorgeous, marble throughout. Deep marble tub and separate shower stall, bidet. Housekeeping kept everything immaculate. Watch out for the minibar prices, I think a can of Coke was something like EU 7. Free shoe-shining service if you stick your shoes outside the night before. All the usual and expected commodities were there for a 5-star (fridge, pay-per-view, writing desk, stationary, bath robes, slippers, very nice shampoo/soap/etc). The suite had a scale, separate closet/changing area, complimentary fruit/chocolate plate, separate bedroom with sliding doors, couch, table and 2 chairs. All rooms had beautiful cathedral ceilings and huge windows (that often did not have views but at least had something pleasant to look at outside). Staff was friendly and helpful enough, some were more accomodating than others but all gave professional service. The only problem I had with them is that messages that were given from the U.S. for me sometimes did not get relayed to me (only 1 message of the 3 came through to me, and that was only after I called regarding something else and was told 'oh, by the way, so-and-so called for you'). The English is not 100% (or even 50% with some staff members) and I feel this may have contributed to the problem. If you have difficulty walking you should try to request a room close to the main entrance as this is a HUGE property. I got lost every single day trying to find a friend or family member's room, no joke! This was my third time to Venice and if I could afford it again (which I probably can't, we spent about $500/night for a standard room) I'd gladly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Truely a Palace”
Reviews.Author: lshort
Reviews.Content: A magnificant venue in stuning surroundings. After a 15 minute boat ride on the hotel charter you arrive on the hotel island to be greeted by helpful pleasent staff who carry your bags to your room. We had booked a delux room but was upgraded to a junior suite, magnificant. After reading previous reports I was apprehensive about resturant prices, these I found to be compariable with main land Venice, the only downside to the hotel was the cost of the bar. Drinks generally in Venice were expensive. Breakfast was included within the price, with plenty to choose from. Shuttle times to the mainland and hotel were regular. I would recommend this hotel to anybody wishing a luxurious break, I will definately return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful haven”
Reviews.Author: Samfa73
Reviews.Content: Spent excellent New Years break here, despite worrying TA reviews. We were upgraded on arrival as break was partner's 40th birthday present & received courteous, efficient service from reception, including bubbly in room on arrival for birthday boy! Junior Suite was roomy, bed was huge & very comfortable, ate in lagoon view restaurant on first night; fabulous multi coursed experience. Whilst corridors are bare & wide, view of internal garden lit in fairy lights made up for it. Piped Xmas tunes still playing on 2nd Jan were a downside, along with one sulky barman who obviously didn't enjoy his job! Enjoyed sauna, steam room & jacuzzis, but would have loved an indoor pool! Would go back to the hotel in an instant, although expensive it was incredibly peaceful in contrast to the hubbub of beautiful Venice & the shuttle boat service couldn't be faulted. Would thoroughly recommend getting taxi from airport to hotel on arrival; its a very James Bond quick way to get to hotel, worth the â‚¬90 cost. New Year in St Mark's square was spine tingling - fireworks over the lagoon with no barging, just lots of whoops, dancing and vibrant atmosphere. Even managed to get a meal on NYE without booking in central Venice. Loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Christmas”
Reviews.Author: Jo_Bill
Reviews.Content: We spent a lovely Christmas at this large, luxury, island hotel. Our standard room was fine: very warm and comfortable with almost silent air-con. The bathroom had a bath and a walk-in shower and lots of marble.. Clean, starched linen bedclothes daily. Towels etc twice daily. Staff attentive and most helpful. The restaurant is sophisticated and first-class, but as one would expect in a hotel of this grade in Venice, nothing comes cheap. A high-light is the free shuttle boat trip to St Marco - a real delight.. Attached to the hotel is an amazing old church, disused and being restored, and well worth a visit If you like peace and quiet (rare in Venice) this is the place for you

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: belleboot
Reviews.Content: Myself and my boyfriend stayed at this hotel for 3 nights on the 15th December 2006. I have to say that our experience was fantastic. The hotel is really very very nice. It is huge, and spacious so you never feel ontop of any other guests...you can have your own space. We had booked a double and got upgraded on arrival to a deluxe double which was very nice. The room was lovely, nicely decorated and the bed was very comfortable. The turn down service was a nice touch, the rooms were cleaned every day and the sheets on the beds were changed every day which I thought was a nice touch also. The bathroom was huge with a lovely bath although it did take a little while to fill up! But the water was lovely and hot which was nice after a cold day in venice! Robes, slippers etc were all included in the room. We enjoyed very nice facials and massages in the spa, where the staff were very professional and very nice. Any downside to the stay? The price of food is very expensive. On arrival I got a club sandwich in the bar which cost me 25 euro! for a plain ham and cheese its 15! A 3 course dinner in the middle-priced restaurant with the cheapest bottle of wine cost us 190 euro! Needless to say it was delicious but a little expensive! The boat to venice was regular and always warm which was great. Staff were very friendly which was nice and they were very helpful. We would definitly stay here again at the drop of a hat. Its a lovely hotel and although the food there is expensive, it was very good and you could always eat out in Venice itself!

Reviews.Title: “Call off the search!”
Reviews.Author: Deb m
Reviews.Content: If you want to visit Venice and have some luxury while you there - look no further! This hotel is beautiful, classy and luxurious. We visited in December 2006 and i can highly recommend. We stayed in a Deluxe double room and i had previously read about people being upgraded. This didnt happen to us but our room was really nice anyway. The bathroom ws all marble and beautiful ( towel service Twice a day). Nice touches included bath robes and slippers and even bookmarks by your bed. They do a turn down service where they put the lamps on and leave a bottle of water beside your bed. The hotel decor was really grand and it was decorated beautiful for xmas. The only thing was it was really quiet which is not a minus to us but the bar area (which is really nice) was always empty. We loved the breakfasts there and found that the fresh fruit, cerals and cooked breakfast set us up the for the day, meaning we did not need a lunch. We also visited the spa once and had it all to ourelves ( although i did not have a treatment). The staff was very polite and very proffesional and the courtesy boat came every 30 minutes and was never late. The boat journey to town takes about 10/15 mins and we always enjoyed it. i would not hesitate to go back at all. Visiting at this time of the year meant we could not use the swimming pool, however seeing the hotel dressed up for xmas more than compensated this.

Reviews.Title: “Great Room, Mediocre Service, Inconvenient Location in the Winter - Not Haunted!”
Reviews.Author: cqt
Reviews.Content: During our last two trips to Venice, we stayed at the Westin Excelsior on Lido, but at this time of the year, it's closed. We were deciding between staying at the Hotel Gritti or the San Clemente Palace. After reading the inconsistent reviews and looking at the photos of the Hotel Gritti's room on this website, we decided that the San Clemente Palace would be more up our alley. Both times at the Excelsior on Lido, we went in late spring so the weather was nice and there was daylight savings so the sun didn't set til pretty late each night. We've never come to Venice in the winter before. Anyway, the room was very well-appointed and had great furnishings. We were upgraded to a junior suite, which I wasn't sure was a suite because it was one big room - quite different from the pics on their website. It looked more like their deluxe room. It was spacious and felt luxurious. The best part was that it felt new and well-kept. Likewise, the bathroom was nicely appointed with a separate shower stall from the tub. I felt that this room was far nicer than the rooms that we had at the Westin Excelsior. The free buffet breakfast was fine - nothing special. A spread with eggs, bacon, sausage, fruit, bread, cereals, fresh juices, etc. There was absolutely no variety but this wasn't a problem since we were there for a few days. We didn't try either of the hotel restaurants so I can't comment on them. The service was very mediocre and disappointing for this level of hotel. I find that my experiences with the hotel staff in Venice is disappointing in general. They just weren't helpful - seemed to be an almost alien concept. Most of the staff just stood around, especially the front desk staff and the concierges (with the shining exception of Alessandro Heinrich who was GREAT!). When I asked about the weather for the next morning, the concierge on staff said that he didn't know. I hadn't realised then that the hotel leaves a notice with the next day's weather by our bed. If the hotel had that information, why didn't the concierge?! Also, on our last day, I asked if we could have late check-out; I was offered 12pm. That is normal check-out time, and the annoying thing was that the hotel was probably only half-full, if that. Because of the weather (rain and wind), it was not ideal to stay at San Clemente Palace. We opted for this because we had done this before and really enjoyed the experience of staying away from the hordes of crowds on San Marco. However, we didn't anticipate what a pain it was to have to wait for the hotel's complimentary boat in the rain. Getting on and off the shuttle boat during high tide or rain was not fun - if you have limited mobility or are elderly, this is not the place for you during winter. Starting last week, the boat was on a 30 minute interval schedule so less convenient than the 15-20 minute intervals that we experienced on our 1st day there. I would recommend this hotel for the summer when all their resort facilities (e.g., pool, golf course) can be enjoyed. In the winter, probably more of a pain than it's worth. BTW, the long corridors were fine - they weren't ornately decorated, but was by no means sterile. I found it quite simple and tasteful. Who would want to have the hallways of the Overlook Hotel?! For the record, I seriously doubt that there is any spirit roaming here contrary to one of the previous reviews - this place is NOT haunted. It's almost laughable!!! ; )

Reviews.Title: “Beware Burlap Sheets”
Reviews.Author: TxHokie
Reviews.Content: First of all, San Clemente Palace was a very attractive facility, and I found the staff very friendly. There were two significant negatives, however. First, during the off season, the very large hotel seemed almost deserted. This made its location on a seperate island (a short 10 minute water taxi ride) more of an issue, at least if you are looking for anything more than simple pease and quiet. Second, given the overall good quality of the facilities, the linens were HORRIBLE. I felt like I was sleeping on burlap.

Reviews.Title: “Not a Great Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: JNSW
Reviews.Content: The San Clemente was pretty, but felt deserted. We rarely saw another human being. It was also very spooky - the huge corridors are unfurnished and remind one of the psychiatric hospital history. Here are my main observations: 1. The service was fair. Not terrible, but not wonderful. 2. The sheets were like burlap. We actually got a good laugh out of them - how could anyone actually make something out of that kind of fabric and expect people to sleep on them? 3. The shuttle wait times can be too long, especially after dinner. 4. The American bar was ridiculously expensive. 5. All guest computers broken. 6. No air conditioning or heat while we were there. 7. There are door sensors that tell staff if you are in the room or not. A bit overbearing. I wouldn't stay here again. It wasn't terrible, but it completely made me uncomfortable with the cold, spooky surroundings and deserted feel. I never slept well, not for one night. I was either uncomfortable in the burlap sheets or uncomfortable in the strange deserted atmosphere. It feels haunted. I recommend something in Venice proper.

Reviews.Title: “Loved San Clemente Palace”
Reviews.Author: fantravel
Reviews.Content: I wanted to offer one week stay in Venice to my parents and my partner. So I booked for two junior suites on san clemente palace website where special internet summer rates were very interesting. I was extremely satisfied of my trip from booking to end of stay. We booked a private taxiboat to go from airport to San Clemente island : amazing views and unusual exciting experience!! Arrival to the palace was very welcoming and smooth from the boy on the pier to the reception staff. Young man at reception was quite strict but extremely professional. He proposed to upgrade my parents to a large suite with view on San Marco. I was so happy for such gift to them. San Clemente Palace is beautiful, relaxing and luxurious. Nice swimming pool is a big big plus for a hotel in Venice. Rooms and suites are very large and nicely appointed. I have to say I am much more in contemporary minimalist-asian design style, but those rich, colored, decorative furniture, clothes and lightings are so nicely fitted with building and setting that it didn't bother me. Two minor negatives: - I didn't like so much large and very long corridors which give impersonal feeling, but I loved impressive stairways. - It is a pity there is no benches on the green area except at the entrance of the building. My parents liked to walked on the small island, but they could not have a sitting for a rest. Otherwise, we have only very good memories with San Clemente Palace: - the Palace is perfect for those seeking escape from hot and touristic jams in downtown Venice - Free shuttle boat from hotel to San Marco is great experience - Reception staff, concierge, breakfast staff , pool boys were very nice. Wd could sometimes feel that some young people were somehow inexperimented but they were always very smiling and helpful. - Food is great. - Setting is unique - Sunsets are beautiful - Swimming in the pool during very hot weather is brilliant I do recommend this hotel compared to other "not enough space" and stuffy hotels in Venice. It is a nice experience for a balance between this isolated quiet palace and busy escapes to downtown Venice.

Reviews.Title: “simply as it states”
Reviews.Author: TRAVELINLUXURY1
Reviews.Content: Fantastic stay going through italy and have stayed at some wonderful hotels but this one is joint top complete celeb life style thankyou all

Reviews.Title: “Our 30th anniversary”
Reviews.Author: SpencerT
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights in a junior Suite and from start to finish the hotel was great but very expensive making the most that they could from the guests. (cant blame them for that as most of them I suspect have lots of it!) Some nice touches such as a bottle of Bubbly in the room for our anniversary when we arrived. Bathroom facilities second to very few but the room a little basic for a five star. Breakfast was buffet but good with service for coffee and tea, and the option of being able to eat outside was pleasant when the weather was good. The Trip from the Airport was expensive but fine and the trip back was even better as the captain of the launch took us right through the centre of Venice. Worth paying even a bit more for and the going rate for the fare is Euro100 either way not including a tip. The (free) launch service to Venice was great but would get tedious if you stayed for longer then three nights. The pool area and gardens are great and a super place to relax and contemplate the huge cost of the privelege of being there. All in all a super hotel but do not go without any elusions about the cost. Total indulgence but worth it!!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant setting”
Reviews.Author: Mick10
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights prior to our wedding in Verona. On arrival we were upgraded to a junior suite which was a suprise, especially so, given we were only checking in at 11.30pm. The hotel and grounds itself are beautiful and peaceful. I am fussy when it comes to hotels and customer service. The reception staff, while friendly over the course of our stay were a bit cold, something you would not expect from a 5 star hotel. The shuttle service to San Marco square runs every 15 mins and is brilliant. Another great way to see Venice, free of charge! While the room rate was reasonable, ours did not include breakfeat. After our fist sitting, our breakfast for 2 cost â‚¬90. Overall 8/10.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: CyranoH
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel in March with my girlfriend who was soon to become my fiance(we got engaged on our second day there). I emailed the hotel in advance to make sure the room was in order. When we arrived to check in to our suprise they had upgraded the room to a suite. The staff overall where excellent from the conceirge to the breakfast waiting staff. I thought the location was ideal as Venice is very busy it is nice to get way from the hustle and bustle, the boat service is regular so you are never left stranded. If you arrive by air get a water taxi to the hotel, but agree the price first. this is a great way to see around the area.

Reviews.Title: “amazing!!”
Reviews.Author: Ratt
Reviews.Content: We are staying at the San Clemente at the moment, it is really fantastic, pure luxury. It is a mere 10 mins via luxurious private boat to St Marks Square. The hotel is on its own private island. The boats run from the hotel constantly and for free, we were never waiting longer than 3 minutes for one to leave or to go back to the island. The trip in itself is breathtaking and you can go back and forth as often as you like. After 1.30 at night you call and they send the boat especially to pick you up, no charge at all! It is so so quiet on your own private island at night, one of the main reasons we chose it over the Bauer or the Grand, no noisy nightlife whilst you are trying to sleep! They have a beautiful outdoor pool area with waiters to get cocktails all day and chairs with special shade covers so that you dont expose your face, v clever The breakfast is the best I have eaten in Italy, it is really good and they serve till 11.00 so you can relax over the yummy hot chocolate and crispy bacon. Our deluxe room is simply decadent and we love it so overall we have had a great trip, pity we leave in the morning but we will be back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “think twice before booking here!”
Reviews.Author: davidinNJ
Reviews.Content: This hotel is on an island, which might be great in the summer but is not ideal in the fall or winter. Imagine, you are in Venice, enjoying the glories of the city and then wait on a cold night on the dock for the launch but you discover that you just missed one and now have to wait 40 minutes for the next one. The hotel is lovely which gorgeous chandeliers. But and this is the concern, the service leaves a lot to be desired. For example, my son requested that his suit be pressed for a business meeting in Milan the next day. They lost the suit. After several hous, the suit was found but you guessed it --- it was not pressed. The arrangements for my son to get to the airport were not made . I spoke to the general manager but rather than satisfaction, I got a hard luck story about how hard it us to get reliable help. And to add insult to injury, I got extra charges on my American Express statement. I challenged the charges and after an investigation, they were dropped. Nothing should spoil Venice but this experience at the San Clemente did.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, but not terribly convenient”
Reviews.Author: lovetotravel212
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the San Clemente on July 30th and- probably because it was a Sunday- were pleasantly surprised to find that not only could we check in at 11am but also that we were given a complentary room upgrade. We do not have any preferential status with Turin Hotels, so this was entirely of their own doing. The room was stunning- extremely high cielings and luxurious linens. The room was very generously sized, and the bathroom was as well. The concierge took care of our wake-up call and water taxi arrangements to get us to the airport on time, and was very polite and professional as well as helpful. They offered to come to our room to get our luggage for us so we would not have to carry it down the hall. They also took care of bringing it to and from the little dock where their shuttle boat was parked. Overall, it was an excellent experience. I had only two minor "complaints"- (1) the pool closed early...we wanted to go for a swim but found out that it closed- I think it was 7pm, and it was still VERY hot out. Fortunately, our room was a very comfortably cool temperature. (2) It wasn't all that convenient getting to and from the hotel. We stayed close to St. Mark's Square when we were in Venice a week earlier, and it was much easier to come and go from that hotel. It was about 30 minutes to get to San Clemente from St. Mark's if you count the time you wait for the shuttle boat, take the trip out, and then walk from the dock to the hotel. Those are minor complaints though- I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, facilities, almost 5*, but...”
Reviews.Author: timbo59uk
Reviews.Content: Hotel has great location (on its own island) and facilities. Boat runs regularly every 20 minutes into St Mark's. It's a big hotel, and facilities are those of a 5*, but prices are too. We ate for my birthday at the Ca' Frati restaurant which should be a Michelin recommendation (but bring a small mortgage!). Service staff were friendly (vs other recent review here) and moved us to a better room nearer our children when a junior suite became available. Great swimming pool, and tennis court (but one of the two had a broken sagging net). Ate on a Sunday night at the Maschera restaurant, where the food was great but it took forever (maybe because of a lot of arrivals on the Sunday). Much quieter location than in Venice; mixture of people, from families with small children to old couples; quite a few Americans (is that good or bad?).

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: joejack
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four nights at the San Clemente Palace in Venice. It is a five star hotel with all the amenities. We loved the location, the pool and the boat ride to and from the hotel which ran every twenty minutes from St. Marks Square. The room was spotless and large. Our only critique is that once you are at the hotel, all items purchased are through the hotel and very expensive. You might want to buy snacks and refreshments to bring to the hotel. Also, make sure breakfast is included in the room price otherwise it is very expensive. We will stay there again. The price was right and the island it is on is beautiful..

Reviews.Title: “Beware of Ghosts!”
Reviews.Author: readingone
Reviews.Content: DO NOT STAY HERE!!! We (My husband, myself, 2 adult children checked in on Friday, 8/4/06 for 4 days. We paid for upgraded rooms but were given standard. We had to change from 1 room because the air did not work. It was 95 in the room. The very young manager told us the air was working!!! as if we were making it up. We are from Florida we usually don't complain about the heat. (We had to upgrade to a jr. suite because the hotel was overbooked but no allowance was made on our bill.) The second room had no hot water EVER and the kids showered in our rooms!!! The manager told us we didn't know what hot water was!!! Since we got there at 4:00pm on Friday and it took them almost three hours to fix the room situtation we had to eat in the American Bar since the restaurants were overbooked and could not seat us until 11:00pm. MISTAKE. We paid 18 euros each for a Caesar salad which was so gross that it was inedible. Then we paid an additional 25 euros each for almost a ham sandwich!!! We went back to our rooms to try to get on the internet to get out of there but there is no internet access in the rooms (even dial up). Downstairs there are 4 computers (3 dial up and one high speed with a backup line of people trying to get on!!!) We found out through the grapevine that the hotel had once been and INSANE ASYLUM FOR WOMEN!!! It made sense since the entire place is creepy. NOT LIKE THE PICTURES!!! There is NO artwork in any of the very long hallways only sound absorbing fabric. (My daughter said only the walls can hear your Scream!!!) The place smells like a hospital caffeteria. The doors have heavy duty bolts unlike anything I've ever seen and sensors on them so they know when you are in the room. It is like being under survelience all the time. The tennis courts are totally torn up so we couldn't play, one of the reasons I booked the hotel. The unexperienced manager talked to us and said he had never had complaints before us so we cut our losses, checked out and went to the Danelli. We had smaller, noiser rooms but there was no attitude and we had a much better time(Including hot water and air) Dante was refering to the San Clemete when he wrote the Inferno I'm sure!! We stayed for three weeks in Italy and never encountered anyplace like this. We are writing a formal letter of complaint to the Turin hotel company but I can't imagine what they would do since we would never stay in one of their hotels again!!! We have stayed in five star hotels around the world this is the worst hotel experience we have ever had. This is NOT A FIVE STAR HOTEL!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Heavenly, but...”
Reviews.Author: siriusreg
Reviews.Content: We had three nights, with my wife and my son, 7 years old, in the San Clemente in order to celebrate our tenth wedding birthday. I looked for a five star luxury hotel in Venice and the San Clemente seemed a very good deal, in comparison with the price of a (little) room at the Danieli or at the Gritti. Due to his situation, on an island in the lagoon, remote from the agitation of San Marco, the San Clemente is both very quiet and most cheaper than the others five star luxury hotels. In addition to that, I booked a package named â€œgourmet packageâ€� including the accommodation in a Deluxe room, breakfast, a bottle of prosecco in the room upon arrival, a dinner for two in the â€œle Maschereâ€� restaurant, a candlelight dinner for two in the gourmet restaurant â€œCa dei Fratiâ€� and free upgrade to the next category of room. I got the whole package for 1600 euros, which is a very good value for 3 nights in Venice in this hotel category. Every 20 minutes, the hotel boat, a little but luxurious and powerful wooden boat, picks up the guests for free at a peer near San Marco Square and bring you to the private San Clemente Island. This 10 minutes ride is a charming entry to your stay and it makes you feel special. At the arrival on the island, with its huge hotel and gardens, you are welcomed by a very professional staff. As promised, we were upgraded to a junior suite, which was large and very richly appointed. Unfortunately, at this point a few things happened which will make me temperate my appreciation: There was a temperature of 26 or 27Â°C (80Â°F) outside, which is rare in Venice in April and the air conditioning was not functioning. I asked about that at the reception and I had the strangest answer I ever received in a hotel: â€œYou understand, some people feel too warm, others feel two cold, so we prefer not allowing air conditioning nor heating in our rooms. But, if you want, I suggest you to open the window!â€� I stayed speechless and Iâ€™m still wondering if I wasnâ€™t dreaming???? There was not the promised Prosecco bottle in the room, and, when I asked at the reception, I got a: â€œHo, are you sure itâ€™s really included in the package? I will see itâ€� I never saw the Prosecco and didnâ€™t dare to ask for it a second time! The mini-bar in the room was not functioning but it was fixed an hour later. When I reserved at the concierge desk the table in the Ca Dei Frati restaurant, I asked for a special dessert with candles as a surprise for my wife and I received a: â€œof course but only for 2 people because we donâ€™t accept children in this restaurant!â€� Because I booked the package for 3 persons, because there is no indication of that on their website and because I had no intention to drown my son in the lagoon in order to have dinner with my wife, at this very moment, I began to loose my temper a little! After a phone call to the Maitre dâ€™ and the chief of cuisine, they finally accepted my son. After those little, but irritating, problems were solved, the hotel was really a dream: The breakfast buffet was huge and awesome, the room staff was very pampering and the dinner, especially at the â€œCa dei Fratiâ€� was excellent with a charming dÃ©cor and view, very good food, wine and service and the birthday cake with candles especially well designed. As a conclusion, the place, the room, the common parts, the dinner are idyllic, but there are a few things to fix in order to really feel in a â€œPalaceâ€�. Those things never happen in the Cipriani, if you can afford 3 times the price of the San Clementeâ€¦

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a proposal!”
Reviews.Author: LizM123
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the hotel for 2 nights in July during which he proposed! It was a perfect trip. We took the Alilaguna water bus from the airport to Piazza San Marco and got straight on the private boat to the hotel which was very welcome after the long journey. The swimming pool was divine in the hot weather - well maintained, towels provided and never too busy. We had a standard room which was cool and comfortable with a beautiful, large marble bathroom. Food and drinks in the hotel were expensive however our meal by the waterside at Le Maschere restaurant was one of the best I have ever had and was well worth it. Prices are high throughout Venice, however we found a couple of cheaper pizza restaurants near the Rialto Bridge. I would definitely (and already have) recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Grand location, building, ambience but.....”
Reviews.Author: skyfly04
Reviews.Content: We stayed here after reading reviews from trip advisor. We are very glad we booked. The hotel is set on its own island (no other properties on the island) just 10 gorgeous minutes from san marco in the hotel launch (very posey). A large and comfortable bar/pool area is great for getting away from the crowds of venice. Inside rooms are furnished very well. Beds are very very comfy and the air conditioning throughout the hotel is probably the best i've come across (so nice when you need to get out of the july heat). Bar, however, is soul-less and outside restaurant seemed very quiet on the nights we were here. Try the a la carte restaurant (at a price) for a superb 7 course set menu with wine (approx e350 for 2) with great view of the lagoon. Jacket required. Staff could be more appoachable...only reception seemed to know how to deal with guests. Recommended. BUT take a travel iron! we spent over e150 on our laundry during our stay. As you are a captive audience on the island the hotel's bar and food prices are high. bottle beer e10 cheeseburger and fries e20. Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Oasis”
Reviews.Author: lovetrav
Reviews.Content: We had a five night stay at the San Clemente Palace. As it happens this coincided with a heatwave making us even more grateful for the fine pool! We were delighted with our stay and consider this one of the best hotels we've been in, in almost every way. Rooms,reception/concierge services, buffet breakfast all first rate . We found breakfast in a courtyard in the shadow of a campanile particularly delightful. The boat service to San Marco is frequent, comfortable (in the a/c cabin) and punctual. Caveats: wouldn't recommend for first time visitors, on a short stay, who would want to be in the center of things. It is also less good a choice during the late fall and winter seasons. Otherwise: superb!

Reviews.Title: “Good but not Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Marcus2
Reviews.Content: There are plenty of things about this hotel that would justify a 5* rating. The building is imposing and the grounds well maintained. The pool area is beautiful and the bars, restaurants and lobby are fantastic in terms of their furnishings and presentation. Staff are generally very pleasant and the complimentary boat service is very very good in terms of promptness, frequency and comfort. But there are too many problems wih this hotel to allow me to just agree with some of the glowing reviews on this site. First off, I will just say that I took my partner away for a week to Venice for a romantic break, not a honeymoon or anniversary. Therefore I did not feel like the stay had to be absolutely perfect but in the end I was quite suprised at some of the fairly basic problems with this hotel. The corridors are indeed (as has been pointed out in some other reviews) cold and underfurnished. They have far too strong a resemblance to the corrdors of the mental hospital that formerly occupied this building. The lobby and communal areas are very well presented and furnished to a high standard. Why could the same not be done for the corridors? The answer is that, in a five star hotel, it should have been done. Our room was big but not huge. The bathroom was again big but the marble was of poor quality and the secondary shower did not work. There was heavy scuff marks on the skirting boards and the heavily obscured view of a tree laden courtyard was very, very disappointing. I realise that not all rooms can have lagoon views and would have been happy with a garden view. What I wasn't expecting was a great deal of daylight to be excluded from the room due to dense tree foliage being yards from the window. None of this is acceptable for what was a deluxe room at a five star resort . Nor was a smirking concierge, understaffed restaurants and bars and broken guest computers. With regard to the understaffing in the hotel bars and restaurants, I had a casual conversation with one of the barmen one night and asked him about the delays in service and foodin the day time. He informed me that the hotel seem to routinely place 1 or 2 staff in bars and cafes that require 3 or 4 staff to maintain an efficient service. They then still see fit to charge highly extravagant prices (even for Venice) for this poor service. He said that he felt it was unprofessional and was leaving at the end of this holiday season. This is not a bad hotel. It just has too many problems to make it an excellent one. You get the overwhelming impression of a paper thin 5* facade behind which there is not enough quality of service. That said, it does seem to be somewhat cheaper than similarly rated hotels.

Reviews.Title: “San Clemente was Top Notch”
Reviews.Author: travelernottourist
Reviews.Content: After researching many hotels in Venice, Italy, my husband and I decided on trying the San Clemente Palace. The rate we got for 2 nights in May was excellent for the quality of the room, services and grounds. We paid $335/night, which is for a 5 star experience not a bad price overall, especially for Venice. It was our 20 year anniversary so we had to splurge before our Med Cruise. Our room was for a standard double but it was hardly basic. The linens were luxurious. The draperies were velvet and sumptious over floor to ceiling windows. The marble bath is quite spacious with walk in shower and sunken tub. Separate toilet area - very nice amenities. Lots of closet space and room is large. I opened the windows and we caught a beautiful breeze from the surrounding water. We had a lovely corner room with a good view of part of the island and water. It was peaceful and quiet. Breakfast was excellent with a good selection of cold meats, cheeses, eggs, bacon or sausage, pastries, juices, rolls, coffee, etc. We took our breakfast out in the courtyard and enjoyed the ambiance. We ate one lunch at the poolside restaurant and it was quite good if straightforward. We enjoyed the convenience of the San Clemente's boat which was reliably available every 20 minutes every time we went down to catch it either at the hotel's dock or the pier near St. Mark's Square. Note: when we arrived to airport we found that there is a direct Allilaguna boat that runs directly from the airport pier to St. Mark's Square (no stops). This was I think 25 euro each vs. 10 euro each for the regular boat. For us, it was worth it because this direct boat was not crowded, very comfortable and far cheaper than taking a 100euro private taxi. Faster too without all the stops along the way. We were tired and wanted to get to the hotel. Also, this boat drops you off right next to the dock for...you guessed it, the San Clemente Palace hotel. This is a very special hotel; although expensive it is not as expensive as others more famous such as the Cipriani, Danieli and the like. I don't think anyone would be disappointed. We have stayed in many Ritz Carlton's and Four Seasons in the US and Mexico - this is on par and perhaps a little nicer than any of these other 5 star properties. Note: the photos on the hotel website are very accurate. The property is gorgeous. Funny though...every where we went Venetians pointed out just before property turned into a hotel, it was a mental hospital for women. They don't advertise that since more famous as a former monastery. I thought it was the perfect place for me...perhaps because I'm a crazy woman sometimes!

Reviews.Title: “Expensive, but worth it”
Reviews.Author: Principessaleah
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the San Clemente Palace for four nights in July, and had a wonderful time. The hotel is a former monastery and retains the grace and elegance of the original building. We stayed in a very nice room at the front of the hotel, looking out over the gardens and towards the bay. You could not see venice, but the view was still wonderful. The room itself was extremely luxurious, with a big and comfy bed, rich furnishings and a great marble bathroom. Each room is equipped with a tv which has a few english language channels, and apparently also has internet connections (though we had no call to use them during our trip). The toiletries provided were of excellent quality, and repeatedly replenished throughout our stay (sometimes twice a day). We had one problem, in that the air conditioning was not properly working on the first night. Given the heat in venice during july it made that night rather uncomfortable, but after some complaints to the reception the problem was fixed and the temperature was perfect for the rest of our stay. The other problem was that we arrived at the hotel rather late, having taken a water taxi direct from the airport. This meant that the kitchen had closed and we could not even get a snack at the hotel bar. We had to settle for room service which was fairly limited and extremely pricey. However, they were the only faults we could find. The breakfasts were delicious and extensive, the pool was very well maintained, clean and at a perfect temperature. The grounds were also lovely (though my boyfriend did complain that the gravel from the paths got into his sandals) and the old church was particularly beautiful. We didn't eat at any of the restaurants (apart from at breakfast) since we wanted to go into venice but one of the main restaurants is located just outside the church which always looked very romantic as we passed in the boat on our way to and from the hotel. The hotel boat is an excellent service, it runs every 20 minutes on the dot to and from St Marks Square (apart from after 11.20 when it starts running every 40 minutes). It takes about 15 minutes and although it can get fairly hot, standing out on the deck is very pleasant. The hotel is very peaceful and quiet (probably not great for party animals) even though there were plenty of kids about. It means that going into venice, which is absolutely heaving during july, isn't such a trial. However, it is a relief to get back to the peace and quiet, and air conditioning, of the hotel. Advice for venice would include not using the water bus to get to and from the airport. Water taxis are very expensive (about 100 euros) but well worth it. However, if you can't stretch that far then get a coach from the bus station. The water bus to the airport is a really unpleasant experience - you can't see out of the windows, you are sitting below sea level and it gets very hot and busy. Plus it takes about an hour, whereas the coach takes about 20 minutes.
