However, I would recommend using the water buses within venice, which are great fun and you get to see the sights of the grand canal without shelling out for a gondala. Wandering around the streets of venice is great fun. We didn't actually go into many museums because of the queues but the campanillo was good (particularly since the breeze was lovely and cooling), and we also went to the academia - full of medieval religious paintings and not much else. You have to search for restaurants that are anything out of the ordinary, but there are good value places out there which serve good food. All in all it was a wonderful trip. I would thoroughly recommend the san clemente for anyone who fancies a trip to venice, but would also like to enjoy some of the luxuries of a resort.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: we stayed here for 3 nights at the beginning of March - this is a great time to stay in Venice. This hotel, as far as we're concerned, is the only place to stay in Venice. the luxury and scale of the hotel provides a great respite from the narrow streets of venice. The hotel was extremely clean, the staff were friendly and helpful when required. The Breakfast, was ridiculous! - enough food to feed the whole of Venice = and catered for all tastes. The spa was also a great bonus to recover and rest our achey legs after all the walking. We will definitely return at some point in the future - there is nothing negative to say!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel for a honeymoon, with just a few caveats...”
Reviews.Author: The Diver
Reviews.Content: My freshly minted husband and I stayed at the San Clemente Palace for three nights during our wedding in Venice, Italy. We had obtained a good rate of 600 Euro/nite or so for a Classic Suite with Lagoon view. Here are the pluses and minuses (however tiny) of our stay at this hotel: The San Clemente Palace is really on its own island. It's fabulous if you want to get away from the maddening crowds of San Marco and the Grand Canal. There's nothing on the island but the hotel - a former convent - a mini golf course, a lovely abandoned church, and the parklike grounds. Absolutely beautiful, except humorous hubby remarked that it appeared slightly like a mental institution in the early 1900s. I've got to hand it to him for that one; the hotel does have that ''sanitarium'' look to it, at least exteriorwise. Also, the pool area is a bit barren, due to the landscaping being very recent and the trees still quite young and short. The common areas, however, are quite glamorous, yet discrete. Nothing overdone. Tastefully positioned antiques, Murano chandeliers, plenty of light. The restaurants are very appealingly done and I'd schedule a wedding here or a large scale public event any day. And, in fact, the San Pellegrino Cooking Cup was held at the hotel during "our" weekend. To the credit of the hotel, we only saw participants in the cup as they landed with the shuttle boat. Otherwise, we had the impression we were the only ones there. Our suite did have a view of the Lagoon, however, the vista of San Marco et al was quite small. The windows of the suite remain unaltered from their nunnery days and are on the small side positioned quite high up. There were no French windows or terrace doors, which limited the view when sitting down and looking out. The suite itself was extremely well planned; there was a large dressing room, a big hallway/anteroom, a huge livingroom and a big bedroom. Furnishings were elegant if a bit boring. What are Victorian armchairs doing in Venice? The room was in some way a little too "soothing" and without character. There could have been more paintings on the wall, more interesting antiques (or repros for all that matter) which would have given the suite more warmth and magic. Everything was simply "too beige" and too "institutional," even if elegant. The bathroom, curiously enough, only had one sink and was on the small side. Shower pressure was iffy. Toiletries were ETRO, not that great. Very perfumey, I wouldn't use them. I prefer natural products, even L'Occitane is better. Nevertheless, we liked it and since it was our wedding night plus, we were content and happy. What wasn't so great, which we soon found out, was that at this time, THERE IS NO BROADBAND OR WI-FI IN THE ROOMS. We were given some kind of modem number, but absolutely no information as to passwords, ISP or other technical info. When we complained to the concierge, he did this characteristical Italian shrug and told us to use the public computers - 3 of them for 200 rooms. We were watching them like hawks, and when some hogging teenagers finally got off, we pounced. We also discovered that the computers (the public ones had broadband and were very fast) were very much available in the mornings. Still, it's a detriment to such an elegant hotel. They couldn't tell us when wi-fi or broadband would become available. But this is typical of Italy. Some things work flawlessly, other things don't. We lived with it, anyhow, but it was a bit of a pain not having one's own laptop for access. As to the food, it was truly flawless. The breakfast buffet was very good and had a variety of items. We also had dinner at Ca' Dei Frati, their premier restaurant on the third floor, overlooking the lagoon. Truly splendid. We're hoping the chef gets a star in the Guide Michelin, because he's worth it. His preparation and execution was every bit as good as at Osteria da Fiore, where we ate our first night in Venice. They've got one star and I'd recommend them as well. Aside from the computer issues, the concierges at the San Clemente were extremely professional and helpful. I do speak Italian, so I don't know how they handle other languages. But it seems that they converse with equal ease in English, Spanish and French. They were very prompt in booking our restaurants, our wedding luncheon, faxing credit cards long before we got to the hotel, etc. Highly recommended. The spa is typical of a luxury hotel and the technician who gave me a body scrub was charming, spoke excellent English (she's from Brazil) and did a great job. I had her apply fake tan in addition to the services requested and she did it very well. Didn't charge anything extra and was very meticulous. As to the free shuttle to San Marco and back, it was prompt and a nice ride every time. Unless you're willing to wait the 20 minutes for the shuttle during daytime and every 40 minutes late at night, be prepared to shell out $80 plus for each time you want to leave or come back to the island. In three days, we ended up spending roughly $800 on just water taxi rides. We never did go on gondolas (and you can't to the hotel, it's much too far) because we were surrounded by the silence on our island and we didn't need any extra quiet riding the canals at night. But we walked the side streets and we noticed that the crowds didn't bother or stress us out, since our hotel was so quiet. The only time we saw people was during breakfast, but otherwise, it was free from noise. We'd recommend San Clemente Palace for an over-the-top wedding with loads of guests (we got married at the Palazzo Cavalli and had our FANTASTIC wedding luncheon with guests at Harry's Dolci on Isola Giudecca) or for those seeking solitude on their own. Yes, it seems paradoxical, but there was a wedding on the grounds and we only saw it in the distance...didn't hear one peep. The grounds are that big. If your taste runs to the more dramatic in terms of furnishings and style, you'll be disappointed. I'd suggest staying at the Danieli or the Cipriani Hotel with Palazzo Vendramin, also a fantastic hotel (but at twice the price) on Isola Giudecca. Will we go back to the San Clemente? Probably not. It was perfect for a wedding or a wedding night, but next time we'll probably for a suite at the Palazzo at the Bauer. More designer drama, plus you only get married once, right? At least to the same person...

Reviews.Title: “FIrst Honeymoon Stop”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned from our honeymoon and Venice, Italy was our first stop. We had decided to stay at the San Clemente Palace which is on its own Island. Well they have left an impression on both of us. I had done the research myself and came across this hotel....... that included A welcome at the docks when we arrived with someone there to take care of our luggage. The check in process was painless and since it was our honeymoon our room was phenomanally huge, plenty of space, buffet breakfast every morning included in our package, our gourmet dinner included in the package came with amazing food and the best service. The pool was beautiful and although there was only one day there.. It was a piece of relaxation that we enjoyed. Also, when they say that they provide taxi service every 20 minutes to San Marco Island there was not a minute delay with a nice looking water taxi. I must say that San Clemente Palace surpassed all of our expectations and made my husbands first stop and time in Italy a memorable one. We definitely intend on returning to this hotel in the near future. Thank you to the entire staff that helped me with my reservations to making our first honeymoon stop something we can not stop talking about.

Reviews.Title: “a sade hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: we stay tree nights in this hotel when we arrive our room was not ready et chech in at 5h30 pmno activities in the hotel all is cold and the saff limit the restaurent is not good my only congratulation is for the shuttle perfect not a good experience

Reviews.Title: “excellent place in summer”
Reviews.Author: Juergenbgelb
Reviews.Content: Stunning hotel on an island in the lagoon. There ist a boat service 3 times per hour from the hotel to san marcus (10-20 minutes depending weather the captain sticks to thr traffic rules)and retour which works as perfect and as punctually as a swiss railway! It is a quiet place to relax for a few hours when recovering from crowded venice. Especially the pool area is great if the weather is fine. We could enjoy it due to bad weather conditions only one afternoon. The other two days were cold an d humid and unfortunately the hotel was as well. Obviously italian hoteliers are as stubborn as german officials, they have their heating period and their none heating period regarless the temperature. We had two days in june cold and humid weather and some more temperature would have been fine. The breafast is good however they have this dammed american attitude "wait to be seated" (my american friends may forgive me) which i often experienced in former communistic eastern europe where grumpy kgb or stasi ladies let you to your table. With warm weather it is no problem, because the brakfast room is enlarged to the terasse. The rooms, we had only a standard rooms, are excellent well equipped and brand new and clean. Only the shower needs more pressure. The whole staff is very helpful and competent. Prices for venice are ok and the 5 star luxury classification is justified. In summer a clear recommendation.We will come again.

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel”
Reviews.Author: millie42
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a short stay at this hotel and would have loved to stay longer. Anyone in need of relaxation and pampering should escape to this hotel. It provides the perfect balance between easy access to the main tourist areas (by boat of course) and tranquility of the island and lying by the pool when the crowds become too much.The staff were wonderful. We ate in the downstairs restaurent and had excellent food and service without it feeling pretentious at all. Drinks are expensive but so is Venice generally. Also recommended is sitting outside and taking in the evening view in the restaurent nearest the Rialto bridge on the side furthest from San Marco- the waiters were great and so was the food. Unfortunately the water taxis were on strike during our visit so we did our sight seeing on foot. The back streets are excellent for wandering around at your own pace.This is a beautiful city, especially away from the crowds and we hope to return. We would return to the San Clemente without doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful - Magical”
Reviews.Author: Kellie18_10
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at San Clemente Palace, May 2006. This place is truely something from a dream. We are fortunate to stay in many lovely hotels throughout the world, this place is one of the best we have stayed. Our room was absolutely dreamy, but it comes at a price, but if you want to splash out this is the place to do it. The beds were comfortable, the bathrooms ultra modern and everything was finished in Venetian period style but not sacrificing any comfort. We found the service extremely helpful, unpretentious and tips for eating out were really very helpful, they really did look after us. The restaurant is really very good if you love seafood. I am almost in two frames of mind sharing my wonderful experience, sort of want to keep it a big secret so it doesn't become spoiled. I will definetely be coming back time and time again. I noticed people who rated this hotel quite badly in Tripadvisor, we must be talking about a different place, or they were incredibly rude to the staff, I was here for over 1 week and my friend recommended this place, no such problem. Impeccable. This is unrelated to the hotel, don't do the walking tour of Venice that the Tourist Centre sells tickets for, if you just want to wander aimlessly (some people do and Venice is the place to do it) do the 40 Euro p/p ticket tour, we didn't learn anything on this tour. If you want to learn generally about the history of Venice, get a tour guide that the Hotel can organise. Or stick with your guide book. Enjoy San Clemente.

Reviews.Title: “A Quiet Oasis!”
Reviews.Author: Bunnyllg
Reviews.Content: At the end of April 2006 we stayed at the San Clemente Palace for 4 nights. We took a water taxi from the airport and they must have radioed ahead because upon our arrival at the San Clemente palace there were Bellmen waiting to take our luggage inside and up to our rooms. Check in was flawless and all 3 room were graciously upgraded. What beautiful rooms! Large with extremely high ceilings, upholstered walls and yards of luxurious fabrics. The bathroom was large and well appointed. Murano sconces and lamps greated us with a warm glow. We never ate at the hotel for dinner, although the breakfast buffet was exceptional. The conceirge was the best we ever experienced and he recommended and made reservations in Venice each night. He was kind, courteous, and if he didn't know an answer he would call someone (even his wife!) to make sure our info was accurate. In the hustle and bustle of San Marco Square it was nice to get on the beautiful wood San Clemente launch with leather banquettes to be wisked away to tranquility. The spa was beautiful, and a friend's hot stone massage was well received. Our room rates, including breakfast, were reasonable. Drinks in the bar were quite expensive (but what in Venice isn't?) but service was excellent and afternoon drinks on the patio overlooking Venice and next to the hotel's 12th century church was special. I would stay at the San Clemente Palace again without reservation!

Reviews.Title: “The Most Gorgeous San Clemente Palace”
Reviews.Author: traveldiva10
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful hotel and it should be when it sits on its own island; that would probably be the negative as it takes 20 minutes to motor over to St. Marks Square each and every time you wish to go to and then of course 20 minutes back. The lovely little boats do operate every 20 minutes so there is never a wait and they are very prompt. The rooms are large and very roomy but the hotel is quite expensive; in particular the restaurants, which are very, very stuffy. Too much service and very pretentious. When we ate in their formal restaurant we were only one of 3 other couples the entire evening so therefore the waiters did not know what to do with themselves and they were all over us all evening long. There is really nothing to do on the Island of San Clemente other than use the pool or spa at the hotel. The action is in Venice proper.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels in the world!!!!”
Reviews.Author: karoxenia
Reviews.Content: We visited San Clemente Palace last December and we had a wonderful time. We found it extremly luxurius and relaxable. Usally Hotels in Venice offer very small guest rooms but in San Clemente the rooms are huge and very comfortable. We loved the marble bathroom, bed and linen. We were also impressed by the main bar of the hotel which was made by murano crystal. December is considerded to be low season and so we booked in a very good price (220 euro). Upon our arrival we were upgrated in a junior suite. We did not find San Clemente expensive. Compered to the prices in Venice, food and beverages in San Clemente are normal priced and moreover include better quality and service. Generally, we enjoyed every minute in the hotel, and we are thinking to go again for a relaxing and romantic weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Very Grande”
Reviews.Author: RudyKai
Reviews.Content: Our stay here was a 21st birthday surprise from my boyfriend, I was so excited as Venice is a very romantic city and could not wait for our gondola ride. On arrival I was not dissapointed and did not actually realise the hotel was on it's own island, the concierge were extremely helpful and even arranged a private visit to the venetian glass factory which there was no charge for, being guests at the palace. Our room was beautifully decorated and had beautiful views overlooking the lagoons and across to St Marks Square. The bathroom was very big, the only fault being a handheld shower which is the norm for Italy. We dined in there a la carte restaurant, on the top floor with brilliant views, we were treated like royalty and it was a dining experience we will never forget. Venice is very overpriced but if you are looking for somewhere special it is well worth it. Could not fault anything and would love to go back in the summer to enjoy the outdoor pool.

Reviews.Title: “very nice place but awful service”
Reviews.Author: perche
Reviews.Content: After booking the room on the web, my wife and I were very excited to stay in an island in a beautifull Palace with a great view to san Marco. But bad surprise when arrived at the hotel. We were actually very disappointed by the quality of service and a bit by the ambiance. Sure it is a majestuous and historical building, located in a unique place in Venise lagoon. But what a cold ambiance there ! Of course the building was initially a monestary, transformed afterward into an hospital. But the problem is elsewhere : spaces, corridors and rooms are definitely too big and ceilings too high to create a well-balanced and friendly p(a)lace. To be short, despite luxuous facilities and materials, the transformation of this former monestary into a palace is not very convincing. But the worst is the service. When we arrived, the A/C was out of order and the room was frozen. That can happen but you can expect from a 5-star hotel to find generally a solution within the day, by repairing the facilities or by proposing another equivalent room, or upgraded one sometimes for compensation. It was not at all the case. We had to wait two days to have another room and A/C has never been repaired despite several claims. Thus we were very upset. As reception desk didnt feel responsible at all, they did't appreciate our negative reaction and show it by saying first we hadn't to forget that we benefited from reduced fare by internet and second by refusing to provide services at the end of our stay (carrying luggage to the shuttle boat for example): incredible attitude from such a called Palace. Finally, I recommend this place for old and rich people only, who have paid the full price ! That said, Venise is a magic place, celebrating beauty and pleasure

Reviews.Title: “This must be the best hotel in the world.”
Reviews.Author: swissclive
Reviews.Content: This place is truly wonderful. I spent a perfect three days here with my girlfriend, during which time I proposed to her! Upon arrival in Venice, the hotel's own water taxi (which operates at any time of the day of night as we found out when returning from the opera in Verona at 3am) took us from St Marks Square and sped us to the tranquil island of San Clemente; it seemed like a million miles from the suffocating crowds of the city. Our first impression of the hotel was "wow"! Upon entering the building, the vast hallways and grand staircase show the splendour of the place. The staff, who were very patient with my attempts at Italian, (even though they spoke perfect English) were polite and throughout the stay, ever helpful. Our room, which was "standard", was anything but standard; it was lush! On the first night we dined in the hotel's own CÃ  dei Frati restaurant. I'm not sure if we were given the usual level of service, as there was only one other couple......but we had four waiters attending to our every need! Our seven course meal (yes, seven - it was meant to be four, but with all the complimentary add ons from the chef, it came to seven) was a wonderful experience in itself. After the meal, a walk around the gardens provided us with breathtaking moonlit views across the lagoon to Venice...........truly romantic. This place really is a palace, and we were made to feel like royalty. Thank you San Clemente - it was a part of our lives we'll never forget.

Reviews.Title: “Not too far from the Maddening Crowds”
Reviews.Author: haz2468
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a wonderful, relaxing,5 day stay at the San Clemente Palace, where we celebrated our 39th Wedding Anniversary and my 60th Birthday. Transport to the San Clemente Palace is via their private launch, which is moored almost next door to the Airport Shuttle. Once on the San Clemente jetty, you do not have to carry your luggage anymore.You and your bags are helped on to the boat and on arrival at the Hotel jetty there is someone there waiting with a luggage trolley to take your bags to your room. We were shown to our room and give a guided tour on the way, Champagne on Ice greeted us and the view overlooking the Lagoon and Venice was wonderful. Our room was very spacious and comfortable,a seperate large dressing room and a very luxurious large bathroom,complete with weighing scales, which we did not use except to weigh our luggage when we left! The Hotel is a very tranquil place and you are left to wander at your leisure, not rushed or pressurised to go on any tours etc, but the help and advice is there if you need it. Clean cool sheets and numerous fluffy towels every day, and everywhere spotlessly clean, The Chandeliers are stunning. Breakfast was excellent, with a large selection of everything you could think of, and we were greeted personally every morning. After a busy day walking around Venice, which is charming,but very busy, even in March,it was a luxury just to catch the boat back to the Hotel,no pushing or shoving as on the local boats the 10 minute journey, not too far from the maddening crowds, but far enough to let you unwind and relax or use the Spa before returning back to Venice. The boat leaves every 20 minutes, and I felt safe enough to travel on my own to go shopping in Venice once or twice. St Marks Sqauare is magical during the day and even more so at night when all lit up. We did eat a few times in Venice in the evening,but came to the conclusion that it was better value to eat at the Hotel. The food was excellent, no unseen cover charges, no added service charges,complimentary appertisers and small pastries from the Chef and the food was fresh and served in lovely peaceful surroundings by very courteous staff at all times. We had a very pleasant stay at San Clemente Palace and will most definitely stay there again,when next in Venice, until then, we will treasure our memories.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fabulous, highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: PH&LH
Reviews.Content: Fantastic 5* hotel. My wife and I stayed 3 days at the San Clemente Palace in March 2006 for our wedding anniversary. We had a great room with views back over the bay to St Marks Square Well appointed bedrooms with fabulous dÃ©cor, bathrooms with plenty of fluffy towels and bathrobes also complementary slippers. We also had a nice bottle of champagne in an ice bucket with the complements of the management - a nice touch! The rooms were spotlessly clean and the room service unobtrusive. Massively wide hotel corridors with chandeliers and elegant tapestryâ€™s on the walls. The location is ideal on its own island with a courtesy shuttle boat every 20 mins during the day from Piazza St Marco. The journey only takes 15 mins and is a very relaxing way to travel back to your room after the miles of walking around Venezia. The sauna & steam rooms along with the relaxing Jacuzzi was a god send to recharge our batteries and relax after a days sight seeing before dinner. Staff are very welcoming and friendly and couldnâ€™t do enough for us. Without doubt one of the best 5* hotels I have stayed in around the world and we will certainly be going back for more. I would highly recommend this hotel and the trip adviser was a great help in choosing this hotel. We have also booked 2 others from reading the comments on there site

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 3 day break in what literally can only be described as a "Palace". On arrival we were taken care of superbly, the Conceiarge was a great help and gave us great tips on what to do and what to avoid. We were upgraded on arrival to a Junior Suite which was fantastic, we had a view overlooking St Marks Square, the room was stunning and the exact of that on San Clemente's main website. Breakfast had a great selection including fresh fruits, cereals, Cakes/croissants, English Continental, the location of the hotel was in a good relaxing spot as you are away from the crowds of san marco, the boat to and from st marks square is around 10 minutes and provides excellent sightseeing on the way. Overall this is a fantastic hotel set in a beautiful location offering 5* service at its highest standard, already booked next years trip !

Reviews.Title: “Facility is fine but not 5 star standard service and details”
Reviews.Author: Hoteljunkiebunny
Reviews.Content: We stayed Jr Suite for 3 nights. Most of this reviewers were very lucky to be up graded to Jr Suite, or get a bottle of free champagne. So, all their review were good comments and I have chosen this hotel because of this good reviews and I was little bit disapointed for our stay. First of all, I did research the price on Hotel web-site and Leading Hotel's site which prices were little bit different for same type of room. In order to leave an evidence what I asked, I sent a fax to hotel and I got reply 5 days later, which is not a 5 star standard. Then I mentioned that your reply made me worried, then some hotel reservation staff said that they never received my fax to make a excuse. Their correspondance was the most slowest in my experience of 5 star hotels. For example, Santa Caterina Hotel in Amalfi reply within 1-2 hours and they try very hard to reply. Then when we arrived the hotel, door man at the pier was very friendly and welcoming, but at the front desk, the lady never smiled for 3 days even when we pass each other. This lady took us to the room and as I already read some review, she never explained serving time for breakfastand and the restaurant location in such a big place. (I think this is the basic explanation when you showing around the guest) So, I had to ask everything including where is the spa and fitness centre. All other 5 star hotel I have stayed were showed the facilities and opening time and I believe that the staff have never worked for 5 star hotel before so that they don't know how it should be. (sorry again Hotel Santa Caterina in Amalfi, all staff even cleaner and gardener never ignore you. they always greet and of course hotel front desk never missed whenever we pass and they always call our name and they are so friendly) I was mostly disapointed by the food in the evening, because everyone on this review said that it was good meal. Some of them were far too salty and not edible. Then there were hardly any meat in ragu pasta. My husband's meat was chewy and not tender how it should be. The couple next to our table were strongly complaining to the staff that their fish were very dry and hard. I am sure that they use frozen fish, not a local catch. If you love food and you think you are gourmet, don't eat there. You will get disapointed. There are more restaurants in Venice which serve more authentic food. The food in Hotel is really arranged for tourist and we were not happy about thier standard of quality. The room was beautiful, but since we booked Jr Suite, I thought I will get a separate lounge which other 5 star hotels normally provide, but just little bit bigger than normal room. However, cleaning ladies works very hard and everything was so clean,tidy and spotless. Concierge was great and very friendly. All of them are always greeting us with big smile and tried to help. They are the star. Shuttle service was excellent and we were very happy to chosen this hotel due to canal was very narrow and crowded. The hotel location is not bad as you think. Over all, the facility of hotel and rooms are great, but they need to know how 5 star hotel standard themselves.

Reviews.Title: “just Perfect”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just got back from the San Clemente and cannot praise the hotel highly enough. Like other writers we were delighted to be upgraded to a junior suite which was beautiful - tranquil, elegant and understated rather than sumptuous. the staff were attentive and friendly without being obtrusive or sycophantic. Large rooms, an enormous bed, high ceilings and the best bathroom I've ever used made it a truly memorable experience. However having read the other reviews am now only slightly disappointed not to receive champagne or chocolates for my birhtday! Everything else was perfect however - the boat ride across the lagoon to Venice every day a pleasure rather than a chore. Very good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Truly a palace”
Reviews.Author: MrsChoosy
Reviews.Content: This is the perfect hotel for Venice. It has a beautiful setting, with lagoon views all around. The decor is very Venetian, but in a modern, understated way. Everything is immaculate and we received faultless, friendly service throughout the hotel. The restaurant, La Maschere, was particularly good. We had a cocktail, 3 course meal, glass of wine and after dinner drink for a special price of 63 euros each. The room was huge, the bedlinen excellent (including a duvet) and the bathroom a luxurious showpiece. The private water taxi (every 40 minutes) worked very well and was always on time - a timetable is available at reception so you can plan your journeys. The low season price (January) was excellent value for money. I chose this hotel, having stayed in Venice previously in other hotels, after looking at TripAdvisor. I was definitely not disappointed. I would recommend this hotel unreservedly and cannot wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “Hermoso Palacete, Romantic and Mistirious”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I are frequent travelers, we have experience many wonderful hotels all over the world, but the San Clemente Palace it's a magic and romantic hotel with a great service and beautiful views of Venice, make ou feel your are in another era, misterious, mistic,romantic... a difficult place to forget!!! San Juan, Puerto Rico

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: DaveWapping
Reviews.Content: Stayed 13-15th January. We were upgraded free to a mini-suite which was beautiful. The hotel had a relaxed, regal atmosphere and was very peaceful and quiet in the evening. Dined in the restaurant La Masqua. Food was superb. All the staff were very helpful and very pleasant - organised the water taxi to the airport on the last day. The whole experience was first class and would definitely stay there again and would recommend it to all.

Reviews.Title: “A Very Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from the 31st December to 4th January. We'd booked a deluxe double and were upgraded to a Junior Suite. This had an amazing view across the lagoon to San Marco and on clear days we could see the Alps. The bed was very comfortable and we slept really well. Breakfast was fab. The buffet had everything you could want on it. The building itself is very impressive. The interior is truely elegant. Internet access in the lobby was useful. The staff are very keen to help. My luggage was lost by British Airways who were useless but Pierluigi, the Concierge, was so helpful in actually getting them to pull their finger out! He was charming and reassuring. The boat across to San Marco takes about 10 minutes. They are frequent and this was all part of the fun. It certainly wasn't an inconvenience, indeed it was good to feel we were escaping back to the island leaving the tourist chaos behind us. Finally, there are only 2 slightly negative things we would say: the restaurant /new years eve celebration they'd planned for guests are both over priced and secondly, the piped music in the bathrooms and guest areas was a bit too limited /festive - it seemed to be an endless Bing Crosby loop! Having visited Venice on several occassions the San Clemenete Palace is by far the best place to base yourself. In comparison with many other very good hotels we've stayed in this was one of the few that manage to get everything important right.

Reviews.Title: “The beautiful san clemente palace hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the san clemente on the 27th December for a christmas treat,and it certainly was. As we came off the awful water-bus from the airport,we suddenly noticed The san Clemente private boat awaiting for passengers to take them to this truly outstanding hotel,quite possibly the best hotel in the world. We arrived looking stunned at this beautiful place before our eyes,we were instantly upgraded to a suite for nothing extra,and the room size was huge. Breakfast was lovely though i must add do not take it in your room,as we got charged 49 euros for an egg and some fruit ( which was classed extra food) and 20 euros to have the breakfast in your room, which we thought was quite steep. Also the only sort of people that stayed at this hotel looked alot like royalty so don't even think about turning up in your jeans,this did make us feel a little out of place but you kind of get used to it. Having said that would definetly return, maid service and in general the whole service of the hotel was fantastic. Stayed half-board would like to see more of a variety of food next time but was still lovely, kind of felt a little embaressed of the hotel staff, they fell over backwards to please you especially at meal times in the morrocan themed restaraunt, someone was watching you to fill your water or wine glass every time you took a slip which made us laugh. Well enough said stay away from the loud and noisy san marco and give you and your partner that extra special treat, oh and venice was wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed in this hotel for a weekend, on arrival we were amazed by the service from every staff member. We paid for a duluxe room but when we arrived they upgraded us to a junior suite for free. The room was huge, clean and so perfect for a couple. The bathroom was def a 5* experience, his and her sinks, bath shower and sep toilet. The service was amazing and the massages were even better, id def reccommend this hotel to couples, and if you just want to get away from it all for 2 days. If you decide you want to go into St Marcs square, its just a shuttle boat ride away..The hotel offers a free boat that is clean reliable and fast..We had a pleasant experience at this hotel and would def reccommend it! if you want to ask me any questions feel free to email me

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic San Clemente Palace”
Reviews.Author: dsw187
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week in early October 2005 and would highly recommend the San Clemente Palace. First off, the hotel is located on its own island. This tranquil setting, with plenty of space, provides a real contrast to the busy and narrow streets in the main part of Venice. It was lovely to return to the hotel grounds each evening. Due to the hotel's location the only way to central Venice is by water. The hotel provides a free and reliable service 24 hours a day, running every 20 minutes most of the time. We really enjoyed the 15 minute journey each day to and from the hotel. The boat docks at the pier near San Marco, a convenient place. The views as you travel across the lagoon are great. Our room was a junior suite (ie a large room). It was tastefully furnished and there was plenty of space. The bathroom was very good. We were on the end of the hotel near the church, which gave us a great view across the lagoon back to Venice. One word of warning if you are staying in early autumn (and possibly late spring). Apparently, an Italian energy saving law does not allow the heating to be turned on until 15 October. Our room got very little direct sunlight and so was quite cold. We complained but were told, due to the law no heat could be provided. The staff were polite and sympathetic, but were constrained by the law. In the end we gave up the great view and moved to a room on the front of the hotel that got a lot more sun and so was much warmer. The hotel concierge desk was very helpful. They really know their stuff. We explained that we wanted to visit Murano (famous for glass blowing) and asked which trajetti/water buses to take. We found out that one of the glass manufacturers would send a water taxi to take directly from the hotel to Murano and back for free. (When we arrived there really was no obligation to buy and we could come back when we wanted, so could visit other places on Murano.) There are two restaurants in the hotel. The ground floor restaurant is very good. Ca dei Frati on the top floor, with lagoon view, is truly outstanding â€“ we were really impressed by the quality of food and standard of service. It definitely compares favourably to some of the best restaurants in London. There are 3 computers near reception with free internet access â€“ and one has a printer. Very useful and nice that there was no charge. One final tip, if you fly to Venice airport I would recommend taking a water taxi directly to the San Clemente. It is likely to be quicker than travelling into the centre of Venice and then getting the free boat to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Stay at the San Clemente Palace”
Reviews.Author: dhemmert
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a wonderful stay at the San Clemente Palace in Venice. The hotel is beautiful and on its own island. The hotel is only thing on the island, but it is a quick 10-minute boat ride on the free shuttle to San Marco square and all the hub bub of Venice. The shuttles leave back and forth every 20 mins (at least in offseason). You can also get a free shuttle to Murano, which we thought ended up being a "can't miss" activity. We were impressed with the staff, especially the concierge staff. The spa was good, but not particularly large. We were treated very well there by the staff. We also really enjoyed the food. We did NOT have any service issues at the morning breakfast that I read in some of the other reviews. All our meals were wonderful. We were upgraded to a suite and our room was impressive. The walk-in closet was large and very well organized. The bathroom was very large, also. In fact, our entire hotel room in Munich could have fit in this bathroom. The decore befitted what you expect from a place called "palace" including huge, wide corridors leading to the rooms, high ceilings, and such. The only Internet access was WebTV, which has a painful interface. But it was at least very cheap at 4 euros a day. Be forewarned that the taxi from public parking to the Palace is between 70 and 80 euros. We just paid it. But if you were motivated, you could take the public shuttle bus boat (that is easy to use and very cheap) to get to San Marco, and then from San Marco you can catch the free hotel shuttle.

Reviews.Title: “need to confirm in writing”
Reviews.Author: Robertrose
Reviews.Content: When booking our de-luxe room, my wife asked them to confirm that it had a lagoon view. The booking clerk confirmed it did. Unfortunaly when we got there we only had a view of the internal courtyard. The manager very rudely disputed they had agreed a lagoon view. It seems that most rooms face inwards to the courtyard. The main restaurant was extremely expensive, very pretentious and lacking in the usual good italian cooking. We got the impression that perhaps there had been some changes of management staff to the detriment of the guests. A very large, grand hotel, but lacking in friendly staff and character.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Palace”
Reviews.Author: HMo23
Reviews.Content: I am just back from a lovely week-end in venice. I choose the San Clemente Palace for a real Special occasion. Briefly I would recommend this Hotel for the following points : - really nice and 'antique' building - decoration (really snappy at least according to my taste, check the web site) - the spa - the view from the shuttle when you get to San Marco - the room (junior suite) Although I was slightly disappointed by: - the service. I had to insist heavily to get the personal to explain me where were the spa. Only after the third attempt I found a really nice concierge that walked me through. Furthermore I received no indication of the existence of this Spa on my arrival, no information on the breakfast time, the time I had to live the room on checkout day. - the shuttle to get to the hotel. Only every 20 mn (in November at least). So you better plan you walks well not to have to wait under the rain. But my girlfriend really enjoyed it. I am perhaps just too picky. But we stayed in the Marriot in Budapest and the 'customer experience' as much better.

Reviews.Title: “Stellar”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel in close proximity to St. Mark's Square. Very nice decor, food (breakfast was amazing, rapid service and regular, complimentary gondola service to St. Marks. One word of advice: you get the best deal booking directly with the hotel rather than American Express Platinum Travel. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “San Clemente for the squirrels...”
Reviews.Author: kachst
Reviews.Content: I work for a m ajor US airline and have travel a lot nad have stayed at many of the nicest hotels in the world. San Clemente was great on service, but for the size of this hotel I thought the room size was quite disappointing for the single traveler. The hotel I would not reccommend for a first time visitor as it is a 15 minute boat ride to where the resort is located (not to mention your time waiting for the boat). So it is quite inconvient if you want to stop at your hotel or your day can be spent traveling back and forth! Great if your just looking to kick back and relax on the hotel grounds, but there is NOTHING else here other than the hotel itself. The hotel itself is quite large and will have to hike 1/4 mile to get to the boat dock. Not to mention during my stay they would shut a majority of the lobby area lights off...needless to say for the American, I am NOT use to 5 star resorts shutting of their lighting fixtures! Also, the A/C system did not work and had to open the window for mosquitos to fly in ( I read this in another reveiw and did not believe it till expierenced). Also how they play up the monastary past versus the Hospital Islands past makes me laugh. The resort use to be a nut house- now you know why it is so calming out there. When you say San Clemente to the local Italians, they understand and smile =) If you are going to pay big bucks, stay where you don't need to be shuttled unless you plan to spend more time at the hotel than seeing Venice.

Reviews.Title: “A Delightful Haven”
Reviews.Author: Contessa
Reviews.Content: Best appreciated by seasoned travellers to Venice who will appreciate the calm this haven brings and to those who are prepared to do their research before they book a hotel. The web site states quite clearly that it is 15 minutes from San Marco and to us this was the most delightful way to approach the hubbub! There is no escaping the fact that the Island has been home to many things in former years but do your research before you go if you can't cope with history!! True the hotel is vast but we found staff to be helpful and obliging,the grounds a perfect retreat and views out from our room simply magical. Our room was comfortable and stylish with the wonderful luxury of being quiet! This was unique to us as we have stayed in Venice many times in some very exclusive places but noise from the busy waterways has always disturbed us. Our bathroom was excellent with an abundance of towels and toiletries by Etro. We felt really spoilt. Breakfast was exemplary and so was service. Certainly stay at Ca Maria Adele if that is what you want but to us the San Clemente gave us the best of both worlds at a very good price. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “A secluded island hotel close to San Marco”
Reviews.Author: SophieConcord
Reviews.Content: The San Clemente is a quick 10 min. wooden boat ride from San Marco Square and its ferry stop. The luxurious boat ride removes you from the hustle of central Venice to an old monastery-now luxury hotel. Loved the spa services of massage,pedicure with windows back to the city. Overpriced but good dinner menus. Beautiful breakfast buffet. Luxurious pure linen sheets and nice services. The long monastaic corridors aren't cozy, but the quality is good at San Clemente. If you want a rest from the hustle of sightseeing , this is a great spot to restore travel-weary souls. Close enough to see all of Venice after restoration.

Reviews.Title: “fab hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just arrived back from a 2 night break with 6 of our closest friends.Wow what a fantastic hotel,it was so luxurious and heavenly. Fantastic rooms, beds were so comfortable,everything was spotless .Staff were always courteous and friendly not one would pass you by without speaking to you.The boat service was fantastic and very reliable.We loved the little extra touches like the complimentary slippers and bottles of water at bedtime.Didn`t eat in any of the restaurants but the views from them were fantastic. Will defienately return again maybe try San Clemente in the summer and make use of the lovely outdoor pool and beautiful gardens.Highly recommended for a really extravagent get away from it all self indulgent treat!!!

Reviews.Title: “Enchanting San Clemente”
Reviews.Author: LARS6743
Reviews.Content: We went to Venice for 5 nights in September. The San Clemente was heavenly. We found the staff was exceptionally helpful. The front desk called our hotel in Rome- at no charge- when I noticed that I left some earrings behind in our room. An adapter was loaned within minutes. All questions were answered promptly and with great courtesy. The ride to Venice is a matter of personal preference. We loved being on the water for the trip into San Marco. To me, it was magical to approach the city from the water. We went to and from quite a bit. As a practical matter, you might as well learn from our mistake. The San Clemente shuttle is just to the west side of San Marco Plaza near the entrance to the Grand Canal. We arrived by train. Since we were spending a fortune at the hotel I thought taking the vaporetti for a few euros to the shuttle stop sounded like a good idea. It would have been if we had known that you really, really, really need to get one that goes to San Marco and not San Zaccaria which is on the far other side of the Plaza and two bridges away from the shuttle.

Reviews.Title: “give it a miss”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights after the very apologetic Ca Maria Adele e mailed shortly before our arrival to say there was a problem with the plumbing in the suite we'd booked so they had arranged for us to stay at the San Clemente for the same price. If you like huge characterless hotels with lots of marble and surly bar waiters you'll love it.It didn't help reading in the guide book that it was a converted "lunatic asylum". It was half empty but most of the guests appeared to be Americans waiting to get on a cruise. The 15 minute boat trip to get there from San Marco seems to me to miss the whole point of being in Venice. It was very disappointing - so much better to stay at the perfectly located chic Ca Maria Adele or characterful Flora and step straight out into this magical city.

Reviews.Title: “Service is Awful”
Reviews.Author: Sarah_WA
Reviews.Content: The "palace" is probably the most inhospitable place in Italy I have ever been. Do not stay here thinking you will be treated well. The service stinks. Unlike other four and five star hotels, like the Four Seasons where anything and everything you could ever want is responded to with an "Of course, Ms. Smith", at the "palace", the staff seems a little miffed to have to be acknowledging you AT ALL. Want to make a phone call? Good luck figuring it out. They aren't going to help. Worried about your luggage (delayed on a plane)? Don't dare ask the front desk, only the concierage should be asked; confused about whether breakfast is included? Again, don't ask because they will tell you that it is for 2 days in a row and then on the third present you with a bill for all three days (I'm not making this up). This rudeness holds true for the front desk staff, the concierage, and the manager. The random shop clerks, waiter, and maid were very pleasant. Perhaps it was because we booked a good deal on their website (350 Euros - gee, a cheap 500 bucks USD a night - instead of 500 euro during high high season). I do not know. Reading the Turin Hotels goal for "hospitality" makes me laugh, though. As other reviewers have noted, the shuttle service becomes irritating rather quickly. It takes 15 minutes to get to Piazza San Marco. Unless you want to pay 12 Euro for a coffee, 20 euro for desert/appetizer, and 20 Euro min. charge for ANY room service, you have to go into San Marco. Venice is expensive indeed, but a cappuccino in Piazza San Marco is 1.30 Euro at the bar, a far cry from San Clemente's prices. Another problem is that they turn off the A/C. If you are there when it is not extremely warm out, they shut down the whole air conditioning system and you must open the windows. The windows have no screens, and the mosquitos will buzz around in your room all night biting you and keeping you awake. That's some 5 star service there. Our friend's 3 star hotel on the Main part of Venice had air conditioning that worked all week. Also, we relied on his front desk/concierage for all of our questions regarding the phones and other basics about Venice. The only positive is that the rooms are really nice. Nice big beds, big baths, great design. They are all really new also. Not much Italian charm, though. I completely regret that I booked this hotel. I should have chosen the Hotel Bauer. Hotel Bauer is right off Piazza San Marco. Such a shame that we didn't stay there. I was really influenced by Trip Advisor naming San Clemente as the "number one" hotel in Venice. Just realize that rating is based on a bunch of Americans - every person staying there is American or Asian. None of the Europeans are staying at San Clemente. I think this says something along the lines of those who are really in the know stay somewhere else. If other people write later about how I must be crazy and the service is great, either Turin Hotels have switched out the whole hotel staff or the other reviewers are unduly impressed with front desk people in coat and tails. I'd rather have my questions answered than have the front desk staff looking daper in finery. We have traveled all over the world at some of the finest hotels in Europe, Asia, and the good ol' USA, and the "palace" is the worst for service ever. I felt bad for the line of Americans waiting for the shuttle as we left, poor suckers.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: ceelee
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a two week stay in Italy -- three wonderful nights of which were spent at San Clemente Palace. As many others have written, it is a gloriously lovely place to stay -- enhanced even more so for us I'm sure by the upgrade they gave us to a beautiful suite. I was ready to move in. The beds are very comfortable -- unlike some others we experienced at other 5* hotels in Italy. The rooms are beautifully decorated. I loved the bath and all the bath products -- if Venice wasn't so enticing I'm sure I could have spent most of my time in the bath tub. We didn't have a terrific view overlooking the water but I didn't mind -- we spent most of our time in Venice anyway. The boat trip from the hotel to San Marco is fun and a welcome break from all the hustle and bustle of Venice -- I was happy we weren't staying right in Venice and could get a break from all the activity and crowds. The 10 minute boat ride was an easy transition in both directions. The staff were wonderful. The concierge was especially helpful in pointing out good times to visit places like the Basilica, the Doge's palace, and the Guggenheim when we wouldn't be inundated with tours -- he was right too! He also made some very good recommendations for restaurants -- we liked one so well we went back twice. I read some reviews where people were disappointed with the buffet breakfast -- I thought it was great but, then, the only eggs I really like are scrambled so it was very ok with me that that was the only egg choice. We were eating so much for lunch and dinner anyway that I had to consciously limit myself from overeating at the buffet! We didn't eat at the restaurants at the hotel but we did spend one lovely early evening in the bar -- the seating choices are extremely comfortable, the staff friendly and attentive -- we stayed in the bar longer than we were planning to just because it was such a pleasant place to be. People who like a lot of activity and energy should take note that they may not feel as comfortable at San Clemente as others who really want peace and quiet -- it can be very, very quiet there. All in all, of the three 5* hotels we stayed in on the trip to Italy, San Clemente Palace was definitely the best.

Reviews.Title: “San Clemente - beautiful definetly not perfect”
Reviews.Author: tibbies
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend took me to San Clemente Palace for a 3 day weekend for our anniversay this past weekend. It is a beautiful hotel and we had a great time exploring Venice. It was my second time in Venice, his first. There are many positives of this hotel such as beautiful linens, generous bathroom amentities, high ceiling rooms,bathrobes that actually fit my boyfriend. He is a big guy and sometimes the hotel robes don't fit. and I loved the pillows, the suttle boat was also nicer than we expected. The negatives of the hotel are we did not think the staff were as great as other people had mentioned. Reasons being when we arrived at the airport the hotel clerk told us the suttle bus was no longer running this time at night and told us to take a water taxi. We chose the vaperreto and to our surprise there was the shuttle boat at St. Marks picking up people. What?! Why did the desk clerk tell us it had stopped we will never know?! Trying to make appts with the spa to book massages required persistence. We showed up and found noone there but 3 other couples also wanting information and looking around for someone to talk to. One man was walking around sweaty from a workout wondering where he could get a towel. After reapeated phone calls from my room I finally got through and the massages were great. The 2 women we met there were lovely, and gracious. (I just think they needed a full time receptionists to answer questions and book appts) Breakfast was pretty good but not a huge choice. Only 1 type of egg (scrambled) noone making omeletes - I'm not a huge breakfast person. We found the rooms to be quite cool. When we tried to increase the temperature it didn't work. I don't know why this is. The biggest thing I didn't like was the water presure and lack of really hot water in the room. I take very hot baths. The most I could get there was a warm bath. They give you bath foam but because of either the lack of temperature or pressure the foam never bubbled up. We were given a bottle of champagne in our room for our annivesary which was very nice, but it was sitting in a bucket of water by the time we got there - major delays at Schipol due to fog. As mentioned before the prices in the bar and room service are scandalous. Twenty euros for a club sandwich in the bar, eight euros for a non- alcoholic beer. Oh well we had an overall great time. I think I would try another hotel before coming back because being on the island does have disadvantages. The last day we booked our massages early afternoon (only time we could get). We were done by 4:30p.m. Our flight didn't leave until nine. We were trying to figure out if we go on the shuttle bus how long do we have in town before we had to come back retrieve our luggage and back on the shuttle and then the vaperrto. We ended up booking a water taxi so we can spend more time intown. All in all we had a great time though.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel but not perfect”
Reviews.Author: tibbiesBratislava
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I just came back from a 3 night stay at the San Clement Palace. We had a wonderful time in Venice celebrating our anniversay and thought the hotel was beautiful. We are Canadian expats living in Europe and have had the good luck to stay in some beautiful hotels. The positives are beautiful linens, wonderful amneties, loved the pillows and nice high ceiling rooms. The bathrobe even fit my boyfriend (he's a big guy!) and that is not always the case in hotels we have been in. We both got massages at the spa and found it relaxing and the 2 women we met were very gracious and charming. The negatives- we found the room to be quite cool and tried many times to increase the temperature with no luck. The water pressure is not great and we could never get really hot water for a bubble bath. I love a hot bath and they do give you bath foam but it never bubbled up do to low water pressure and lack of hot water. (Mind you I take very hot baths - probably hotter than most!) There also seem to be problem with the communicating with the front desk on arrival. We phoned from the airport around midnight Friday night and was told the shuttle ended at 11:00pm and we should take a water taxi. However reading on the Vencie forum we knew what a rip off they are. We ended up taking the vaperrto to St. Mark's square and lo and behold there is the shuttle from the hotel! Why did the desk clerk tell us it was no longer running at this time at night?! We have no idea! I don't know if they were short staffed but 3 times I went to the gift store and found it close twice. We visited the spa to make the massage appt and could not find anyone to help us - but did bump into 3 other couples also wanting to make appts and aks questions. One man was wandering around trying to find where he could find a towel. Then I asked the front of the hotel if they would try and phone - they did but got no answer. Eventually I did get through over the phone and made the appt. The women were gracious like I said but I think they need a full time receptionist there. We were given a bottle of champagne in our room for our anniversary - that was nice. We were late getting there due to fog in Amsterdam and the ice had turned to lukewarm water. Oh well- when it's a gift you don't want to complain. I have been to Vencie twice now and in the summer I could definetly see this hotel being a welcoming respite from the heat and crowds. However I would probaly like to try another hotel in Vencie before coming back to this one.

Reviews.Title: “Sensational”
Reviews.Author: JGRL
Reviews.Content: By far the best hotel we have stayed in in Venice. Half the price of the Cipriani. Great pool in the summer and service and food top rate. Concierge was best we have ever come accross and recommendations were excellent. Great to get away from the hustle of Venice and the boat trip in each time was an experience in itself. We took two children aged 5 and 11 who had a fantastice time. Thoroughly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Probably The Best Hotel in Italy”
Reviews.Author: BandM
Reviews.Content: Having travelled all over Italy, staying mainly in 5* hotels, I can honestly say this has got to be the best we've ever stayed in. We spent 7 nights there so had the chance to get a real flavour for the place, and it really was beyond expectations. The gardens are immaculate and so peaceful and tranquil after the bustle and crowds of Venice. The lounges, bar, and all the public areas are beautifully furnished and just ooze class and quality. We dined in le Maschere Restaurant on 5 of our 7 nights and found the food to be excellent, and on some occasions truly outstanding. On a couple of evenings we were given the option of dining on the outdoor terrace overlooking the lagoon, or in an inner courtyard, and each has its own special atmosphere. The only problem was that some of the dishes were quite elaborate, and, after 5 nights, the menu was a little repetitive, but there was no problem at all when we asked for a slight variation / simplification of a dish. (Hint 1: if you can pre-book your dinner inclusive / half board option with your tour operator this saves a small fortune as you can basically have any 3 course meal from the menu. To pay for some of the same dishes as you went along would have cost maybe 2 - 3 times as much) The shuttle service to and from St Mark's Square was brilliant: efficient, reliable and always on time. On sunny days, there really is no better way to arrive in Venice, and the mooring jetty is literally at the entrance to St Mark's Square. Whilst you can pay for internet access in your room, there's actually free unlimited internet access at three P.C booths situated around the bar area. We had notified the hotel in advance that we were celebrating a special occasion, and we were upgraded to a premier suite (Room 102) which was literally breathtaking, with its own lobby, double bathroom, full sized lounge, bedroom and dressing room. (Hint 2: it's also worth registering on their THI website to become a member, which is free of charge; this also gives automatic room upgrades, early check in, free newepapers etc). If we could find any fault at all it was that breakfast could be a bit hit and miss, and the selection probably not up to 5* standards. Similarly, the sunbeds around the pool and the toilets/changing rooms in the pool area were not as well maintained as at other hotels we have stayed in. Having said that, there is a lovely outdoor bar and restaurant where it's stunning to sit with a glass of prosecco as the sun goes down. Finally we pre-booked a range of treatments in the spa centre and they were outstanding, and no more expensive that in the UK. The hot stone therapy with Joanne was exceptional! This really is a special occasion hotel, and if you can manage to stay for more than a couple of days, you get the chance to combine both a relaxing "hotel" holiday with a city break and get the best of both worlds. We're already saving up for our return visit!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic The most beautiful hotel in Italy”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights in the nicest hotel I have ever been in. We have traveled Italy from Milan to Sicily several times and most every state in the USA, without a doubt this is the nicest . Bar and restaurant are pricey but it is only a few minute ride to Venice Square on their complementary shuttle launch. There the restaurants are in every price range. Would love to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just spend three days at the San Clemente Palace. It is a fantastic place to spend some quiet time in Venice ( which is very hard otherwise). We stayed at a smaller buidling ( behind the church) which was very cosy - although a little bit loud due to the boats passing by. The food was excellent - the pool magnificent - just the breakfast service was very chaotic. They couldnt remember Tee or Coffee? The forgot cups, plates etc. But besides that - everything was great - although very expensive. But thats Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Splendid & Fully Realized”
Reviews.Author: MrExecTraveler
Reviews.Content: Everything was perfect. Unlike Venice hotels (all of which are noisy and narrow due to their location), this 12 minute boat ride (beautiful and deluxe tenders) takes you to a private island (quiet) and spaciousness you cannot find in Venice proper. The staff - excellent. All amenities excellent. Room sizes amazing for Venice, food and beverage venues expensive (but based on location not a surprise) and, indeed, service is a little slow. But I find service "slow" throughout Europe. Service was totally focused on us and the delivery was the very best food and wines. Frankly, when you stay at this kind of hotel or eat in this kind of restaurant, if you are in a "hurry" you have chosen the wrong venue. The rich never rush, as they say. This hotel is fully realized, a genuine treat and one of the five best in the world, in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel in Venice”
Reviews.Author: seeanything
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights at the end of a two week trip across the French Riviera and through Italy, and found it to be the BEST retreat away from all the crowds as well as the BEST hotel we had stayed in. I have stayed in many 5 star hotels in the world and this definitely deserves 5+ stars. The concierges are of the highest caliber, the rooms luxurious, and the grounds beautiful and peaceful. Anyone going to Venice must stay here!

Reviews.Title: “The best ever.....!!”
Reviews.Author: lucym
Reviews.Content: The San Clemente Palace is the best hotel I have stopped in! The whole experience from start to finish was excellent, excellent, excellent!! The service from the staff was faultless. The hotel is stunning and we will definitely be returning for our 1st wedding anniversary! My wonderful other half proposed whilst there. Couldn't have asked for anything more perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good”
Reviews.Author: matt31
Reviews.Content: A very well run hotel. Excellent conceirge,first class room service. reliable shuttle. Excellent bedroom amenities. Only negative is the poor breakfast buffet. Maybe other reviewers are comparing it with other very poor offerings in Italy, but it is really pretty poor for a 5star deluxe hotel. The gym is a joke.

Reviews.Title: “Everyone must do this in there lifetime.”
Reviews.Author: waileagirl
Reviews.Content: I know they categorize this hotel as 5 star, however we believe it ranks in the 6 or 7 star category! What a wonderful place. First of all, arrive by private boat taxi and escort (arranged through the hotel), it is the best way to get there. The staff is so proffessional and pay attention to every detail. The palace itself in fabulous with venician glass, and damask fabric everywhere. The restaurants are first rate offering wonderful dinners. The breakfast buffet is the best we've had in Italy. Our room was a suite that was elegant in every detail. We really enjoyed the private boat taxi back and forth to San Marco square. We never had to wait more that 5 minutes, even late at night in the rain, they sent another boat immediately to service everyone. The conceirge is the best we've ever had as well. He paid extreme attention to detail and arranged a wonderful tour for us in Murano. We say forget the Gritti Palace, and the Cipriani, they have nothing on this place! This private 17 acre island is fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel in My entire Life of 5 star travel”
Reviews.Author: ONEILLCHRIS
Reviews.Content: This Hotel will fulfill your wildest dreams if you are a luxury hound, the hotel is not for those on a budget for sure, but if you love luxury you will love this. We booked a junior suite and we had a view across the bay facing a church. This is truly an island resort, thay have complimentary shuttle to and from san marco and murano. The Pool area is great, the lobby is great, the rooms were ample per euro style rooms. The grounds are out of a magazine, I have seen the Cipriani and at twice the price its not worth it. I have been travelling 5 star my whole life and this and the cavilieri in Rome are the best hotels I have ever enjoyed. But dont go on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “loved it”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: we spent 2 nights at the San Clemente Palace in late July '05. We found the shuttle service to and from the hotel to its dock reliable and usually prompt every 20 minutes or so. The shuttle boat took about 10 minutes and the dock was at a great location: very close to the Basilica de San Marco and wonderfull shopping. The hotel is classy, initially I thought the hallways were rather bare but I soon came to appreciate the monastic quality, spaciousness and the lack of heavy draperies and furnishings. The rooms were lovely, and spacious too, and immaculate. Housekeeping even placed a bookmark in the pages of a book I was reading. The attention to detail was impressive. The concierge and staff always helpful and polite. I like the free access to the internet near the lobby, and the fact that for 8Euro you could have internet acces for 24 hours in your room using the TV and a keyboard provided. The buffet breakfast included in our rate was scrumptious and classy, and I appreciated the fact that we were not nickel and dimed for any extra expenses....like breakfast or internet access. I liked the complimentary bottled water at bedside each night. I would definitely reccommend this hotel and will return to it if I visit Venice again. My teenagers loved it too.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel in Venice!”
Reviews.Author: PhillipDrummond
Reviews.Content: We stayed five nights at the San Clemente Palace Hotel July 25-30. We are very lucky indeed to have visited on four occasions in the period since its opening, when we contributed one of the first TripAdvisor reviews. Since then we have never ceased to marvel at the exceptionally high quality of this remarkable hotel. Most Venice guidebooks have still to catch up with it, but by our reckoning it is Veniceâ€™s best hotel on a number of counts. Its location is unbeatable. It occupies the totality of the tiny island of San Clemente, out in the lagoon, far from the summer crowds and heat of the city. It is still only less than 15 minutes away by one of the hotelâ€™s luxury launches, which operate an impeccable free service in and out of St. Markâ€™s every 20 or 40 minutes until late at night. This journey, down past San Giorgio Maggiore and the fading charms of the Cipriani Hotel, is a delight in itself. Once you are back at San Clemente, blissful peace and quiet takes over. Just now, in midsummer, the hotel was hardly crowded â€“ in winter it can be a wonderful place as it gets even quieter. The hotel is a former monastery, renovated and extended to the highest standards. Its hundreds of metres of massive, calming corridors maintain a miraculously constant level of air conditioning. It boasts a spectacular mirrored bar (â€˜Gli Specchiâ€™), a high quality regular restaurant (â€˜Le Maschereâ€™, currently with additional waterfront seating), and an exceptional haute cuisine restaurant, the â€˜Caâ€™ dei Fratiâ€™ (here the tasting menu, at 95 Euros, is phenomenal value in a highly over-priced city). The rooms are extremely comfortable, especially the bedding and the bathrooms, but if you can manage it you probably have to go up to Junior Suite/Suite standard to get the best quality. We suggest you donâ€™t take a room on the â€˜Ca dei Fratiâ€™ courtyard as we discovered on this visit that it suffers from the noise of early morning collections across the cobblestones and what seems to be the solid hum of a generator â€“ but when we complained the hotel immediately moved us to a quiet room at the front of the building. Right alongside the restaurant is a fascinating 12th Century church, which is undergoing renovation (a wonderful spot for a wedding!). Other facilities include a fabulous spa, a conference centre, an open air pool, a putting course, and delightfully wooded lawns with vantage points over the walls of the island to the lagoon and St. Markâ€™s. The multilingual staff are courteous, friendly, and extremely professional indeed. A wonderful hotel!

Reviews.Title: “stranded”
Reviews.Author: aurobindo
Reviews.Content: Impeccable rooms, generally good efficient service- trip ruined because of highly erratic shuttle service- we were stranded with two small children at 1.30 am - we had failed to notice a sign posted at the entrance to the hotel. Pool area and tennis courts a bonus- a little souless as other reviewers have suggested

Reviews.Title: “2nd stay even better”
Reviews.Author: rwdtgb
Reviews.Content: We stayed here before our June 7th Grand Princess cruise. We booked the hotel on our own and booked a mini suite. This was our 2nd time staying at this hotel , we were so impressed during our 1st stay a year ago when we decided to return to Venice the San Clemente Palace was the only hotel we looked into. Upon check-in we were upgraded to a suite and the staff and conceirge were just as fantastic during this stay. We tried the La Maschere restaurant again this trip and the food and service were 100%improved over last year. The only thing the hotel can improve on is the fact that the shuttle has to wait for other boats to unload at the dock in St Marks. It would be nice to see them secure a private slip like the hotel Cipriani.

Reviews.Title: “Isolation, huge hallways, good value-for-money, fun boat!”
Reviews.Author: k12dad
Reviews.Content: It is fun to ride the motorboat to the city! The location is very quiet and spacious. We loved the bar design and enjoyed our drinks there very much. The room was nice but not memorable in any way. It is possible that this hotel's size may accommodate very large groups. We saw a very large boat disgorging many new guests and the hotel marquee indicated a business group in residence. This could be an issue for restaurant service, bar, etc. I think that we would stay in Venezia proper for our next vist. Ciao

Reviews.Title: “Didn't want to come home”
Reviews.Author: pantonm
Reviews.Content: Wow!!! What can i say about this truly fabulous hotel. My fiancee and I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights and loved every minute of it. On arrival we were upgraded to a suite and i can say i've never had such a spacious and beautiful room. The staff were all friendly and helpful. The hotel was absoulutly immaculate. We found it the hotel to be peaceful and relaxing whilst only 15 mins boat ride, provided by San Clemente, to St Marks Square where you have all the tourists crowds. If you require a luxurious hotel then i would recommend this hotel. You could want for nothing.

Reviews.Title: “Everything i expected and more”
Reviews.Author: bedroom
Reviews.Content: Having planned a holiday to celebrate our silver wedding anniversary for nearly a year we decided on the San Clemente Palace based on all I had read. When we arrived it was fabulous and were given a beautiful room overlooking the lagoon. The staff could not have been more helpful and the hotel was really luxourious. We ate in their main restaurant on the night of our anniversary as part of our package and the meal was unforgetable. Really expensive but worth every penny for a special occassion. I felt like I had died and gone to heaven and found it very hard to leave after 5 days. Do try to visit here once in your lifetime. Just want to go back again. P.S. Do try to book directly with the hotel as they have some lovely packages and we found it much better value.

Reviews.Title: “Everyone should experience luxury like this at least once in a lifetime”
Reviews.Author: beachlvr123
Reviews.Content: I only started reading this website so my review is long overdue. With that said, the rooms are gorgeous, the staff is wonderful, the grounds are meticulously maintained and the shuttle to/from St. Marks timely and easy. . You will not be disappointed. Gritti Palace, Palace Il Baur and Danieli have NOTHING on San Clemente! Our Suite (upgraded at check-in) was very, very well appointed, great amenities, Prosecco, and fruit basket in our room large living room (bigger than my home), large tastefully decorated bedroom (none of the overdone glitz you will find at many other 5* in Italy).

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon At San Clemente”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Everything that has been written about this hotel is true. We have just returned from honeymoon where we were upgraded to a suite, champagne in the room and a dinner for 2 compliments of the hotel. The staff were excellent nothing was too much trouble. My only comment is 'you must stay here once in your life'.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfully romantic, a bit isolated”
Reviews.Author: feaves
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a 4 day stay at the San Clemente Palace in Venice. This was my first trip to Venice and was very excited. It is a bit off the main part of Venice, so you have to take a water taxi (supplied by the hotel). There usually is not too long a wait. The property itself was wonderful and quiet. The pool area was nice and relaxing. We found ourselves running back from Venice just to sit by the pool and enjoy the hotel. The staff was very kind, but almost robotic in some sense. They had all the requested taxis, etc for us at our requested time. The prices for the bar and the hotel were way out of sight, but they do have a captive audiance. The breakfast was just spectacular every morning, and the wait staff in the restaurants could not have been nicer. The hotel supplied free internet use, but the server seemed to be constantly down. There was also the issue of mosquitoes, which bit me from head to toe. Seeing the hotel is on its own island, this is something I did not think about until it was too late. All in all the hotel and property was wonderful. I would say that if you are willing to spend the money, staying closer at the Gritti Palace or the Cippriani would be better. The water taxi thing got old, really quickly. I would come back again when I was not more interested in seeing Venice, and just wanting to relax by the pool. But I would give good consideration to the expense of everthing.
