Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay - don't forget your Jacket!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently stayed at the San Clemente - it was truly phenomenal!! The hotel and all facilities are superb. Do eat at the main restaurant if you have the opportunity (please note: Jacket required for men dining. If you forget a jacket, like I did, you can 'borrow' their black number hanging in the back office - 1 size fits all, be warned!) Great wine, meat, deserts and overall food presentation. The chef is an up-and-coming star. The rooms were excellent, air conditioned, spacious and very comfortable. The hotel gym could do with a bit more weights and equipment and less of the exercise bikes, but that's just my opinion, so don't let it deter you! As for the pool outside..it was fantastic. West facing, so you get that great evening sun up until 7-8pm - perfect after a day in Venice. Poolside food and drinks are OK. However, the service could be a bit more flexible. We ordered a club sandwich at 5:02pm. We were refused as food stopped at 5pm. Having just spent close to Â£1,000 for a few days stay, I was really dissappointed that the chef or even a waiter could not make a sandwich of some description - I wasn't asking for much. How much time does it take to butter 2 bits of bread and chuck in some ham/lettuce and cheese?? The waiter had plenty of time to fill a bucket of water to tend to a poolside guest's thirsty dog, but not enough time to make me, a cash paying guest, a sandwich. What's that all about?? Anyway, its a great place to go. It gets v.full in May-June time, so book early. If you want Venice on your doorstep, but want to get away from the hussle and bussle in the evening, this is the place to go, no doubt about it.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Honey Moon Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: 9th - 13th May 2005 Wow, this hotel is simply amazing. It really is a 'Palace'. This is one of the only hotels that we have stayed in that has actually superceeded our expectations. On arrival, they congratulated us and greeted us as the 'New Mr & Mrs Truesdale' they then upgraded us into a suite on arrival with a bottle of champagne in our room. This absolutely made our honeymoon! The decor is so elegant, staff so polite and professional. The grounds are fabulous, and because the weather was so good, they opened up the pool area , which was bliss. The distance from the centre of Venice was absolutely no problem. The luxury shuttle service runs every 20 mins, in fact it was nice to leave the hussle and bustle and return to the peace and tranquility of the San Clemente Palace. We ate in the brasserie resteraunt on the first night, and although expensive, the food, wine and service was superb. You must try the cocktails in the American Bar - very good. Breakfast's were divine, with absolutely everything to choose from. There were a couple of families staying here with small children and it was so nice to see that the staff really enjoyed having a bit of fun with them. We would highly recomend this hotel to anyone - yes it is expensive, but it is a real treat. We had a look at a couple of the main hotels on the main land while we were there, but the San Clemente is by far the best in Venice. I hope that they do not change anything!!! Enjoy your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ruthiano
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the San Clemente in April for three nights. We got wonderful value at 185euros per night and had read the reviews here. This is by far the best hotel we have ever styed in italy. Magical location. Our room had sweeping views of the lagoon. The rooms are exceptionally comfortable with terrazzo floors and marble bathrooms. Breakfast was excellent and the staff were professional and courteous at all times. The concierge was invaluable . The motor launch which ferries you in and out of St. Marks square is perfect. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, rude restaurant service, no follow through”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is seriously over rated. Donâ€™t get me wrong it is elegant, clean and beautiful however we had problems from the very first minute. Our room was not ready as we requested. They only had one room left with two beds that had a view of the service entry. They gave me no discount for this lovely view of the â€œback of the houseâ€�. I had dinner in the restaurant and was treated very rudely by the head waiter. It was obvious we were troubling him and they were short staffed. I asked for a table that was not in front of the kitchen entry and was told everything was reserved. I told them thanks but no thanksâ€¦then they were able to accommodate us. We were only handed one menu as there was an apparent shortage of printed copies. I requested a second menu only to have to wait another 20 minutes and request it again. A few minutes later the head waiter simply approached me and said are you ready. He did not introduce himself nor explain the menuâ€¦I still did not have the second menu. In ordering my cocktail the waiter seemed rushed and was very short with me. I could see the staff was overwhelmed and everyone was running around with very unhappy faces. I was starving so I only ordered an entree. We ate and left as quickly as possibleâ€¦during our five night stay we never ate again at the hotelâ€¦except for the included breakfast. Also the tables the head waiter referred to never had guests on them for the entire 90 minutes we were in the restaurant. The thermostat in the room did not work and it was never fixed after phoning the reception on two separate days. Also the safe was locked by the previous guest and never opened during our stay. The front desk staff and concierge staff were friendly and helpful but not enough to compensate for the bad experiences. I was with a group and on the water taxi to the airport I quickly found we all had similar experiences. One of our group members went to the bar to ask for ice and the bartender went in the back to the ice machineâ€¦where waiters were drinking beersâ€¦and made a rude comment regarding my friendâ€¦which my friend overhead and confronted the bartender with. The bartender proceeded to make excuses. Be prepared for the beauty of the hotel and the rudeness. If you stay here make sure you get a GREAT rate and be prepared to complain.

Reviews.Title: “peaceful,luxurious setting”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Venice staying two nights at the San Clemente Palace. It was a very peaceful setting after the hustle and bustle of Venice on the weekend. The pool just opened and was a bit cold -took a dip anyway. The rooms are gorgeous-the bathrooms wonderfully large and beautiful. I loved the spa although I only took advantage of the jacuzzi and sauna. The massages wre all booked, so call in advance to reserve. The food is very expensive but the complimentary breakfast buffet is excellent. The shuttle is convenient as long as you are not in a rush! Would definately love to return!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, peaceful....”
Reviews.Author: ml3369
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a five day stay at the San Clemente. Lovely hotel, in a quiet, peaceful location. A good shuttle service runs from the island to San Marco. If you want to be in the thick of things, this isn't the place to be, but if you are looking for a quiet hotel, away from it all, then this fits the bill. Buying anything at the hotel - room service, bars, food - is horrendously expensive - they have a captive audience and they make sure they profit from it. A (small) cappucino was 6 euros, a (small) club sandwich 26 euros. We ate in Le Maschere which was quite disappointing - food was passable, but not special. Nothing vegetarian on the menu, and could only offer a very, very poor plate of pasta. So have deep pockets for the food and drink - but if you don't mind that, or avoid it, then the rest of the hotel is really very good indeed.

Reviews.Title: “A relaxing(!) time in Venice”
Reviews.Author: SkyeTraveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel during the last week of April, when the weather was perfect. The hotel upgraded us to one of their best suites (huge -- bigger than our London flat!), probably because we were among the few travelers who weren't part of a business conference or a tour group. It's hard to dislike a hotel when they've upgraded you. But even if they hadn't, we would still rank this hotel as one of the most memorable we've ever stayed in. First, the location. Riding the private water taxi to and from San Marco was incredible. We stayed four days, did the round-trip taxi ride twice every day -- and enjoyed it each time. The taxi was never late, the staff were always courteous. And who could ever tire of approaching San Marco from across the lagoon? Returning to San Clemente was such a relief after the crowds. When you stepped off the boat and into the hotel courtyard, you could hear birds singing. I never thought I'd describe any trip to Venice as relaxing, but that's exactly what it felt like. All the touristy craziness was within easy reach, should you wish to return to it. As I've said, we did the round trip twice every day, and it was no hassle at all. There seems to be disagreement among reviewers about the hotel's atmosphere. Yes, it hosts a lot of business conferences (there were several while we were there), but the conference building is separate from the main hotel. We never really saw the "suits" -- except when they were sneaking away, going to San Marco on the water taxi! The hotel apparently opted not to go super-Venice in its design. Instead, it went for a classic feel with only a few nods to Venetian things, like Murano glass chandeliers. That's fine with me; it gave the hotel an airy feel that contributed to the feeling of calm. And the buildings are by no means new. They were built in the nineteenth century (okay, new by Venetian standards, but not exactly built yesterday), and there's an interesting older chapel attached that's worth exploring. Since it was April, the pool wasn't open yet. But in the summer months, an outdoor pool and tennic courts are another nice touch that you don't get with most Venice hotels. Given what a great time we had, I think the price we paid (313 euros per night, including tax and breakfast) was a steal. The bellinis, at 15 euros each, were not such a great bargain. We grumbled a bit about that . . . then ordered them anyway! This hotel is fairly new; it opened in 2003. Its prices are still relatively low, but I'm sure they'll climb to match the Cipriani's, once the San Clemente's reputation becomes established. (THEN you'll wish you'd tried it out when its prices were still reasonable!)

Reviews.Title: “super hotel, no atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: mcgorr
Reviews.Content: A wonderful hotel set on its own 5 acre island. Every amenity is available, visually delightful with very helpful staff. Breakfast was extensive and could be rushed or leisurly. Our evening meal was superb. The only criticism is that it lacked atmposphere, it is extremely large but where were the people who inhabited those beautiful rooms? There was a free 15 minute boatride from near St Marks Square, but if I return I do believe I would stay somewhere more centrally situated.

Reviews.Title: “truly wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Derbyshire_fellow
Reviews.Content: Booked the hotel on the strength of the reviews on trip advisor and was not disappointed. It is a fantastic hotel and a wonderful peaceful haven away from the hustle and bustle of the streets of Venice. The service was impeccable and friendly. All the staff were courteous and could not do enough for you. The rooms, the views, the service, the location - perfect in every way!

Reviews.Title: “Class”
Reviews.Author: PORTHAETHWY
Reviews.Content: My husband booked this hotel as a treat for my 40th Birthday. It really does live up to all its glowing reviews. The staff are very attentive - making a point of remembering your name and helping to guide lost souls in the labyrinthian hallways. You could literally drive a double-decker bus down the corridors. When we arrived at the hotel, which was bedecked in fairy lights in preparation for Christmas (via the complimentary waterlaunch - which is regular as clockwork and makes you feel like a movie star) they upgraded our room to a suite. It was vast, with a marble bathroom and sumptuous fabrics. On the downside, they forgot to mention that there was a problem with the hot water - and having travelled for the best part of 12hours, it was a tad frustrating. No apology was offered. We ate in the hotel restaurant that night as we'd arrived fairly late. Expensive and not particularly good (but then Venice on the whole is disappointing when it comes to food). Whilst they offer great room rates (tip - book with the hotel direct, preferably by phone as they don't appear to have mastered email yet) they more than attempt to make up for it in the restaurants and bars. Having said that, this place oozes style and you can't fail to be impressed. Book now - as it won't be long before this place becomes established and their rates start reflecting their positon as one of the best hotels in the world.

Reviews.Title: “Peerless”
Reviews.Author: ceejayjay
Reviews.Content: We booked on basis of tripadvisor, and we couldn't have been more pleased with it. It was epic in every way. They were kind enough to upgrade us, and the Classic Suite was superb. The staff were unfailingly polite, and every single inch of the place was spotless. We visited the Cipriani for lunch ( lovely but expensive ) and the Danielli and neither compared to San Clemente let alone on price. Our last meal in Ca D'Frati was historic. A wonderful experience and we are already going back.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Service ever”
Reviews.Author: heitmann
Reviews.Content: This is by far the best Hotel we have ever stayed at. Every wish we had was fulfilled by t he staff. The boat shuttle service to San Marco was unbelievably ALWAYS on time and complimentory. The rooms was fantastic with the view of Venice. The two restaurants in the hotel were also 6 (six) stars. We hope to return.... Judy and Hans

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, but with some little problems...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I carefully read most of the reviews on this website about the major hotels and I chose San Clemente Palace because it seems to be the best choice. I started to contact the hotel at the end of January, waited for many days to get a reply for my question, and so on so forth...it took me one month and half to reserve my room. I thought that my e-mail account broke down, therefore I also tried to reach them from VeniceBy, and the result was the same, even the VeniceBy manager wrote to me to explain his sorry. Other hotels replied almost instantly, at least within two days, but San Clemente really took me a lot of time. So when I finally set up for Venice, I hope my waiting worths. It really is one of the best hotels I have ever stayed. My family loved it, and they swear they will come back one day. I guarantee that this was a very nice experience, and the price was good. But I have to remind all of you not to take the advised trip to Murano from the concierge. The staff "all" recommended us to go, and because of their helpfulness and friendliness showed, we decided to go on the boat they hired (it was said to be complimentary, and it really was a better option compared to Wter Bus). After we arrived, the manager of the factory came to welcome us, and took us to the factory, but the viewing of the making of the Murano glass only took ten minutes. Then he took us to the showroom and waited nearby to see if we need to buy anything. THat was our last day and we have already packed, so we did not expect to buy anymore things. But the atmosphere was pressing, it seems like we have to buy something in order to get back to San Marco. So we shopped, and found amazing prices. The manager told us Prince Charles and Princess Diana and Nicole Kidman and the Chairperson of the Chinese Communist came here (and the list goes on), and the price was certainly royal. Finally we came out with a 1150euros cup. All the glasses were beautiful, but we found similar stuff with a 1/5 price. So, go to Murano yourself if you have to. Except these little events, the staff were very nice, the breakfast was great, the room was spacious and everything was fantastic. So my advice is, reserve the hotel by phone and endure Italian accent, and skip the Murano trip they provide, and you shall have a wonderful holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Stay at the San Clemete Palace!”
Reviews.Author: SisterMoon_8
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the San Clemente Palace and were blown away by this incredible jewel of the Adriatic. I cannot say enough about this magical place! Those of you looking for true elegance, luxury, Venetian warmth and charm, yet at the same time crave peace and tranquility for true relaxation should seek no further than the tremendous and gorgeous halls of the San Clemente Palace. The service is first-rate, with knowledgeable, kind and helpful concierge's that go the extra mile for their guests. Our wish was their command! The rooms are lovely, luxurious and well appointed, with sweeping views of the Adriatic and the city of Venice across the Bay. The on-island restaurant is five star quality with incomparable service and delicious cuisine to rival any restaurant we ate at in the City. The buffet breakfast included in our room rates was among the finest I have had in my many trips to Europe. The shuttle service to Piazza San Marco is convenient and virtually at your disposal - it's almost as though you have your own private water taxi when you want to head into the City. You will find that the separation from the bustle and noise of the Venice is a wonderful luxury in and of itself. We all laughed when we saw our poor fellow travelers struggling with their luggage up and down the bridges of Venice bedraggedly looking for their hotels. For an extra fee, we were greeted at the train station with our own English-speaking guide and a porter who whisked us to our pardisical island with no fuss, no muss! This was worth every penny! The spa is also tremendous and not to be missed. The staff there are so accommodating and put you immediately at ease - my husband got the best haircut of his life here and we all had wonderful massages, steams and jacuzzis. My 17-year old neice, a very picky eater, was able to find whatever she wanted on the kid-friendly room service menu. Even she proclaimed that the San Clemente Palace was the best hotel we stayed at on our five-city tour of Italy! Venice stole my soul and when I and my family return to this breath-taking city, The San Clemente Palace will be our hotel of choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: martali
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Easter break in Venice, the San Clemente was not my first choice but booked late and this was best option. The hotel and staff are really good, I have stayed in some of the best hotels in the world and would say this would be high on my list of favourites. Booking late I got an incredible rate of 185 euros a night and expected to be put in a small room with no view, quite the opposite happened we were given a great room with walk in closet and a view over to St Marks Square. The service was impeccable from the concierge to the maids, our room was always made up when we left and we appreciated the note left at turndown giving the weather forecast for following day. The restaurants and bar were good and they make some mean cocktails, although as all of Venice overpriced. The only negative is as some other reviewers have mentioned the place does lack a certain atmosphere, you sometimes feel you are the only people in the hotel. This said we were quite happy as did not go to Venice to spend it with other people and the plus side is you get to leave the day trippers of St Marks behind.

Reviews.Title: “Live like a doge”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were treated like royalty from the moment we walked in. The private slip, the perfectly attired boat captain whisking you to the private island, the sumptuous grouds, and stunning interior all add up to a world-class experience. Don't miss the lavish breakfast on the outdoor terrace or a late-night bellini at the bar. The only downside is having to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Lacks Soul”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just got back from my first trip to Venice. Based on the recommnedations of this site, I picked the San Clemente Palace. As some others have recently said... it lacks soul... it's very, very, very big... it's beautifully decorated... but it's a bit of trip from San Marco to the hotel.. 10-15 minutes...the boat is very efficient... once you get to the hotel you are there... it really feels like a hospital.. the hotel staff for the most part were nice... they gave me a juinor suite upgrade... the room was massive... nice.. but no view...I would have preferred a view over a massive room... the bathroom area around the toilets had a funny smell... as big as the place is.. they like to store stuff in the stairway that guest are encouraged to use... the first thing you see when you get off the boat.. is this row of tented things, where they store their lawn equipment. and other items... again for as big as the place is.. you would think they could find a better place... the place needs warmth, a lovely outside bar/caffee people.. music.. something to give it a sense of life... it desparately needs a personality.....

Reviews.Title: “Mad about San Clemente”
Reviews.Author: Massimo_C
Reviews.Content: The San Clemente Palace is the yardstick by which other Venetian hotels should be judged by. It's the epitomy of elegance and style and is a destination in itself. It starts with the beautiful polished wooden speed boat which takes you back and forth to San Marco. The trip takes 10-15 minutes, a comfortable and enjoyable ride. It's not sea-sickness inducing I found: very low to the water and steady. Then there's the hotel itself, standing in lovely gardens on it's own island. Refreshing to stay somewhere so tranquil after the crowds of San Marco. The hotel is huge, but perfect. It sparkles. Our room was beautiful, well sized, with a lovely bathroom. We had a view of the water and Venice, but being far and hazy could not see much of the distance. We also had a view of the old, ornate church and some gardens, so our view was heavenly. Had the opportunity to explore the church at dusk, which I recommend. The hotel has it's own beauty spa: I had a divine facial there - it's top notch. Breakfast is grand, much better than most hotel breakfasts. Fresh and tasty, great scambled eggs, fresh fruit, Italian hams & cheeses etc (and the rest). Minor annoyances are so minor I would have to be nit picking (hair dryer isn't great, you cannot iron anything for yourself, only real movie options you have to pay for, like a lot of places). I did not like Venice much on my first trip. It's true it's too touristy, busy, dirty and expensive (food especially is hit and miss). However this time, I loved Venice despite all that. Its ancient canals, streets and buildings are amazing. How much of a difference hotel choice makes. If I go back, I don't want to stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Impressive but...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in mid March 2005. It was nice to stay at a modern, large hotel with all the amenities. Huge room, huge bathroom, all the luxuries. Yes, you will pay 7 Euros for a bottle of water from the mini bar. We loved the boat service to the main island. Definitely makes up for the location, and we never had to wait more than 10 minutes to go either to or from the hotel. However... before it was a hotel, it was a mental institution (at least that's what the hotel tour told us), and you can kind of tell. The large hallways and doors (you could see the lockdown bolts in our room door!), the institutional look to everything, and the imposing look it has from the outside kind of takes away from it. We would stay here again, but probably after we tried to stay somewhere on the main island along the canals. Not a bad rate in the off season, though.

Reviews.Title: “Do not miss out!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Oh what a hotel, Oh what a location, a private launch to you own island, fantastic garden area and courtyard, supurb food in the main resturaunt. We stayed for 3 days and had a wonderful time, spent a packet, but hey, if you want the best you have to pay for it. However, I left the hotel feeling like I got value for money. supurb experience, do not miss out! Seriously, this hotel is a gem, you will not be disappointed and your partner will remember the experiene and love you forever.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable!!”
Reviews.Author: Wicomico091705
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I just returned from a magnificent trip in Italy. Our stay at the San Clemente Palace was better than I could have ever imagined. The views from our room were incredible....sunsets every night were postcard quality. 24 hour boat transport between hotel & Venice was top notch. Concierge was an invaluable asset. Will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Havlat
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the San Clemente Palace based on reviews from this website, and have to say that we weren't disappointed. We did have some initial problems with our check in. Our room was not ready, and although I had requested an early check-in, our room was not ready even at time of normal check-in. This was not a great start to our stay here. Although the staff tried to accomodate us with a free cocktail. It seemed little compensation for keeping us an hour in the lobby. When we got our room, it was very nice, we had a view back towards Venice. The room was excellently decorated and very comfortable. The grounds of the hotel were immaculate and at times it seemed staff outnumbered guests 5 to 1. The boat was a little hard to find at first but like other reviewers had stated it was a great experience. The breakfast was the best we had in italy. Great food and so much of it. I would definetly stay at this hotel on my next trip to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Peace and Tranquility”
Reviews.Author: Billus
Reviews.Content: My wife and I visited Venice for her 50th Birthday,and part of the special treat was to arrive there on the Orient Express,everything you read about that experience is true!! We chose the San Clemente based purely on other reviews,we were not disappointed. I made a request earlier if possible to be upgraded,and on arrival we were duly upgraded to a junior suite overlooking the lagoon.Unfortunately both mornings we opened the curtains the island and surrounding water were shrouded in fog,but it was Venice in March! The hotel is superb, the room faultless,cleaning in the morning,turn-down in the evening,efficient. All the staff we came into contact with were very courteous and helpful. Our suite door was playing up,and I went to see Reception,before I arrived back at the room via the stairs and corridoors, we were on the third(top) floor, the maintenance man was there waiting for me,excellent. We pushed the boat out on our final night,and dined in the more exclusive of their restaurants situated on the third floor overlooking the Lido.My wife and I try to eat out as much as possible,and the meal that night was the best I have ever experienced. The food and service faultless,however the wallet took a serious bashing! Venice is not a cheap destination,and the prices within the hotel were expensive, but the whole experience was excellent,the cost became very secondary. A fantastic few days,sheer peace and tranquility.

Reviews.Title: “Hard to fault yet lacks a certain something”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: It is difficult not to give this hotel five stars. The service is superb, the location is very special. The one thing I believe it lacks is atmosphere. Venice, to me, is crumbling grandeur, old style magnificence, eerie fogs and dimly lit alleyways. The San Clemente Palace is decorated exquitistily but it lacks the atmosphere, charm and intimacy that many smaller hotels within Venice seem to have in abundance. For example Palazzo Abadezzo.. The rooms at the Clemente are of a generous size, the bathrooms are wonderful, but generally it is all just a little too clinical, too large and possibly too corporate for my tastes. That is just my personal opinion. I spend a fair deal of time travelling on business in large corporate hotels so in my spare time I really appreciate a smaller, more intimate setting. If you don't share my preference, I can believe that you would find the San Clemente absolutely perfect. As I said, it is very hard to fault. It jut lacks that certain something.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location - But beware the Pay Movies”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my wife a fortnight ago. We generally had a fantastic time. The location is an ocean (well lagoon) of tranquility after the hussle and bussle of Venice and as per other reviews the shuttle boats are charming and really add to the luxury of the whole experience. The rooms are nice and airy due to the (extremely) high ceilings and the enormous corridors and staircase add to the grandeur of the whole place. The breakfast was very good with a very wide selection considering the hotel seemed quite empty (we often had the breakfast room to ourselves) and the room service food was among the best I have experienced. Our only negative experience was when we tried to watch a film one evening after I'd exhausted my pregnant wife via another full day of sight-seeing. Unfortunately our TV was faulty. To cut a very long story short it took two and a half hours, three room changes and a couple of TV swaps before I completely lost my temper. To be fair at this point we were upgraded to a junior suite and received a bottle of bubbily but it was a shame we had to get to this stage. (Incidentally the movie still didn't work and stopped half way through the next night!) The whole TV experience almost lost the hotel a mark but ultimately the vast majority of the staff are great and I really can't imagine a better, more luxurious location to explore Venice. Next time I'll just read a book!

Reviews.Title: “Simply the best”
Reviews.Author: gwillis
Reviews.Content: I spent two lovely nights in this superb hotel (one offered by my amex centurion points) and have a splendid memory of it. Luxury and taste at the same time, and excellent service . The rooms was huge ,with lovely furniture. Unfortunately the restaurants were closed at the time I was there so I did not experience them,but I will surely do in my next trip to Venice

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: January 17th 2005 My husband and I just returned from a wonderful weekend in Venice, the San Clemente lived up to all the reviews...wonderful service, beautiful room with view of the lagoon, luxury bathroom with all the trimmings! Breakfast was great...lots of choice. We took advantage of their Winter in Venice promotion at Euro185 + tax per night including breakfast. Otherwise we couldn't have afforded to stay here. We went to the American bar on Friday evening to have a sandwich and coffee (club sandwich and coffee for two was Euro60.00). The boat to and from Venice is wonderful...you feel very special. As some of the other reviewers mentioned, the only complaint is the strange music piped in the lifts, bar etc. Not really in keeping with the rest of the atmosphere. I would love to stay here again, but need to start saving first!

Reviews.Title: “Great but expensive!”
Reviews.Author: juicyjules
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in May 2005 and it is as beautiful as everyone says, rooms and bathrooms are wonderfully luxurious, breakfast has a vast choice and service is excellent. We stayed for five days and my only negative comment that I dont think anyone else has mentioned, is the price of all food and drink in the hotel, this includes the pool bar, the restaurant and of course room service. I am talking 24â‚¬ for a sandwich, 19â‚¬ for a dessert, 20â‚¬ for a bowl of soup, â‚¬7 for a bottle of water, 10â‚¬ for a beer etc. Now while venice is famous for being overpriced I thought this was a little excessive and as you are on an island you cant just pop next door to somewhere cheaper but if money is no object this is your place!

Reviews.Title: “A luxury retreat in Venice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have just come back from San Clemente for New Year holidays and I agree the other reviews. The wood boat ride, the 17th c century monastery buildngs, the chuch, the large park, the size of the corridors, the elegant decor and colors and above all the scenic views on the lagoon, San Marco and the Dolomites Mountains ... all is quite amazing. Of course some details, as the bath water pressure or the welcome check-in, have to be improved but truly the service is very close to the best 5* European hotels. The room service is prompt and stylish. The evening turndown is done exactly on right time when you are out for dinner and the toileries are changed. The laundry service as well as the spa are handle by professional teams (ask for a facial treatment with Daniela). At the end of the main corridor (150m long...), the gastronomic restaurant casa del Frati worth itself a visit and it is today truly the best hotel restaurant in Venice (open for dinner only). And the rates are today moderate for Venice as it is a new hotel. If you like space, peace and impressive religious architecture it is the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic views, rooms good value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Ensure you pay extra for a lagoon view, its worth it. In the morning venice appears across the lagoon lit by early morning sun leaving a stunning backdrop of the dolomites in silhouette behind. The hotel is large and elegant with enormous corridors. We had a junior suite, which was reasonably sized and tastefully decorated with a marble bathroom (and amazingly large bottles of toiletries!). One thing to try is the 'taster' set dinner at their top restaurant Ca' dei Frati - 7 courses of excellent, original food, reasonably priced (for venice) at â‚¬90 and again with fantastic views of venice. It's only a little niggle but there's no-one to help you carry your cases from the motor launch to the hotel or show you to reception. Apart from that an excellent, quiet hotel situated on an island, 15 minute boat ride (free) off St. Marks and at the moment with reasonably priced rooms. The restaurant Bistro de venise in venice itself is well worth a visit - try the quail risotto. It's better to get a water taxi to the hotel, don't bother to book at the airport. Get the free bus to the water taci dock asap (it's a scramble to get one!) - although its â‚¬80 one way, it saves a lot of messing about and a great start to the holiday!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Kirstey
Reviews.Content: Location fantastic, beautiful public areas and room/bathroom and allows for a wonderful view of Venice as the boat (which is free and every 20 minutes) glides up to St Mark's Square. I would recommend this immaculate hotel without question.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent - can't fault it.”
Reviews.Author: Grendel666
Reviews.Content: We searched on the internet for quite some time to find a good hotel for our 10th Anniversary and we found this one and I'm really glad we decided to stay there. The hotel is fantastic and all the staff were very friendly and polite. The private island setting is very quiet and only a short private boat trip away from St Mark's Square. What more can I say? Book it, I'm sure you won't be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Superb facilities but not quite there (yet)”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: A beautiful oasis from the hustle and bustle with lots of nice touches (e.g. the lovely wooden launches shuttling you back and forth across the lagoon). The building is hugely impressive and the rooms stunning. However it is noticeable that the hotel has not been open long in that some of the staff didn't quite understand what is required by 5 star status. For example returning to our room one afternoon we encountered several kitchen staff sitting in the corridor outside our room smoking. This is clearly unacceptable, particularly as we had ordered a (non-smoking) junior suite to ensure we were in a nice part of the hotel. To give the hotel credit though, having pointed out this problem in passing to the concierge we returned to our room from dinner to find an apology and some complimentary refreshments from the duty manager. Another example was that upon returning from the (gorgeous) pool at about 6pm, the housekeeping staff turned up and asked if they could turn the room down for the evening when it was clear that not only was it very early to do so, but we were just about to shower and get ready to go out for the evening. It's just little touches like this that let the experience down a little. Having said this, most of the staff were excellent, in particular the concierge whose local knowledge of just about everything was boundless. We did have a fantastic time at this hotel and once all the staff are up to speed it's got to come close to being one of the better hotels in the world.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT MISS THIS HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: anglosaxon
Reviews.Content: We had previously read the previews and could not believe that all could be true, but believe me it was even better. Absolutely SUPERB from every angle. We were on honeymoon and had booked a junior suite - our package had been booked direct with the hotel and the price whilst expensive (although who cares when the service lives up to it) was extremely good when compared with other agents. Do not miss this hotel. Absolutely fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Don't visit during a conference!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, with great facilities. Can't fault the room or housekeeping services. Unfortunately the personal touch with the general staff was lacking. Very disappointed with Le Maschere restaurant, 185 euros for 3 courses and wine. The food was nicely presented but not nearly worth the price. No Wine list (very surprising) just a choice of 2 white or 1 red (very dry) French wine for 9 euros for half a glass! Definately reccomend that you eat elsewhere. All the restaurants were pretty pricey in the hotel and nothing special. If you want a good meal eat in Venice at the Grand Canal, Hotel Monaco. Wonderful, homemade pasta, beautiful view and great service. We were unlucky enough on our last day to be staying in the hotel whilst they had a couple of conferences going on. Breakfast was terrible, waited much too long for a hot drink and the food kept running out.

Reviews.Title: “Truly Superb hotel in a marvellous setting”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have just got back from a 3 night stay at this wonderful hotel. The trip was a treat for my mother's birthday so I was looking for something special, this hotel certainly doesn't disappoint. The short boat trip from St Mark's makes it even more enjoyable, you can feel the calm as soon as you step off the private launch at the hotel, every 20 minutes during the day means we never had to wait, forty minutes at night is no problem if you make allowances because it is worth the getting away from it all feeling and is a social trip to compare notes with other guests. We also made time to relax by the pool away from the afternoon heat which I would definitely recommend to recharge your batteries, stay an extra night to find the time! Unfortunately we didn't eat in the main restaurant during the evening but the food at lunchtime in the poolside restaurant was excellent. The staff cannot do enough to please. It would seem that the hotel have filled in on the small things (ref earlier review by another)- nibbles with drinks, bottled water at turn down etc. It is one of the coolest five stars I have stayed at. Can't wait to visit again. The price is good value and I can't see what the Cipriani can offer more for twice the price.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here for 3 nights in March 2004 and couldn't rate the hotel highly enough. Staff and service was excellent, rooms beautiful and the breakfast a gargantuan feast. No problem being away from the centre of Venice, the hotel was peaceful and the room quiet and very comfortable and using the boat to get into Venice itself part of the fun. We found an ant in our room the 2nd day - part of being on an island with earth and grass I imagine - but the reception staff moved us to another room without question whilst we were out for the day. Needless to say we were very pleased when we returned to find they had put us in a deluxe suite for our trouble. We would urge anyone staying here to check out the giant hot and cold tubs, fantastic after a day walking around Venice and the sauna/steam room were great too - although I did get told off by a naked German woman for wearing my bathing suite in there! The concierge was very helpful and recommended and organised our gondola trip from the stands just outside Harry's Bar. We paid the same price for 50 minutes as we had been quoted for 20 mins when asking the gondoliers themselves. Oh, and you must have a Bellini at Harry's Bar, touristy I know but the best I have ever tasted. Finally, I found the best deal for room price at the hotel group's website - thi hotels

HotelInfo.Name: San Clemente Palace Hotel & Resort
HotelInfo.Address: Isola di San Clemente 1, 30124 Venice, Italy
